　　问曰：何故得者有冷有热？答曰：足有三阴三阳，寒中三阳，所患必冷，暑中三阴，所患必热，故有表里冷热不同。热者治以冷药，冷者疗以热药，以意消息之。脾受阳毒即热顽，肾受阴湿即寒痹。
　　　　　论因脚气续生诸病

　　虽患脚气，不妨乳石动发，皆须服压石药疗之。夫因患脚气续生诸病者，则以诸药对之。或小便不利，则以猪苓、茯苓及诸利小便药治之；大便极坚者，则以五柔麻仁丸等治之；遍体肿满成水病者，则取治水方中诸治水之药治之。余皆仿此，更无拘忌。
　　　　　论须疗缓急

　　凡小觉病候有异，即须大怖畏，决意急治之，勿缓。气上入腹，或肿或不肿，胸胁逆满，气上肩息，急者死不　　旋踵，宽者数日必死，不可不急也。但看心下急，气喘不停，或自汗数出，或乍寒乍热，其脉促短而数，呕吐不止者皆死。[58p]

On the Differences of Cold and Heat

It is asked: Why do those who are afflicted experience both cold and heat? The answer is: The body has three yin and three yang. Among the cold are three yang, where the problem must be cold; among the heat are three yin, where the problem must be heat. Therefore, the manifestations of cold and heat differ internally and externally. Heat is treated with cold remedies, and cold is treated with heat remedies, according to one’s intentions. When the spleen suffers from yang poison, it manifests as stubborn heat; when the kidneys suffer from yin dampness, it manifests as cold stagnation.

On Diseases Following Beriberi

Though suffering from beriberi, one may still have issues with stones, which must be treated with pressing stone remedies. When diseases arise due to beriberi, various remedies can be applied. If there are difficulties with urination, then herbs like polyporus and poria, along with other diuretics, should be used for treatment; if bowel movements are extremely hard, then the Five Soft Hemp Seed Pills and similar remedies should be used; if the body is swollen and water retention occurs, then one should use remedies from the water treatment prescriptions. The same approach applies to other ailments, and there should be no restriction.

On the Urgency of Treatment

Whenever there is a slight abnormality in symptoms, one must be greatly alarmed and decisively treat it as a priority, without delay. If qi rises into the abdomen, whether it is swollen or not, the chest and sides may feel full, and qi rises to the shoulders; if it is urgent, death can occur in an instant, while a more moderate case may lead to death within several days. One cannot afford to delay. Signs of urgency include a rapid pulse, constant shortness of breath, instances of sweating, alternating chills and fever, persistent vomiting—all of which indicate a likely fatal outcome.[58p]

　　　　　论虚实可服药不可服药

　　凡脚气之疾，皆由气实而死，终无一人以服药致虚而殂。故脚气之人，皆不得大补，亦不可大泻，终不得畏虚，故预止汤不服也。如此者，皆死不治也。
　　　　　论看病问疾人

　　世间大有病人亲朋故旧交游来问疾，其人曾不经一事，未读一方，自骋了了，诈作明能，谈说异端，或言是虚，或言是实，或云是风，或云是蛊，或道是水，或石是痰，纷纭谬说，种种不同。破坏病人心意，不知孰是，迁延未定，时不待人，欻然致祸，各自散走。是故大须好人及好名医，识病深浅，探赜方书，博览古今，是事明解者看病，不尔大悞人事。窃悲其如此者众，故一一显析，具述病之由状，令后来病者读之，以自防备也。但有一状相应，则须依方急治，勿取外人言议，自贻忧悔，但详方意，愈人不难，莫信他言以自误也。余尝为人撰门冬煎，此方治脚气大有验，病者须急用之。[59p]

On the Efficacy of Medication: Real and Imagined

All cases of beriberi result from an excess of vital energy, leading to death; there has never been someone who died from taking medicine that caused deficiency. Therefore, those with beriberi should not receive excessive tonics, nor should they undergo drastic purging; ultimately, they need not fear deficiency, hence they should avoid preemptive herbal concoctions. Those who do otherwise tend to perish unheeded.

On the Examination of Patients and Inquiry into Illness

In the world, there are many patients whose friends and acquaintances come to inquire about their ailments, yet such individuals often lack practical experience and have never consulted a remedy. They claim to possess knowledge, misleadingly presenting themselves as experts and spouting erroneous theories; some say it is deficiency, others claim it is excess, some declare it is wind, while others assert it is sorcery; some attribute it to water or stone phlegm, presenting a myriad of fallacies and contradictions. This confuses the patient, leaving them uncertain, and as time is fleeting, disaster can strike suddenly, causing everyone to disperse. Therefore, it is crucial to have reputable individuals or esteemed doctors who understand the nuances of illness, explore remedies deeply, and possess a comprehensive understanding of historical and contemporary practices. Only those with clarity on these matters should examine patients; otherwise, it can lead to grave mistakes. I lament the many who fail in this regard, thus I seek to elucidate these matters clearly, providing detailed descriptions of ailments, enabling future patients to protect themselves. However, if any symptoms match, one must adhere to an appropriate remedy and not rely on the theories of outsiders, thereby inviting unnecessary distress and regret. By understanding the prescribed remedies, healing is not difficult; one must not trust misleading words that lead to self-deception. I have once prepared a decoction of winter cherry, which has proven effective for treating beriberi; patients must use it urgently.[59p]

　　　　　论脉候法

　　凡脚气虽复诊候多涂，而三部之脉，要须不违四时者为吉，其逆四时者勿治。余如《脉经》所说，此中不复具载。其人本黑瘦者易治，肥大肉厚赤白者难愈。黑人耐风湿，赤白不耐风，瘦人肉硬，肥人肉软，肉软则受疾至深，难愈也。
　　　　　论肿不肿

　　凡人久患脚气不自知别，于后因有他疾发动，治之得瘥，后直患呕吐而复脚弱，余为诊之，乃告为脚气。病者曰：某平生不患脚肿，何因名为脚气？不肯服汤。余医以为石发。狐疑之间，不过一旬而死。故脚气不得一向以肿为候，亦有肿者，有不肿者。其以小腹顽痹不仁者，脚多不肿。小腹顽痹，不过三五日，即令人呕吐者，名脚气入心。如此者，死在旦夕。凡患脚气到心，难治，以其肾水克心火故也。[60p]

On the Examination of Pulses

In cases of "flat-foot disease" (脚气), although many examinations and observations are made, it is vital that the three positions of the pulse do not contradict the four seasons in order to be auspicious; if they oppose the four seasons, do not treat. As mentioned in the "Pulse Classic," I shall not elaborate here. Those who are originally slender and dark are easier to treat, while those who are large, with thick flesh that is red or white, are difficult to cure. People with darker skin endure wind and dampness better, while those with red or white skin do not. Thin individuals have firm flesh, while fat individuals have soft flesh; soft flesh is more susceptible to deep-seated diseases which are harder to cure.

On Swelling and Non-Swelling

When a person suffers from "flat-foot disease" for a long time without recognizing it, and later develops another illness which resolves, they may then suffer from vomiting and weakened feet again. Upon diagnosis, I inform them they have flat-foot disease. The patient replies, "I have never suffered from swollen feet; why do you call it flat-foot?" They refuse to take the medicine. I regard it as a stone manifestation. In the midst of uncertainty, they die within a short period. Hence, flat-foot disease should not only be considered through swelling; there are cases with swelling and without swelling. Those who experience stubborn lower abdomen numbness often do not have swollen feet. Stubborn lower abdomen issues for merely three to five days can lead to vomiting, a condition termed "flat-foot invading the heart." Such cases are perilous and may result in death imminently. In general, when flat-foot disease reaches the heart, it is difficult to treat, as kidney water overcomes heart fire.[60p]

　　　　　论须慎不慎

　　凡脚气之病，极须慎房室、羊肉、牛肉、鱼、蒜、蕺菜、菘菜、蔓青、瓠子、酒、面、酥油、乳麋、猪、鸡、鹅、鸭，有方用鲤鱼头，此等并切禁，不得犯之，并忌大怒。惟得食粳粱、粟米、酱豉、葱、韭、薤、椒、姜、橘皮。又不得食诸生果子酸酢之食，犯者皆不可瘥。又大宜生牛乳，生栗子。
　　　　　论善能治者几日可瘥

　　凡脚气病枉死者众，略而言之有三种：一觉之伤晚，二骄狠恣傲，三狐疑不决。此三种，正当枉死之也。故世间诚无良医，虽有良医，而病人有性灵，堪受入者，更复鮮少。故虽有骐骥而不遇伯乐，虽有尼父而人莫之师，其为枉横，亦犹此也。今有病者，有受入性依法，使余治之，不过十日，可得永瘥矣。若无受入性者，亦不须为治。纵能治之，恐无瘥日也。非似脚气，诸病皆然。良药善言，触目可致，不可使人必服。法为信者施，不为疑者说。[61p]

On the Need for Caution

In the case of beriberi, one must be particularly cautious regarding sexual activity, mutton, beef, fish, garlic, shepherd’s purse, mustard greens, wild greens, bottle gourds, alcohol, flour, ghee, unpasteurized milk, pork, chicken, goose, and duck. It is advisable to use carp heads in prescribed treatments. All these should be strictly avoided, and one must also refrain from intense anger. Only acceptable foods are polished rice, corn, fermented soybeans, scallions, leeks, garlic chives, peppers, ginger, and orange peels. Additionally, sour fruits and foods must also be avoided; those who consume them cannot recover. Fresh cow's milk and raw chestnuts are highly recommended.

On the Duration of Recovery for Those Who Can Be Treated

Many people suffer fatal outcomes from beriberi, which can be categorized into three types: injury from sleeping late, arrogance and excessive pride, and doubt and indecision. These three conditions lead to certain death. Thus, it appears that there are genuinely no good doctors; even when good doctors exist, patients without the right disposition to accept treatment are quite rare. Just as a fine steed may go unrecognized by a wise trainer, and a talented mentor may find no one to teach, the same holds true for such illnesses.

Currently, for those who are ill and possess an appropriate disposition for acceptance, if I treat them, they can be cured in no more than ten days. However, for those without such a disposition, treatment is unnecessary. Even if it can be treated, recovery may never come. This principle applies not only to beriberi but to all diseases. Good medicine and wise words must be visibly appropriate; they cannot be forced upon anyone. Treatment should be given to those who have faith in it and not to the doubtful.[61p]

　　　　　论服汤药色目

　　风毒之气，入人体中，脉有三品，内外证候相似，但脉有灾耳。若脉浮大而缓，宜服续命汤两剂，应瘥。若风盛，宜作越婢汤，加白朮四两。若脉浮大紧转快，宜作竹沥汤。若病人脉微而弱，宜服风引汤。此人脉，多是因虚而得之。若大虚短气力乏，可其间作补汤，随病冷热而用之。若未愈，更服竹沥汤。若病人脉浮大而紧快，此是三品之中，最恶脉也。或沉细而快者，此脉正与浮大而紧者，同是恶脉。浮大者病在外，沉细者病在内，治亦不异，当消息以意耳。其形尚可，而手足未容至弱，数日之中，气上即便命终。[62p]

On the Prescription of Decoctions for Illnesses

The wind toxin enters the body, and there are three categories of pulse patterns. Internally and externally, the symptoms may appear similar, but the pulse will reveal the severity. If the pulse is floating, large, and slow, it is advisable to take two doses of the Sustaining Life Decoction, which should facilitate recovery. If the wind is strong, one should prepare the Decoction of Overcoming the Servant and add four liang of white atractylodes. If the pulse is floating, large, tight, and starts to quicken, the Bamboo Juice Decoction should be made. If the patient has a pulse that is weak and thin, the Wind Guiding Decoction is appropriate. This type of pulse is often due to deficiency. If there is severe deficiency with shortness of breath and lack of strength, one may prescribe a nourishing decoction in accordance with the temperature of the illness. If not yet recovered, the Bamboo Juice Decoction should still be administered. If the patient has a floating, large, and rapid pulse, this is the most severe among the three pulse categories. Alternatively, if the pulse is deep, thin, and rapid, it is equally a dreadful pulse. A floating, large pulse indicates an external illness, while a deep, thin one indicates an internal ailment; treatment methods do not differ, and one must be attentive to the pulse's indications. The appearance may still be acceptable, yet if the hands and feet remain weak, the life force may diminish rapidly, and within a few days, there could be a fatal outcome.[62p]

如此之脉，往往有人得之，无一存者，急服竹沥汤，日服一剂，切要汤势常令相及，勿令半日之中，空无汤也。此汤竹沥多，服之若不极热，辄停在胸心，更为人患。每服当使极热，若服竹沥汤得下者，必佳也。若已服三剂竹沥汤，病及脉势未折，而苦胀满，可以大鳖甲汤下之。汤势尽而不得下，可以丸药助汤令下。后更服竹沥汤，趣令脉势折，气息料理便停，服三十二物八风散佳。又初得病，便摩野葛膏，日再，顽痹脚弱都愈乃止。若服竹沥汤，脉势折如未病时，气力转胜，脚故未能行，体力充足，然后渐微行步。病重者瘥后半年，始能人扶行耳。[63p]

In such a condition, there are often those who may experience it, yet none survive. It is imperative to urgently take Zhuli Decoction, consuming one dose daily, ensuring that the decoction is constantly available without a gap of half a day without it. This decoction has a high content of bamboo leaf juice; if taken when less than very hot, it will remain in the heart and cause further harm. Each time, it must be taken extremely hot. If the Zhuli Decoction induces a downward effect, it is certainly beneficial. If after taking three doses of Zhuli Decoction the pulse remains unchanged and there is severe bloating, one can use a large turtle shell decoction to induce a downward action. If the decoction is exhausted and does not induce movement, one can use pill medicine to assist the decoction in this regard. Subsequently, continue taking Zhuli Decoction to ensure the pulse is weakened and to stabilize the breath before stopping. One may then take the Thirty-Two Description of Eight Winds powder. Furthermore, at the onset of the illness, one should apply wild kudzu paste twice daily; this will alleviate stubborn numbness and weakness in the legs. If having consumed Zhulii Decoction, the pulse weakens as if in health, and strength gradually increases yet the legs are still unable to move, one should eventually begin to take small steps. In severe cases, after recovery, it may take half a year before one can walk with assistance.[63p]

既觉脉及体内瘥，但当勤服八风散，勿以脚未能行，轻加余治，余治未必全得益，更生诸恶，失此诸治也。猥人边亦勿行野葛膏。有人闻竹沥汤云恐伤腰脚者，即与勿治。宜知此法，此皆人无受入性，不可与医故也。不为疑者说，此之谓也。竹沥汤有三首，轻者服前方，重者以次第服后方。此风毒乃相注易，病人宜将空缺服小金牙散，以少许涂鼻孔耳门，病困人及新亡人、喜易人、强健人宜将服之，亦以涂耳鼻乃可。临近亡人及视疾者，绛囊带一方寸匕，男左女右臂此散毒。服宜从少为始。[64p]

Once the pulse and body feel healed, one should diligently take the Eight Winds Powder. Do not treat lightly just because the feet cannot walk; such light treatments may not bring full benefits and can lead to worse conditions, thus losing the effectiveness of the treatments. Do not hastily apply wild kudzu paste on the edges either. If someone hears about Bamboo Sap Decoction and fears it may harm the waist or feet, do not administer it. It is important to understand this method; it is not suitable for everyone, and thus should not be given indiscriminately. This caution is to clarify misunderstandings.

Bamboo Sap Decoction has three variations: for mild cases, take the initial method; for severe cases, follow with the later method progressively. This wind toxin can easily infiltrate, so patients should take the Small Golden Tooth Powder in empty doses and apply a little in the nostrils and ears. Those who are weak, recently deceased, overly sensitive, or strong should also take it and apply it to the ears and nostrils. Those near the deceased or observing the sick should carry a small dagger in a red pouch; males on the left arm and females on the right, to counteract toxins. It is advised to start with a small dose.[64p]

病人惟宜饮赤小豆饮，冬服侧子金牙酒、续命汤。治风毒病，初得似时行毒病，而脉浮缓终不变，快者不治，或数日而死，或十日而死。或得便不识人，或发黄，或发斑，或目赤，或下部穿烂者，此最急，得之即先服续命汤一剂，并服葛根汤、麻黄汤下之。若此不折，更与续命汤两三剂必瘥。此病大急，常令汤势相接，不可使半日缺汤，不然，即便杀人。夫脚气之病，先起岭南，稍来江东亦有得之者。其证或微觉疼痹，或两胫肿满，或行起濇弱，或上入腹不仁，或时冷热，小便秘濇，喘息，气上冲咽喉，气急欲死，食呕不下，气上逆者，皆其候也。若觉此证，先与犀角旋覆花汤。[65p]

Patients should drink adzuki bean tea and, in winter, take Cezi Golden Tooth Wine and Xuming Decoction. This is for treating wind toxin illnesses, which initially appear similar to seasonal epidemic diseases; however, the pulse remains floating and weak without change. Those who feel better should not be treated, as some may die within a few days or in ten days. Symptoms may include confusion, jaundice, rash, red eyes, or severe necrosis in the lower body. This is urgent; upon diagnosis, administer Xuming Decoction immediately, followed by Ge Gen Decoction and Ma Huang Decoction. If this does not yield results, continue with two or three more doses of Xuming Decoction, which will certainly lead to recovery. This illness is extremely critical, and one must ensure the medicinal broth continues without interruption for even half a day; otherwise, it could be fatal. The disease known as "foot qi" originated in Lingnan and can also be found in Jiangdong. Symptoms may include slight feelings of pain or numbness, swelling of the legs, weakness when walking, numbness radiating to the abdomen, alternating sensations of heat and cold, difficulty urinating resulting in urgency or congestion, shortness of breath, a feeling of suffocation in the throat, and an inability to eat due to nausea. If these symptoms are present, first administer Xijiao Xuanshu Hua Decoction.[65p]

　　　　活人书 【宋　朱肱】

　　　　　脚气

　　伤寒只传足经，不传手经。地之寒暑风湿，皆作蒸气，足常履之，遂成脚气，所以病证与伤寒相近。其脉浮而弦者起于风，濡而弱者起于湿，洪而数者起于热，迟而濇者起于寒。风者汗而愈，湿者温而愈，热者下而愈，寒者熨而愈。脚气之病，始得不觉，因他病乃知。毒气入心，则小腹顽痹不仁，令人呕吐，死在朝夕矣。然终是与伤寒不同者，孙真人云：卒起脚屈弱不能转动，有此为异耳。要之，有脚气之人，先从脚起，或先缓弱疼痹，寒气胜者为痛痹，有寒故痛也；或行起忽倒，或两胫肿痛，亦有不肿者；或脚膝枯细，或心中忪悸，或小腹不仁。盖病久入深，荣卫之行濇，皮肤不荣，故为不仁。不仁者，皮顽不知有无也。[66p]

Human Health Manual
[Song Dynasty] Zhu Gong

Athlete's Foot

Cold-induced illnesses primarily affect the feet rather than the hands. The cold, heat, dampness, and wind of the earth create steaming vapors; frequent exposure to these elements leads to athlete's foot, causing its symptoms to resemble those of a cold. The pulse tends to be floating and string-like due to wind, moist and weak from dampness, surging and rapid from heat, and slow and thin from cold. For wind-related issues, sweating is the remedy; for dampness, warmth is needed; for heat, purging is beneficial; and for cold, applying heat helps.

The onset of athlete's foot can be subtle and is often recognized only due to other illnesses. Toxic energy entering the heart leads to numbness in the lower abdomen, causing vomiting, which can be lethal rapidly. However, it remains distinct from colds; as Master Sun noted: a sudden weakness in the feet that prevents movement signifies this difference.

In summary, individuals with athlete's foot typically experience symptoms starting from the feet, which may first present as mild weakness or pain, with pain resulting from excessive cold, leading to a painful sensation. Sometimes, individuals may suddenly collapse while walking, experience swelling and pain in the legs, or suffer from thin and weak legs, palpitations, or numbness in the lower abdomen. The prolonged nature of the illness leads to deep internal complications, hindering the smooth circulation of vital energy and resulting in skin that lacks nourishment, leading to numbness. Numbness signifies that the skin is desensitized, unable to perceive what is present or absent.[66p]

或举体转筋，或见食呕逆，恶闻食气，或胸满气急，或遍体酸痛，皆脚气候也。黄帝所谓缓风湿痹是也。顽弱名缓风，疼痛为湿痹。痹者，闭也，闭而不仁，故曰痹也。寒中三阳，所患必冷，越婢汤、小续命汤主之。小续命煎汤成，旋入生姜自然汁，最快。暑中三阴，所患必热，小续命汤去附子，减桂一半。大烦躁者，紫雪最良。大便秘者，脾约丸、神功丸、五柔丸、大三脘散、木瓜散主之。脚气之疾，皆由气实，而始终无一人以服药致虚而殂者。头痛身热，肢节痛而脚屈弱者，是其人素有脚气，此时发动也。脚肿者，槟榔散主之。脚气方论，《千金》、《外台》最详，此不复叙。大抵越婢汤、小续命汤、薏苡仁酒法、脾约丸、神功丸皆要药也。仍针灸为佳。服补药与用汤淋洗者，皆医之大禁也。[67p]

Some may experience body twitching, while others may see food and vomit, detesting the smell of food. They may feel fullness in the chest and urgency of breath, or have soreness all over, all indicative of "foot qi." The Yellow Emperor refers to this as "wind-damp obstruction." Chronic weakness is termed "wind," while pain is called "damp obstruction." Obstruction means a closure; being closed off and insensitive is thus termed obstruction. In the presence of cold among the three yangs, the issue must be cold; for this, use “Yuebi Decoction” or “Small Renewing Life Decoction.” When “Small Renewing Life Decoction” is prepared, add fresh ginger juice for the quickest effect. In the presence of heat among the three yins, the issue must be heat; modify “Small Renewing Life Decoction” by removing aconite and reducing cinnamon by half. For severe agitation, “Purple Snow” is best. For constipation, use “Spleen Contraction Pill,” “Divine Function Pill,” “Five Soft Pills,” “Big Three Abdominal Powder,” or “Papaya Powder.” The ailments of foot qi are all due to excess qi, and none have died from weakness caused by medication. Headaches with body heat, limb joint pain, and weak flexed feet indicate that the person has chronic foot qi, which is now being triggered. For swollen feet, “Betel Nut Powder” is indicated. For discussing foot qi, “Thousand Gold” and “External Treasury” offer the most detailed accounts, and thus will not be repeated here. Generally, “Yuebi Decoction,” “Small Renewing Life Decoction,” “Job's Tears Wine Method,” “Spleen Contraction Pill,” and “Divine Function Pill” are essential medicines. Acupuncture is also excellent. Taking tonics and using decoctions for washing are major prohibitions for doctors.[67p]

　　　　济生方 【宋　严用和】

　　　　　脚气

　　《千金》言脚气皆由感风毒所致。又经云：地之寒暑风湿，皆作蒸气，足常履之，遂成脚气。然古来无脚气之说，黄帝时名为厥，两汉之间名曰缓风，宋齐之后谓之脚气，其名虽不同，其实一也。以此观之，寒暑风湿皆能致此，非特风毒而已。脚气之病，初得不觉，因他病乃始发动，或奄然大闷，经三两日方乃觉之。先从脚起，或缓弱疼痹，或行起忽倒，或两胫肿满，或足膝枯细，或心中忪悸，或小腹不仁，或举体转筋，或见食吐逆，恶闻食气，或胸满气急，或遍体酸痛，此其候之不同也。大抵寒中三阳，所患必冷；暑中三阴，所患必热。诚哉斯言。[68p]

Jisheng Fang 【Song - Yan Yonghe】

Foot Disease

The "Thousand Gold" says that foot disease is caused by the invasion of cold and toxic winds. It further states: the cold, heat, wind, and dampness of the earth all produce steam, and when the feet are often exposed to this, foot disease results. However, in ancient times, there was no concept of foot disease; in the time of the Yellow Emperor, it was called "Jue." Between the Han dynasties, it was referred to as "Huanfeng," and after the Song and Qi dynasties, it became known as foot disease. Although the names differ, the essence remains the same.

From this, we can observe that cold, heat, wind, and dampness can all lead to this condition, not only cold and toxic winds. The disease usually goes unnoticed at first and may arise due to another illness, sometimes suddenly causing great discomfort, only to be felt several days later. It often begins in the feet, presenting as mild pain or weakness, sudden collapses during movement, swollen legs, thin and withered feet and knees, heart palpitations, numbness in the lower abdomen, cramps throughout the body, nausea or vomiting when seeing food, aversion to food smells, chest tightness and shortness of breath, or generalized aches. These variations in symptoms reflect the different manifestations of the illness. Generally, with cold conditions affecting the three Yang channels, there will be cold symptoms; with heat conditions affecting the three Yin channels, there will be heat symptoms. Indeed, these words are true.[68p]

若论其脉，浮而弦者起于风，濡而弱者起于湿，洪而数者起于热，迟而濇者起于寒。风者汗而愈，湿者温而愈，热者下而愈，寒者熨而愈。凡得脚气，速宜针灸之。惟用汤淋洗者，医之大禁也。观夫脚气皆由肾虚而生，然妇人亦有病脚气者，必因血海虚乘宿块，嗔恚哀感悲伤，遂成斯疾。兼今妇人病此者众，则知妇人以血海虚而得之，与男子肾虚类矣。治妇人之法，与男子用药固无异，但兼以治忧恚药，无不效也。且补泻之法，当顺四时。春秋二时，当急补泻；夏月疾盛，专须汗利；入冬已后，须量人之盛衰，微加滋补。不然，则气血日衰，必使年年遇蒸热而作，理之必然也。治法大概无越于斯。又当于四时之中，谨加调摄，不得久坐久立冷湿之地，暑月亦不当露坐湿处，能慎于斯，依法随证治之，无不瘥矣。
　　　　疮疡全书 【金　窦汉卿】[69p]

In discussing the pulse, the floating and string-like pulse arises from wind, the soft and weak pulse arises from dampness, the full and rapid pulse arises from heat, and the slow and rough pulse arises from cold. Wind is treated by sweating, dampness is treated by warmth, heat is treated by purging, and cold is treated by warming. For those suffering from foot conditions, acupuncture should be employed quickly. Using decoctions for washing is a major prohibition in treatment.

Foot ailments arise from kidney deficiency; however, women also suffer from foot conditions due to the deficiency of blood and the stasis of phlegm, as well as emotional disturbances such as anger and sorrow, leading to the development of this illness. Given that many women suffer from this, it can be understood that these ailments due to blood deficiency resemble those from kidney deficiency in men.

The treatment for women is fundamentally the same as for men, but must also include medications for emotional disturbances, which will always yield results. Furthermore, the methods of tonifying and purging should align with the four seasons: in spring and autumn, one should urgently tonify and purge; during summer, when conditions are severe, one must focus on promoting sweating; and after the onset of winter, one should adjust treatment according to whether the condition is improving or worsening, with slight nourishing added.

Otherwise, qi and blood will continuously weaken, leading to recurring issues every year with rising heat—a natural consequence. The general principles of treatment do not exceed this. In addition, throughout the seasons, one must be careful to regulate and manage, avoiding prolonged sitting or standing in cold, damp places, and during hot months, one should not expose oneself to damp areas. By being careful in these respects and treating according to the symptoms, recovery will certainly occur.[69p]

　　　　　训疽

　　训疽者，肺经受热，发于两手五指头上，七八日不泻必死，四日可刺。如发黑痈不甚，过节犹可治也，黑甚过节者死。虽过节犹可治者，药入及之也。其状因小黯肉中生点子，点子者如粟豆大，惟大者如梅李，或赤或黑，乍青乍白，有实核，即根也。不浮肿，惨痛应心至骨，或身体发热。若不急治，毒遂冲上，面悉肿，泡点紫黑烂坏，入脏杀人。南人得此，名曰拓着毒，即截去其指，恐毒上攻，罕有一生。十指端忽然策策痛入于心，不可忍之，向明望者，晃晃黄赤，或黯青黑，是瘭疽，齿间出臭水血者，七日亡矣。但厚肉处即割去，用铁烙其上，令焦如炭，又于疽上灸百壮为佳，须顿饮葵根汁，青靛花、竹沥、犀角汁、枳壳汤、消毒饮。若吐脓血，不治，宜以灰掩脓血上。不尔，毒气着人，亦相染矣．瘭疽害人不旋踵，恶风入肌脉，初未知觉，毒郁既发，若火之烈，其上隐小而深，实点黑而不明，其病应心，稍缓则入脏矣。[70p]

Instructions for Treating Carbuncles

Carbuncles arise when the lung meridian is overheated, manifesting on the fingertips and requiring urgent attention; if not alleviated within seven to eight days, they can be fatal. Treatment can begin within four days by puncturing. If a black sore is not too severe, treatment can still be effective; however, a severely black sore post-festival indicates death. Those that can still be treated after the festival require medicinal intervention.

The appearance is characterized by small, dark lesions as large as millet grains, while larger ones can be the size of plums, ranging in color from red to black, occasionally showing blue and white, often surrounded by a solid core, which is the root. They are not swollen, but may be excruciatingly painful, affecting the heart and reaching the bones, and may also cause the body to feel warm. If treatment is delayed, the poison ascends, causing the face to swell with purple-black blisters that can corrupt the organs, leading to death.

In the south, this condition is known as "toxic invasion," as there’s a fear that cutting off the fingers will allow the poison to spread upwards, leading to a high chance of fatality. Sudden, sharp pains in the fingertips that seem unbearable may appear red or yellow, or dark blue or black. If there is foul-smelling blood or pus between the teeth, death is likely within seven days.

For those with thickened flesh, one should excise the affected area and cauterize it with iron until charred like coal. It is also advisable to apply moxibustion over the carbuncle vigorously, and to take juice from sunflower roots, woad flowers, bamboo sap, rhinoceros horn juice, bitter orange soup, and detoxifying drinks. If one vomits pus and blood and does not seek treatment, one should cover the pus and blood with ash. If not, the toxic gas can infect others. Carbuncles can cause immediate harm, as evil winds penetrate the muscle and veins, initially going unnoticed.

Once the poison has become congested and manifests fiercely, tiny and deep lesions may appear darkly or murkily. The ailment targets the heart; if the condition slightly eases, it can lead to organ invasion.[70p]

　　　　　脚背发

　　脚背发，此证由于消渴之证，发于足指者，名曰脱疽。其色紫黑者死，不紫黑者可治。宜服苦参丸。
　　　　　发臂毒

　　发臂毒，受在心肾经，通于五指络，毒气流走，通为串漏，此是恶毒也，当用内托流气饮、定痛消毒饮治之。此肘后毒，气血流注，积结成毒，此乃痈毒也，定痛流气饮。
　　　　　筋疽

　　筋疽生动脉之间，筋脉之上，臂膊不能屈伸，若不速治，溃烂筋脉，必成痼疾。若生于臂撑上者，名鹚痈，红肿作痛，初宜灸之，若溃之必损命，不可轻忽。内服内托散加木香、五加皮，更服黄矾丸、十奇散，多服护心散，外用铁箍散加姜汁调敷。[71p]

Foot Back Disease

The foot back disease arises from symptoms of wasting thirst. If it occurs at the toes, it is called "liu-jia" (decomposition). Those with a purple-black color are fatal; if not purple-black, it can be treated. It is appropriate to take bitter herb pills.

Arm Toxicity

Arm toxicity is related to the heart and kidney channels, connected to the five fingers. The toxic gas flows and leads to leakage; this is malignancy. It should be treated with internal medication for gas flow and pain relief. This back elbow toxicity involves the flow of qi and blood, accumulating and forming toxins, which are abscess toxins. Use the pain-relieving internal gas flow drink.

Tendon Abscess

Tendon abscess occurs between arteries, above the tendons, causing inability to bend or extend the arms. If not treated swiftly, it may lead to necrosis of tendons, resulting in chronic disease. If it develops on the arm, it is called "chi-yin," characterized by redness, swelling, and pain. Initially, it should be treated with moxibustion; if it ulcerates, it may endanger life and must not be taken lightly. Internally, take internal expelling powders with added agarwood and bark of five-flavored plants, and also take yellow alum pills and shi-qi powder, frequently using protective heart powder; externally, use iron ring powder mixed with ginger juice for application.[71p]

　　　　　天蛇毒

　　天蛇毒，受心风伤于指肘臂，此是恶毒证也，当用定痛流气饮治之。此证未熟，不宜便用刀开针拨其努肉，即发起，深者难治，溃后经年不能长肉，用二黄散掺之。
　　　　　臂面毒

　　臂面毒，生于臂臑之面，受在肝肺经，气血凝滞不通，结聚成毒，此是恶证也，当用清毒流气饮，后用定痛内托饮，围药用金箍散敷之。
　　　　　手心毒

　　手心毒，右手受在阴火，太阴阳明气血流于左足厥阴经，左手毒在心火，太阳流于右足太阴阳明，土复生流于五行，子母更相生养，或因喜怒忧思，寒凝气血，阻滞不通，结聚成毒，当用定痛解毒之剂。后用内托流气饮，外用金箍散敷之。
　　　　　手腕毒

　　手腕毒，生在掌后，因心经风、寒、喜、怒、惊风、痰盛，血不流通，结成此毒，当用定痛败毒散、内托清气饮。或透手心，或透腕外，再用三香内托散治之。
　　　　　发膊[72p]

Heavenly Snake Poison

Heavenly snake poison arises when the heart is afflicted by wind injury at the fingers, elbows, and arms. This signifies a severe toxic condition, and one should treat it with a pain-relieving and qi-flowing drink. If this condition has not yet matured, it is inappropriate to immediately use knives or needles to pierce the corrupted flesh, as it may aggravate the situation. If it becomes deeply rooted, it will be difficult to treat, and even after breaking down, it may take years to regenerate flesh; one should apply Erhuang San to the area.

Arm and Face Poison

Arm and face poison manifests on the surface of the arm, resulting from blockage in the liver and lung meridians, leading to stagnation of qi and blood which gathers into toxins; this is a severe condition. One should use a detoxifying and qi-flowing drink, followed by a pain-relieving internal tonic. Surrounding the affected area, one should apply Jinku San as a poultice.

Palm Poison

Palm poison affects the right hand due to yin fire. The qi and blood of the Taiyin and Yangming flow into the left Jueyin meridian, while the poison of the left hand arises from heart fire, with the Taiyang flowing into the right foot Taiyin Yangming. The earth regenerates flowing through the five phases—mother and child generating and nurturing each other. This condition may stem from emotions like joy, anger, worry, and thoughts, or from cold congealing qi and blood, leading to blockage and toxin accumulation. One should use a pain-relieving and detoxifying medicine, followed by an internal tonic to promote qi flow, and externally apply Jinku San as a poultice.

Wrist Poison

Wrist poison occurs on the back of the hand, resulting from wind, cold, joy, anger, fright, and phlegm affecting the heart, with blood failing to circulate, resulting in toxin formation. One should use a pain-relieving and poison-expelling powder, along with an internal tonic for clearing qi. It may be applied through the palm or the outer wrist, and further treated with Sanyang Neituo San.[72p]

　　发膊乃少阳经多气少血，因少阳有相火，尤甚于厥阴，皆由多虑劳神，六气七情相感，预宜防肌肉难长，暴戾之药，勿轻用之。但此证之发，红肿或如粟，勿以小而忽之。
　　　　　冷疔

　　冷疔者，膏梁之变，风湿余毒，天阴久冷，攻于膝下，传于足太阴经。初生如米，渐成溃烂，其色如煤，败血来侵，骨肉损坏，遂成大患。经年骨节疼痛，累岁不能生肌。先用艾叶、蛇床子、紫苏、豨莶草煎汤洗之，内服黄芪、白朮、苍朮、当归、白芍、连翘、生地之药，外用隔纸膏贴之，节劳内省，亦可瘳矣。
　　　　　臁疮

　　大抵下部之证，以苍朮为主，佐以黄蘗之辛，行以青皮，加以甘草，随证用引经之剂，则得效矣。此毒受在肝肾经，痛不可忍，用内托流气饮治之。搽药用腿游风，及妇人臁疮药通用。
　　　　　委中毒

　　此毒受在肾经，寒气阻滞而成，加减紫苏流气饮治之。先用败毒流气饮，后服紫苏流气饮，排脓加入黄芪。[73p]

On feverish conditions
The conditions of the lesser yang channel often exhibit more qi and less blood, as the lesser yang possesses a corresponding fire, even more so than the extreme yin. This is due to excessive worry and mental labor, influenced by external forces and internal emotions. It is advisable to anticipate difficulties in muscle growth and to avoid reckless use of harsh medicines. However, if the symptoms manifest as red swelling, similar to millet, do not underestimate them merely due to their small size.

On cold sores
Cold sores arise from the alterations in nutritional intake, lingering toxins from wind and dampness, and prolonged exposure to cold weather. These conditions attack the area below the knee and affect the spleen channel. Initially appearing like grains of rice, they gradually become ulcerated, resembling coal in color, as putrid blood invades and damages bone and flesh, leading to significant issues. Over years, the joints cause pain and do not regenerate muscle. Begin treatment with an infusion of mugwort, snake bed seed, perilla, and agrimony for washing, and internally take medicines like astragalus, white atractylodes, black atractylodes, angelica, white peony, forsythia, and raw rehmannia. For external treatment, apply a medicinal paste wrapped in paper. Also, focus on internal reflection to alleviate labor or strain.

On ulcerations
Generally, the symptoms in the lower body primarily involve black atractylodes, complemented by the pungency of coptis, and combined with green tangerine peel, along with licorice. Use targeted medications according to the symptoms, and you shall obtain results. This poison affects the liver and kidney channels, causing unbearable pain, treat it with internal methods to remove stagnant qi. For external application, utilize leg wind remedies, and the same treatment as for women's ulcerations can be used.

On the poison in the Weizhong point
This poison affects the kidney channel, resulting from cold air obstruction. Modify the treatment with perilla qi-moving drink. Start with the detoxifying qi-moving drink, followed by the perilla qi-moving drink, adding astragalus when expelling pus.[73p]

　　　　　腿游风

　　此痈受在小肠肾经，伤于寒热，邪气与毒，流于两腿，此是游毒也，当用紫苏流气饮治之，后服败毒流气饮。外治先以金丝膏贴四五日，以拔其毒水，后用擦药治之。
　　　　　鹤膝风

　　鹤膝风，痢风鼓槌风之类也。气血相并而行，周于一身，得寒则行迟而不及，得热则行速而太过。内伤七情，外伤六淫，则血气之运，或迟或速，而病作矣。多因日久得热，已自腾沸，后复感冒湿热，血受邪郁为瘀滞不得运，所以作痛，夜则痛甚，行于阴也。治以辛温，监以辛凉，流散寒湿，而积热得发，其血自行，与气相和，其病乃止。或因濇药取效，性急作劳，常享厚味，感冒风雨，腿肿则痛甚，皆瘀血流于经隧，日久不治，恐成偏枯，以致膝肿筋缩大痛，两足无力，脚弱渐细，髀胫枯槁，拘挛不能屈伸。治宜祛风顺气，补血壮筋，养阴除湿，则气血通畅，自然愈矣。[74p]

Leg Wind

This boil is located in the small intestine and kidney meridians, caused by cold and heat, with evil energy and toxins flowing through both legs; this is known as wandering toxicity. One should use a perilla (zisu) decoction to treat it, followed by a decoction to dispel toxicity. For external treatment, first apply golden silk paste for four to five days to draw out the toxic fluid, and then use ointments for treatment.

Crane Knee Wind

Crane knee wind is akin to dysentery wind and drumstick wind. The circulation of qi and blood harmonizes throughout the body; if affected by cold, the flow slows down and is insufficient, whereas heat stimulates it too rapidly. Internal injury from emotional distress or external injury from environmental factors leads to irregular circulation of qi and blood, resulting in illness. It often stems from prolonged heat accumulation followed by invasion of damp heat, obstructing the flow of blood and causing pain, particularly at night. Treatment requires warming and dispersing the cold dampness and expelling the accumulated heat. When blood flows freely in harmony with qi, the illness ceases. Alternatively, if one hastily resorts to potent medicines, suffers from overexertion, indulges in rich foods, or is affected by wind and rain, leg swelling and severe pain may arise from stagnant blood in the meridians. If left untreated for an extended period, it may lead to atrophy, resulting in knee swelling, muscle tightening, and severe pain, with weakness and gradual thinning of the legs, and dry, frail thighs and calves that cannot flex or extend. The appropriate treatment is to dispel wind, regulate qi, nourish blood, strengthen tendons, and remove dampness, allowing the smooth flow of qi and blood, leading to a natural recovery.[74p]

　　　　　膝眼毒

　　此毒受在肾经膀胱，气血凝滞，而湿热攻于膝眼，结成毒也。围药用鹤膝风药敷之，煎剂用木香流气饮。
　　　　　肫疽

　　俗言此疽坚硬无脓，殊不知肿硬因成脓在内，一时不能出皮肤，须用内托发出，方可用针刺破。
　　　　　骨槽疽

　　骨槽疽，生于膝盖上，并脚趺上腕，其痛时如刀割，其痒似虫钻，急用艾灸疽上三五壮，便贴乳香万应膏，更服黄矾丸。
　　　　　脚手发背

　　此证因心经有热，行履高低，伤于足趺，血聚成疽。治法同冷漏湿毒流注。
　　　　　骨瘘疽

　　此证生于手阳明之间，初如粟，渐长如赤豆，其痛不可忍，渐长大如杨梅之状，血不出，亦不生脓，毒从经络流于遍身。有此疾者，宜当谨防，不可视为轻疾。宜用治疔之法加减行之。[75p]

Knee Eye Poison

This poison affects the kidney channel and bladder, causing stagnation of qi and blood, while damp heat attacks the knee eye, forming poison. For treatment, apply crane's knee wind medicine externally, and use fragrant liquor decoction internally.

Abscess

Commonly said to be hard and without pus, little do people know that the swelling and hardness is due to internal pus that cannot surface at once. It needs to be guided out from within before one can pierce it with a needle.

Bone Groove Abscess

Bone groove abscess occurs above the knee and at the ankle wrist. Its pain feels like a knife-cut, while its itching is akin to insect-biting. Urgently use moxa on the abscess three to five times, then apply frankincense universal plaster, and take alum pills.

Foot and Hand Manifestation

This condition arises from heat in the heart channel, resulting in uneven walking that harms the foot, causing blood to accumulate and form an abscess. The treatment is the same as for cold, leakage, damp poison.

Bone Fistula Abscess

This condition appears between the hand's yangming channels, initially as a grain and gradually enlarging like a red bean. The pain is unbearable, and it can grow to the size of a bayberry, with no blood or pus emerging, while poison flows through the channels and spreads throughout the body. Those with this ailment should be cautious; it cannot be viewed lightly. It's advisable to use methods for treating sores, adjusted accordingly.[75p]

　　　　　脚拐毒

　　此毒受在肾通于阳明筋聚之处，疼痛伤心，成毒也，当用膝眼毒、跟疽毒及鹤膝风药治之。
　　　　　跟疽 【一名牛茧蚕，一名土栗】
　　此毒生于脚跟之上，因行动高下肭伤，故生此疽，形如琉璃色，无脓，惟有紫色，便不可刺破，先用金箍散或铁箍散敷之。避风戒色，不宜行动。先服蠲毒流气饮，后服除湿木瓜汤，待其将溃，用针挑破，出脓水，贴金丝、紫金二膏药。
　　　　　鞋带疮

　　鞋带疮，生于足踝之旁，因受寒湿，足阳明为毒，气血相聚而成也。当用定痛流气饮治之。
　　　　　脚心毒

　　脚心毒，受在肾心经，生在脚心，是为湿毒也，乃名脚心痈。当服定痛流气饮，并槟榔丸治之。
　　　　　血风疮

　　此疮因妇人经脉不调，或一月两次，或过月不来，以此血气渍入足阳明经，故生此疮。宜用木香流气饮、五积散，外用隔纸膏贴之。[76p]

Foot and Leg Conditions

Foot Malady

This condition affects the kidneys and connects to the Yangming meridian, causing pain in the heart. To treat it, use remedies for knee pain, heel sores, and "crane knee wind."

Heel Sores (also known as "cow pupa worm," "earth chestnut")

These sores develop on the heel, typically due to injury from movement. They appear glassy with no pus, only a purple color, which means they should not be punctured. First, take a purging medication to clear toxins, followed by a dampness-reducing papaya soup. Once ready to drain, use a needle to puncture and release the pus, applying golden silk and purple gold plasters.

Shoe Lace Ulcers

Shoe lace ulcers occur beside the ankle, resulting from cold and damp exposure, leading to toxicity in the foot Yangming channel due to an accumulation of Qi and blood. Utilize "pain-relieving flowing Qi drink" for treatment.

The sole malady affects the kidney and heart channels in the foot, resulting in damp toxicity, termed "sole carbuncle." One should take the "pain-relieving flowing Qi drink" alongside areca nut pills for treatment.

　　　　　肾气游风

　　此毒生在脚肚，受在膀胱经，冷气伤肾，伏在膀胱，此乃风毒也。当用紫苏流气饮，外用铁箍散敷之。
　　　　　里外臁疮

　　里外臁疮，三里之旁、阴交之侧生之者，因肾经寒气攻于下焦，内因风邪之所攻，外有冷气之所搏，或因撞损而致生此疮，渐至溃烂，脓水不干，盖因湿热风毒相搏而致然也。
　　　　　蝼蛄三串

　　此证生于两手，有上中下三种，皆因湿毒伤于肤，气血伤于肾，怒气伤心而瘀血滞气相搏，故成此串毒也。治用流气饮、三香内托散、定痛降气饮。
　　　　　中发疽

　　　　　风毒发疽

　　　　明理论 【金　成无己】

Kidney Qi and Wind Poison

This poison arises in the calves, affecting the bladder meridian; cold air harms the kidneys and lurks in the bladder, which is known as wind poison. One should use perilla flow qi drink and apply iron hoop powder externally.

Internal and External Ulcers

These ulcers gradually become necrotic, with pus that does not dry up, caused by the interplay of damp heat and wind poison.

Three Chains of Mole Crickets

This condition appears on both hands in three varieties: upper, middle, and lower.
