  • 1 tael of Da Huang
  • 6 taels each of Sheng Jiang and Shi Gao
  • 7 pieces of Bei Chi

Preparation: Crush the above 17 ingredients, add 14 sheng of water, boil down to 4 sheng, and divide into five doses to be taken three times during the day and twice at night. If not cured, it is certain to heal by the third dose. One formula includes Ling Yang Jiao instead of Xi Jiao.

Foot Qi Formula treats the initial onset of foot qi, from the feet up to swelling and pain in the knee and shin bones.

Take Bian Ma Ye, cut it and pound it, then steam it and wrap it in thin layers. Change it two to three times daily until the condition resolves. Bian Ma Zi resembles a tick, hence the name. If Bian Ma is unavailable during winter, take the root of Sao Zuo, pound it and mix it with one part wine dregs to three parts root, steam and wrap it hot on the swelling as before, changing twice daily until the condition resolves. This formula also treats numbness and stubborn blockages. This is a unique formula, not commonly seen, but both it and the previous two formulas were provided by Su Changshi without differentiation.

Another formula to treat swelling that has reached the lower abdomen, where urination is scanty and difficult:

Take 1 sheng of cow urine.[201p]

　　右温服，日二，取消乃止。《千金翼》云：羸瘦人二分尿，一分牛乳，合煮，乳浮结，乃服之。　　又方　若肿已消，仍有此候者，急服此汤。　　麻黄　射干　人参　白茯苓　防己　前胡　枳实各二两　半夏　犀角　羚羊角　青木香　橘皮　杏仁　升麻各一两　生姜五两　独活三两　吴茱萸　　右十七味，(口父)咀，以水一斗二升，煮取四升，分五服，相去二十里久服之，中间进少粥，以助胃气。此汤两日服一剂，取病气退乃止，以意消息之。若热盛喘烦者，加石膏六两，生麦门冬一升，去吴茱萸。若心下坚，加鳖甲一两。
　　犀角旋覆花汤　治脚气初起。
　　犀角　旋覆花各二两　豉一斤　橘皮　茯苓　生姜各二两　大枣七枚　紫苏茎叶一握　　右八味，(口父)咀，以水八升，煮取二升七合，分三服，相去十里久服之，以气下小便利为度。崔氏名小犀角汤。如其不下，服后大犀角汤。[202p]

Taking the prescribed amount twice daily, continue until symptoms cease. The "Qianjin Yi" states: For lean individuals, take two parts urine, one part cow's milk, and boil together; when the milk floats and congeals, consume it.

Another prescription: If the swelling has subsided but other symptoms persist, urgently take this soup. The ingredients are: Ma Huang, She Gan, Ren Shen, Bai Fu Ling, Fang Ji, Qian Hu, Zhi Shi, each two liang; Ban Xia, Xi Jiao, Ling Yang Jiao, Qing Mu Xiang, Ju Pi, Xing Ren, Sheng Ma, each one liang; fresh ginger five liang; Du Huo three liang; Wu Zhu Yu.

Prepare the seventeen ingredients, grind them, and use one dou and two sheng of water. Boil down to four sheng, and divide into five doses, taking them about twenty li apart for prolonged use, while also consuming a small amount of porridge to aid stomach energy. This soup should be taken once every two days until the illness subsides. Adjust the intake according to one's feelings. If there is severe heat and difficult breathing, add six liang of Shi Gao and one sheng of Sheng Mai Men Dong, omitting Wu Zhu Yu. If there is hardness below the heart, add one liang of Bie Jia.

Xijiao Xuanfu Hua Soup treats the initial stage of foot ailments. The ingredients are: Xi Jiao, Xuanfu Hua, each two liang; Chi (fermented soybeans) one jin; Ju Pi, Fu Ling, fresh ginger, each two liang; seven Da Zao; one handful of Zi Su stems and leaves.

Prepare these eight ingredients, grind them, and use eight sheng of water, boiling down to two sheng and seven ge. Divide into three doses, taking them about ten li apart for prolonged use, until there is a slight relief in bowel movements. This is known as Cui's Little Xijiao Soup. If relief is not achieved, follow up with Big Xijiao Soup.[202p]

　　大犀角汤　疗脚气毒冲心，变成水，身体遍肿，闷绝欲死。　　犀角　旋覆花　白朮　桂心　防己　黄芩　生姜　橘皮　茯苓各二两　豉一升　桑白皮　前胡各四两　紫苏茎叶一握　大枣十枚　　右十四味，(口父)咀，以水九升，煮取二升七合，分三服，相去十里久服之，取下气为度。若得气下，小便利，脚肿即消，能食。若服汤竟不下，气急不定，仍服后犀角麻黄汤。崔氏又以白前代白朮，无防己、黄芩、桑白皮，名旋覆花汤。
　　犀角麻黄汤　服大犀角汤后，仍不下，气急不定。　　犀角　麻黄　防风　独活　羚羊角　芎藭　白朮　防己　当归　黄芩各二两　石膏四两　生姜　甘草　杏仁　桂心各三两　　右十五味，(口父)咀，以水二斗煮麻黄，去沫取汁八升，下药煎取三升，分三服，相去十里久服讫，覆取汗。若不瘥，五日后更一剂，取汗同前。崔氏无独活、羚羊角、杏仁，有附子、茯苓、细辛。[203p]

Da Xi Jiao Decoction treats the toxins from athlete's foot that rush to the heart, transforming into water, causing the body to swell all over, with a feeling of suffocation and desperation to die. The ingredients are: rhino horn, Xuanfu flower, white atractylodes, cinnamon heart, ephedra, Huangqin, fresh ginger, tangerine peel, and poria (each two liang); fermented soybeans (one sheng); mulberry root bark and Qianhu (each four liang); a handful of purple perilla stems and leaves; and ten large dates. For preparation, take these fourteen ingredients, decoct them in nine sheng of water until two sheng and seven he remain, to be divided into three doses. This should be taken over a distance of ten li, and taken for a long time, aiming to expel the qi. If the qi passes down, and there is a small ease of bowel movement, the swelling in the feet will disappear, and appetite will return. If the decoction does not carry through, and the qi is unsettled, take the subsequent rhino horn and ephedra decoction. Cui's method substitutes Bai Qian for Bai Zhu, omits Fang Ji, Huangqin, and Sang Bai Pi, calling it Xuanfu Flower Decoction.

Rhino Horn and Ephedra Decoction is taken after the Da Xi Jiao Decoction if it still does not carry through, and the qi remains unsettled. The ingredients are: rhino horn, ephedra, windbreaker, saposhnikovia, antelope horn, ligusticum, white atractylodes, ephedra, angelica, and Huangqin (each two liang); gypsum (four liang); fresh ginger, licorice, apricot kernel, and cinnamon heart (each three liang). Prepare these fifteen ingredients, decoct them with two dou of water using ephedra, remove the foam, obtaining eight sheng of juice; then add the herbs to brew into three sheng, to be divided into three doses. This should also be taken over a distance of ten li for a long time, to induce sweating. If not cured, after five days, another dose should be administered to induce sweat again. Cui’s method omits saposhnikovia, antelope horn, and apricot kernel, substituting with aconite, poria, and asarum.[203p]

　　茱萸汤苏长史方　治脚气入腹，困闷欲死，腹胀。　　吴茱萸六斤　木瓜两颗，切
　　右二味，以水一斗三升，煮取三升，分三服，相去如人行十里久进一服，或吐或汗，或利，或大热闷，即瘥，此起死回生之方也。又二味等分为末，酒丸，每服五十九或百丸，温酒下，名茱萸丸，治证同。
　　小风引汤　治中风腰脚疼痛弱者。胡洽名大风引汤，无干姜、石斛，有桂心、黄芪。　　独活　茯苓　人参各三两　防风　当归身　甘草　干姜　石斛各二两　附子一枚，去皮　大豆二升　　右十味，(口父)咀，以水九升，酒三升，煮取三升，分四服，服相去如人行十里久。胡洽云：南方治脚弱与此别，用升麻、半夏、芍药各一两，合十三味。本只有十味，减当归、石斛，名小风引汤。删繁方无石斛，以疗肉极寒，肌肉变，舌痿，名曰恶风，腰痛脚弱。[204p]

Zhu Yu Decoction, a formula by Changshi Su, treats athlete's foot that invades the abdomen, causing distress and a bloated stomach. Six pounds of Wu Zhu Yu and two pieces of Mu Guo should be cut and combined with 13 liters of water, boiled down to 3 liters, and divided into three doses. Each dose should be taken after walking for ten miles or so. Patients may experience vomiting, sweating, diarrhea, or a severe sense of heat and oppression, which indicates the remedy is effective. This is a lifegiving formula.

Another mixture involves evenly grinding the two ingredients into a powder, forming wine pills, with each dose consisting of 59 or 100 pills taken with warm wine, known as Zhu Yu Pills, used for similar conditions.

Xiao Feng Yin Decoction treats weak patients with pain in the waist and legs caused by wind stroke. This is also referred to as "Da Feng Yin Decoction" by Hu Qia. It excludes dried ginger and stone frog, but includes cinnamon bark and astragalus. The ingredients are as follows: three taels each of Du Huo, Fu Ling, and Ren Shen; two taels each of Fang Feng, Dang Gui (body), Gan Cao, Gan Jiang, and Shi Hu; one piece of peeled Fu Zi; two sheng of soybeans.

These ten ingredients should be chewed, boiled with 9 liters of water and 3 liters of wine, and reduced to 3 liters, divided into four doses. Each should be taken similarly after walking ten miles. Hu Qia states that in the south, treatments for weak legs differ, using 1 tael each of Sheng Ma, Ban Xia, and Shao Yao, equating to thirteen ingredients. The original formula consists of ten ingredients, reducing Dang Gui and Shi Hu, thus named Xiao Feng Yin Decoction. The simplification omits Shi Hu to treat extreme cold in the flesh, muscle changes, and weakness of the tongue, collectively referred to as "evil wind," with symptoms of waist pain and weak legs.[204p]

　　四物附子汤　治风湿相搏，骨节烦痛，四肢拘急，不可屈伸，近之则痛，自汗出而短气，小便不利，恶风不欲去衣，或头面手足，时时浮肿。　　附子二枚　桂心四两　白朮　甘草各二两　　右四味，(口父)咀，以水六升，煮取三升，分三服，微汗愈。大汗烦者，一服五合。体肿者，加防己四两。悸气小便不利，加茯苓三两。既其附子，今加生姜三两。　　又方　治脚弱风毒实，及岭南瘴气面肿，乍寒乍热似疟状，脚肿气上，心闷咳嗽，瘫痪顽痹。　　麻仁　升麻　麻黄　射干　菖蒲　芒硝　甘草　大黄各二两　豉三合　　右九味，(口父)咀，以水六升，煮取二升半，内芒硝又煎三沸，分三服，微利一二行，解毒热，有肿即消之。凡觉气满辄服一剂，佳。《延年秘录》作芒硝半两，《外台》同。[205p]

Siwu Fuzitang

This formula is used to treat wind and dampness attacking the body, resulting in painful bones and joints, stiffness of the limbs, inability to bend or stretch, increased pain upon approach, spontaneous sweating and shortness of breath, difficulty in urination, aversion to wind and reluctance to remove clothing, and occasional swelling of the head, face, hands, and feet.

Ingredients:

  • 2 pieces of Fuzi (Aconite)
  • 4 taels of Gui Xin (Cinnamon Heart)
  • 2 taels each of Baizhu (Atractylodes) and Gancao (Licorice)

Preparation:
Combine the four ingredients, crush them, and boil with six liters of water to obtain three liters of liquid. Divide into three doses; a slight sweat should result in recovery. For those with significant sweating and discomfort, take one dose of five liang (a weight measure). If the body is swollen, add four taels of Fangji (Stephania). For palpitations and difficulty in urination, add three taels of Fuling (Poria). Finally, if Fuzi is present, add three taels of fresh ginger.

Another formula:
This treats weak feet due to wind poison, swelling of the face caused by southern miasma, alternating chills and fevers resembling malaria, swelling in the feet, and symptoms such as heaviness in the heart and coughing, as well as paralysis and stubborn numbness.

Ingredients:

  • 2 taels each of Maren (Sesame), Shengma (Cimicifuga), Mahuang (Ephedra), Shegan (Belamcanda), Changpu (Acorus), Mangxiao (Glauber's salt), Gancao (Licorice), and Dahuang (Rhubarb)
  • 3 he (a volume measure) of Dou (Fermented soybean)

Preparation:
Combine the nine ingredients, crush them, and boil with six liters of water to obtain two and a half liters of liquid. Then boil Mangxiao additionally for three times. Divide into three doses; a slight purgation of one or two movements will relieve toxicity and heat, and any swelling should dissipate. If there is a sensation of fullness, take one dose, which is beneficial. According to “Yannian Miji”, Mangxiao is half a tael, and this is the same as stated in “Waitai”.[205p]

　　深师增损肾沥汤　治风虚劳损，热毒，脚弱疼痹，或不随，下焦虚冷，胸中微有客热，心虚惊悸，不得眠，食少，失气味，日夜数过，心烦迫不得卧，小便不利，又时复下。湘东王至江州，王在岭南病悉如此，极困笃，余作此汤令服，即得力。病似此者，服无不瘥，随宜增损。　　人参　黄芪　甘草　芍药　麦门冬　肉苁蓉　干地黄　赤石脂　茯神　地骨白皮　当归　远志　磁石　枳实　防风　龙骨各一两　桂心　芎藭各二两　生姜四两　五味子三合　半夏一升　大枣三十枚　白羊肾一具　　右二十三味，(口父)咀，以水二斗，煮羊肾取汁一斗二升，内诸药，煮取四升，分为五服。不利下者，除龙骨、赤石脂。小便濇，以赤茯苓代茯神，加白朮三两。多热，加黄芩一两。遗溺，加桑螵蛸二十枚。胡洽方无黄芪、苁蓉、赤石脂、地骨皮、磁石、枳实、防风、龙骨、半夏，有黄芩，为十五味。[206p]

Shen Shi Zeng Sun Shen Li Decoction

Treats conditions from wind deficiency and labor damage, heat toxin, weak and painful legs, or inability to follow, lower body deficiency and cold, mild foreign heat in the chest, heart deficiency leading to fright, insomnia, decreased appetite, loss of taste and smell, frequent discomfort day and night, heart distress preventing sleep, difficulty urinating, and occasional relapse. When Wang from Xiangdong arrived in Jiangzhou, he had all these ailments while in Lingnan, extremely fatigued. I prescribed this decoction for him to take, and he regained strength. For those with similar conditions, none have failed to recover; adjust the dosage as needed.

Ingredients:

  • Ren Shen (Ginseng) - 1 tael
  • Huang Qi (Astragalus) - 1 tael
  • Gan Cao (Licorice) - 1 tael
  • Shao Yao (Peony) - 1 tael
  • Mai Men Dong (Ophiopogon) - 1 tael
  • Rou Cong Rong (Cistanche) - 1 tael
  • Gan Di Huang (Rehmannia) - 1 tael
  • Chi Shi Zhi (Red Stone) - 1 tael
  • Fu Shen (Poria) - 1 tael
  • Di Guo Bai Pi (White Rehmannia Skin) - 1 tael
  • Dang Gui (Angelica) - 1 tael
  • Yuan Zhi (Polygala) - 1 tael
  • Ci Shi (Magnetite) - 1 tael
  • Zhi Shi (Bitter Orange) - 1 tael
  • Fang Feng (Siler) - 1 tael
  • Long Gu (Dragon Bone) - 1 tael
  • Gui Xin (Cinnamon Heart) - 2 taels
  • Xiong Dan (Chuanxiong) - 2 taels
  • Sheng Jiang (Fresh Ginger) - 4 taels
  • Wu Wei Zi (Schisandra) - 3 handfuls
  • Ban Xia (Pinellia) - 1 sheng
  • Da Zao (Dates) - 30 pieces
  • Bai Yang Shen (White Sheep Kidney) - 1 whole

These twenty-three ingredients are to be chewed well, using 2 dou of water to cook the sheep kidney obtaining 1 dou and 2 sheng of extract. Then add all the herbs and boil down to 4 sheng, divided into five doses. For those with difficulty urinating, remove Long Gu and Chi Shi Zhi. For those with thick urine, replace Fu Shen with Chi Fu Ling and add 3 taels of Bai Zhu. For excessive heat, add 1 tael of Huang Qin. For incontinence, add 20 pieces of Sang Piao Xiao. The formula has no Huang Qi, Cong Rong, Chi Shi Zhi, Di Guo Pi, Ci Shi, Zhi Shi, Fang Feng, Long Gu, Ban Xia, but has Huang Qin, making a total of fifteen ingredients.[206p]

　　石膏汤　治脚气，风毒热气，上冲头面，面赤筋急鼻塞去来，来时令人昏愦，心胸恍惚，或若惊悸，身体颤掉，手足缓纵，或酸痹，头目眩重，眼反鼻辛，热气出口中，或患味甜诸恶，不可名状者。　　石膏　龙胆　升麻　芍药　贝齿　甘草　鳌甲酥炙　黄芩　羚羊角各一两　橘皮　当归各二两　　右十一味，(口父)咀，以水八升，煮取三升，分为三服。[207p]

Gypsum Decoction treats athlete's foot, wind and heat toxins, which rush upwards to the head and face, causing redness, muscle tension, nasal congestion with alternating blockage and release, resulting in dizziness and confusion, a feeling of panic, trembling of the body, and loose limbs that may feel sore or numb. Symptoms may include a heavy head, a sensation of pressure in the eyes, bitterness in the mouth, or various indescribable discomforts.

The ingredients are: Gypsum, Gentian, Cimicifuga, Peony, Baitou, Licorice, Turtle Shell (fried), Huangqin, and Antelope Horn, each one ounce; and Tangerine Peel and Dong Quai, each two ounces.

The eleven ingredients are to be crushed and boiled in eight liters of water until three liters remain, and then divided into three doses.[207p]

　　半夏汤　治脚气上入腹，腹急上冲胸，气急欲绝。　　半夏一升　桂心八两　干姜五两　甘草　人参　细辛　附子各二两　蜀椒二合　　右八味，(口父)咀，以水一斗，煮取三升，分三服，初稍稍进，恐气冲上，格塞不得下，小小服，通人气耳。
　　乌头汤　治风冷脚痹，疼痛挛弱，不可屈伸。　　乌头　细辛　蜀椒各一两　甘草　秦艽　附子　桂心　芍药各二两　干姜　茯苓　防风　当归各三两　独活四两大枣二十枚　　右十四味，(口父)咀，以水一斗二升，煮取四升，分五服。若热毒，多服亦佳。[208p]

Banxia Decoction treats foot disorders that ascend to the abdomen, causing urgent abdominal discomfort and a crushing sensation in the chest, leading to severe gasping. The ingredients are: one sheng of Banxia, eight liang of Gui Xin, five liang of Gan Jiang, two liang each of Gan Cao, Ren Shen, Xi Xin, and Fu Zi, and two he of Shu Jiao. Combine these eight ingredients, crush them, brew with one dou of water, and boil down to three sheng. Divide into three doses; take a little at first to prevent excessive gas from rising, which might cause blockage; a small amount will open up the Qi.

Wutou Decoction treats cold wind foot pain, characterized by aching, stiffness, and inability to flex or extend. The ingredients are: one liang each of Wutou, Xi Xin, and Shu Jiao, and two liang each of Gan Cao, Qin Jiao, Fu Zi, Gui Xin, and Shao Yao, three liang each of Gan Jiang, Fu Ling, Fang Feng, and Dang Gui, four liang of Du Huo, and twenty da zao. Combine these fourteen ingredients, crush them, brew with one dou and two sheng of water, and boil down to four sheng. Divide into five doses. If there is excess heat or toxicity, taking more is also beneficial.[208p]

　　追毒汤　治脚弱，风热上入心腹，烦闷欲绝。　　半夏　生姜各四两　黄芪　甘草　当归　人参　厚朴　独活　桔皮各一两　枳实　麻黄　干地黄　芍药各二两　桂心一两　贝子七枚　大枣十枚　　右十六味，(口父)咀，以水一斗二升，煮取三升六合，分四服，日三夜一。
　　防风汤　治脚气，并治毒气上冲，心胸呕逆，宿癖积气疝气诸病，常服。　　防风　麻黄　芎藭　人参　芍药　当归　茯苓　半夏　甘草　桔皮各一两　鳖甲　生姜　桂心各二两　杏仁两半　赤小豆一升　贝子　乌梅各五枚　大枣二十枚　吴萸五合　犀角　羚羊角各半两　薤白十四枚　　右二十二味，(口父)咀，以水一斗，煮取三升，分三服，一日令尽。一方用水一斗二升，间食糜。一方半夏二两，随时用。[209p]

Zhui Du Tang: For treating weakness in the legs, with wind-heat rising to the heart and abdomen, causing irritability and despair.

Ingredients:

  • Banxia (4 liang)
  • Shengjiang (4 liang)

Fangfeng Tang: For treating foot Qi disorders, as well as toxic qi rising, causing nausea and accumulation of gases in the chest, suitable for regular consumption.

Ingredients:

  • Fangfeng (1 liang)
  • Mahuang (1 liang)
  • Xiangfu (1 liang)
  • Renshen (1 liang)
  • Shaoyao (1 liang)
  • Danggui (1 liang)
  • Fuling (1 liang)
  • Banxia (1 liang)
  • Gancao (1 liang)
  • Jupi (1 liang)
  • Bieqiao (2 liang)
  • Shengjiang (2 liang)
  • Guixin (2 liang)
  • Xingren (halved, 2 pieces)
  • Chixiaodou (1 sheng)

Preparation: Use 22 ingredients, chew them, add 10 liters of water, boil until you have 3 liters, divide into three doses to be taken in one day. One recipe uses 12 liters of water, consumed with porridge. Another recipe uses 2 liang of Banxia, used as needed.[209p]

　　防风汤　治肢体虚风，微痉发热，支节不随，恍惚狂言，来去无时，不自觉悟。南方支法存所用，多得力温和，不用人为，胜于续命、越婢、风引等汤。罗广州一门，及南州士人常用。亦治脚弱甚良。　　石膏半两　防风　麻黄　独活　生姜　秦艽　半夏各一两　麝香六铢　当归　远志　甘草　防己　人参　黄芩　升麻　芍药各一两　　右十六味，(口父)咀，以水一斗三升，煮取四升，一服一升，初服厚覆取微汗，亦当两三行下，其间相去如人行十里久更服。一方，有白朮一两。有热，加大黄二两。先有冷心痛疾者，倍用当归，加桂心三两，不用大黄。[210p]

Fangfeng Decoction treats symptoms of a weak body with wind, mild spasms, fever, joints that do not move freely, confusion, and erratic speech that occurs without awareness. In southern regions, it is often applied, being effective, gentle, and not reliant on forced methods. It surpasses decoctions like Xiangming, Yuebi, and Fengyin. It is commonly used by the Luo family in Guangzhou and by scholars in southern provinces. It is also highly effective for weakness of the legs.

Ingredients:

  • Gypsum (half tael)
  • Fangfeng
  • Mahuang
  • Duhuo
  • Fresh ginger
  • Qinjiao
  • Banxia (each one tael)
  • Musk (six zhū)
  • Dongguai
  • Yuanzhi
  • Licorice
  • Fangji
  • Ginseng
  • Huangqin
  • Shengma
  • Shaoyao (each one tael)

Combine these sixteen ingredients, grind them, and use water (13 liters) to boil and reduce to four liters. The dose is one liter per serving. At first, cover warmly to induce a slight sweat, and it should lead to two or three bowel movements. Between doses, space them as if walking for ten miles.

In one method, add one tael of Baizhu. If there is heat, add two taels of Dahuang. For those with a prior cold heartache, double the dose of Dongguai and add three taels of Guixin, and do not use Dahuang.[210p]

　　甘草汤　治脚弱，举身洪肿，胃反食谷吐逆，胸中气结不安，而寒热下利不止，小便难，服此汤即愈。亦服女曲散，利小便，肿消，服大散摩膏，有验。　　吴茱萸二升　甘草　人参各一两　半夏一升　桂心　蜀椒各三两　小麦八合　大枣二十枚　生姜八两　　右九味，(口父)咀，以水一斗三升，煮小麦取一斗，去小麦，内诸药，煮取三升，分为六服。
　　恒山甘草汤　若寒热日再三发，可服此方。　　恒山三两　甘草一两半
　　右二味，(口父)咀，以水四升，煮取一升半，分三服，相去五里久一服。
　　丹参牛膝煮散　治脚痹弱气，满身微肿。　　丹参　牛膝　桑白皮　杏仁　升麻　茯苓　猪苓各四两　犀角　黄芩　橘皮　防己　白前　泽泻　桂心　秦艽各二两　生姜　李根白皮各二两　大麻仁二升　　右十八味，捣，粗筛，以水一升半，内散方寸匕，煮取七合，轻绢滤去滓，顿服，日再。夏日热不得服丸散。此煮散须年常用，大验。[211p]

Glycyrrhiza Decoction: For treating weakness in the legs, generalized swelling, gastric reflux with vomiting of food, chest tightness and discomfort, persistent cold and heat with diarrhea, difficulty urinating; taking this decoction will result in recovery. It is also effective when combined with Nü Qu San to promote urination, reduce swelling, and with Da San Mo Gao, effective results have been observed.

Ingredients:

  • 2 sheng of Wu Zhu Yu
  • 1 liang each of Glycyrrhiza and Ginseng
  • 1 sheng of Ban Xia
  • 3 liang each of Gui Xin and Shu Jiao
  • 8 he of wheat
  • 20 Da Zao
  • 8 liang of fresh ginger

The above nine ingredients should be ground, boiled in 13 sheng of water, and after cooking the wheat to obtain 10 sheng, remove the wheat, add the herbs, and boil to yield 3 sheng, divided into six doses.

Hengshan Glycyrrhiza Decoction: If cold and heat recur multiple times a day, this formula can be taken.

Ingredients:

  • 3 liang of Hengshan
  • 1.5 liang of Glycyrrhiza

These two ingredients should be ground, boiled with 4 sheng of water to yield 1.5 sheng, divided into three doses, taken five li apart.

Dan Shen and Niu Xi Decoction: For treating weakness and numbness in the legs, with slight swelling all over the body.

Ingredients:

  • 4 liang each of Dan Shen, Niu Xi, Sang Bai Pi, Xing Ren, Sheng Ma, Fu Ling, and Zhu Ling
  • 2 liang each of Xi Jiao, Huang Qin, Ju Pi, Fang Ji, Bai Qian, Ze Xie, Gui Xin, and Qin Jiao
  • 2 liang each of fresh ginger and Li Gen Bai Pi
  • 2 sheng of Da Ma Ren

These eighteen ingredients should be crushed, coarsely sifted, mixed with 1.5 sheng of water, and boiled with a spoonful of the decoction until 7 he is obtained. Filter through a fine cloth, take all at once, twice daily. Avoid using pills or powders in hot summer weather. This decoction should be used regularly throughout the year and has proven effective.[211p]

　　小续命汤 【《活人书》】 　治脚气痹弱，不能转侧者。　　附子生，削去皮脐，五钱　防风一两半　芍药　白朮　人参　川芎　麻黄去节，汤泡三次，焙干　防己　黄芩　桂枝　甘草各一两　　右銼如麻豆大，每服五钱匕，水一盏半，煎至一盏，去滓，取八分清汁，入生姜汁，再煎一二沸，温服，日三夜二。
　　神功丸子和　治风气下流，腰疼脚重，脐下胀痛，溺赤如金。　　大黄三两　人参半两　麻子仁五两，另研　诃子皮炮，取二两　　右杵研为细末，炼蜜为丸，如梧桐子大，每服二十丸，温水下，日三服，以通为度。[212p]

Xiao Xu Ming Tang (from "Huo Ren Shu")
For treating weak legs due to foot edema, unable to turn sides.

  1. Prepare 5 qian of fresh Aconite, peeled and trimmed.
  2. 1.5 liang of Fang Feng
  3. Bai Shao, Bai Zhu, Ren Shen, Chuan Xiong, and Ma Huang (remove joints), soaked in water three times and then dried.
  4. 1 liang each of Fang Ji, Huang Qin, Gui Zhi, and Gan Cao.

Grind the above until they are the size of mung beans. Each dose consists of 5 qian, mixed with 1.5 cups of water, decoct until reduced to 1 cup, discard the residue, take 80% of the clear liquid, add ginger juice, and boil for one or two more rounds. Drink warm, three times during the day and twice at night.

Shen Gong Wan Zi He
For treating the downward flow of wind, waist pain, heaviness of the legs, bloating and pain below the navel, and urine that is red like gold.

  1. 3 liang of Da Huang
  2. 0.5 liang of Ren Shen
  3. 5 liang of Ma Zi Ren, ground separately
  4. 2 liang of He Zi peel, roasted.

Grind the above into a fine powder, mix with honey to form pills the size of catalpa seeds. Each dose consists of 20 pills, taken with warm water, three times a day, adjusted according to effect.[212p]

　　五柔丸　治老人虚人脚气，津液虚，大便结，调补三焦。　　大黄四两　前胡一两　半夏洗　苁蓉酒浸　芍药　茯苓　细辛　当归　葶苈炒，各半两　　右捣，罗为细末，炼蜜为丸，如梧桐子大，温水下二十丸，以通利为度。
　　槟榔散　治脚肿。
　　橘叶一大握　沙木一握　童子小便一小盏　酒半盏　　右同煎数沸，调槟榔末二钱，食后服。
　　木瓜散　治脚气。
　　大腹皮一枚　紫苏一分　干木瓜　甘草炙　木香　羌活各一分　　右细銼为散，分作三服，每服用白水一盏，煎至半盏，去滓，通口服。
　　赤茯苓丸 【《儒门事亲》，下同】 　治脾湿太过，四肢肿满，腹胀喘逆，气不宣通，小便赤濇。　　木香半两　赤茯苓　防己各二两　葶苈四两　　右为末，枣肉丸如桐子大，每服三十丸，煎桑白皮汤送下，食前。一本，赤茯苓一两。[213p]

Wurou Pill treats elderly individuals with deficiency and beriberi, dryness of body fluids, constipation, and regulates the Sanjiao.

Ingredients:

  • 4 taels of Dahuang (rhubarb)
  • 1 tael of Qianhu (Radix Peucedani)
  • Wash Banxia (Pinellia)
  • Soak Cangrong (Cistanche) in wine
  • Shaoyao (Peony)
  • Fuling (Poria)
  • Xixin (Asarum)
  • Danggui (Angelica)
  • Tingli (Descurainia) – each half a tael.

Crush these ingredients into a fine powder, refine with honey to make pills the size of a phoenix seed, ingest twenty pills with warm water to ensure smoothness.

Binglang Powder treats swelling of the feet.

Ingredients:

  • A large handful of Juye (tangerine leaves)
  • A handful of Shamu (sandalwood)
  • A small cup of boy's urine
  • Half a cup of wine.

Boil these ingredients together several times, then mix 2 qian (10 grams) of Binglang powder and take after meals.

Mugua Powder treats beriberi.

Ingredients:

  • 1 piece of Dafu peel (large gourd peel)
  • 1 fen (3 grams) of Zisu (purple perilla)
  • Dried Mugua (papaya)
  • Honey-fried Licorice
  • Mu Xiang (Costus)
  • Qianghuo (Notopterygium) – each 1 fen.

Grind these finely into a powder, divide into three doses, and take each dose with one cup of water boiled down to half a cup, strained, for oral consumption.

Chi Fuling Pills treats excessive spleen dampness, swelling of the limbs, abdominal distension, shortness of breath, inability to circulate qi, and red and painful urination.

Ingredients:

  • ½ tael of Mu Xiang
  • 2 taels of Chi Fuling (red Poria)
  • 2 taels of Fangji (Stephania)
  • 4 taels of Tingli.

Grind these into a powder, form into jujube-sized pills. Take thirty pills, wash down with a decoction of Sangbai Pi (white mulberry bark), before meals. According to one version, use 1 tael of Chi Fuling.[213p]

　　除湿丹　治诸湿肿客搏，腰膝重痛，足胫浮肿。　　乳香研　没药研，各一两　牵牛头末半两　大戟炒，三两　槟榔　威灵仙　赤芍药　泽泻　葶苈　甘遂各二两　陈皮去白，四两　　右为末，糊丸如桐子大，每服五十丸至七八十丸，温水送下，食前。得更衣，止后服。如服药前后，忌酒二日，湿面两三日。食后，温淡粥补胃，尤佳。
　　无碍丸　治脾病横流，四肢肿满。
　　木香半两　蓬莪荗炮　京三棱炮　槟榔生　(木郁)李仁汤泡，去皮，各一两　大腹皮二两　　右六味，为末，炒麦芽杵为粉，糊丸如桐子大，每服二十丸，生姜汤送下，无时。
　　加减白通汤　治形寒饮冷，大便自利，完谷不化，脐腹冷痛，足胻寒而逆。　　附子炮，去皮脐，干　姜炮，各一两　官桂去皮　甘草炙　半夏汤泡　草豆蔻面裹煨　人参　白朮各半两　　右八味，(口父)咀，每服五钱，水二盏半，生姜五片，葱白五茎，煎一盏三分，去滓，空心，宿食消尽，温服。[214p]

Damp-Removing Pill: Treats various damp-related swellings, heavy pain in the waist and knees, and floating edema in the feet and shins.

Ingredients:

  • Frankincense, ground - 1 liang
  • Myrrh, ground - 1 liang
  • Qian Niu Tou powder - 0.5 liang
  • Stir-fried Da Ji - 3 liang
  • Areca nut - 2 liang
  • Wei Ling Xian - 2 liang
  • Red peony - 2 liang
  • Ze Xie - 2 liang
  • Ting Li - 2 liang
  • Gan Sui - 2 liang
  • Aged tangerine peel, white part removed - 4 liang

Combine these into a fine powder, form into pills the size of a Chinese parasol seed. Take 50 to 80 pills each time with warm water before meals. If there are changes in clothing, stop taking after. Avoid alcohol for two days before and after taking the medicine, and maintain a dry face for two to three days. After meals, consuming warm, light porridge is especially beneficial for the stomach.

Wu Ai Pill: Treats spleen disorders causing excessive flow, with swelling in the limbs.

Ingredients:

  • Mu Xiang - 0.5 liang
  • Pungent herb (Pungent Atractylodes) - 1 liang, toasted
  • Jing San Ling, toasted - 1 liang
  • Fresh areca nut - 1 liang
  • (Wood fragrance) Li kernel - 1 liang, soaked in soup, skin removed
  • Da Fu Pi - 2 liang

Grind these six ingredients into a fine powder, and crush malt into a fine powder. Form pills the size of a Chinese parasol seed. Take 20 pills each time with ginger soup, at any time.

Modified Bai Tong Decoction: Treats cold sensations, drinking cold, self-laxative stools, undigested grains, cold pain in the abdomen, and coldness in the feet and shins.

Ingredients:

  • Stir-fried Fu Zi, skin and navel removed - 1 liang
  • Dry ginger, stir-fried - 1 liang
  • Gui Pi (Cinnamon) - skin removed
  • Zhi Gan Cao - half a liang
  • Ban Xia, soaked in soup - half a liang
  • Grass cardamom powder wrapped in moist cloth - half a liang
  • Ren Shen - half a liang
  • Bai Zhu - half a liang

Combine these eight ingredients, chew, and take 5 qian each time with 2.5 bowls of water, 5 slices of ginger, and 5 green onions, simmer until reduced to a third. Strain, take on an empty stomach when old food is completely digested, warm.[214p]

　　既济解毒汤　治上热，头目赤肿而痛，胸膈烦闷，不得安卧，身半以下皆寒，足膝尤甚，大便微秘。　　大黄酒制，大便利勿服　桔梗　黄连酒炒　甘草炙　黄芩酒制炒，各二钱　柴胡　升麻　当归身　连翘各一钱　　右，(口父)咀作一服，水二盏，煎至一盏，去滓，食后温服。忌洒湿面大料物及生冷等物。
　　蛜(虫祁)丸　治鹤膝风，及腰膝风缩。胡楚望博士病风疰，手足指节如桃李，痛不可忍，服之悉愈。　　蛜(虫祁)一条，头尾全者　白附子　阿魏研　桂心　白芷各一两　乳香三分　当归　漏芦　芍药　威灵仙　地骨皮　川牛膝　羌活　安息香　桃仁各一两，生，同安息香研　没药三分　　右十六味，蛜(虫祁)、桃仁、白附、阿魏、桂心、白芷、安息香、乳香、没药九味，同童子小便并酒二升炒热，冷定，入余药为末，蜜丸弹子大，空心，温酒化下一丸，无时。[215p]

Jìjì Detoxifying Decoction treats heat in the upper body, causing redness, swelling, and pain in the head, chest oppression, inability to lie comfortably, and coldness below the waist, particularly severe in the knees and feet, with slightly constipated stools. Ingredients include:

  • Dàhuáng (Rhizoma Rhei) prepared with wine
  • Jùgēng (Platycodon)
  • Huánglián (Coptis), stir-fried with wine
  • Gāncaǐ (Licorice), roasted
  • Huángqín (Scutellaria) prepared and stir-fried with wine, two qian each
  • Chái hū (Bupleurum)
  • Shēngmá (Cimicifuga)
  • Dāngguī (Angelica sinensis)
  • Liánqiáo (Forsythia), one qian each

The above, ground into a single dose, boiled with two cups of water until reduced to one cup, strained, and taken warm after meals. Avoid exposure to damp conditions, strong spices, and raw or cold food.

Yú (Insect Qi) Pill treats gout in the knees and lower back. Dr. Hú Chǔwàng had a condition where his hands and feet were swollen and painful, resembling peaches and plums, and was fully cured after taking this.

Ingredients include:

  • Yú (Insect Qi), a whole specimen
  • Bái fùzǐ (Latex of Raphanus)
  • Āwēi (Ferula), ground
  • Guìxīn (Cinnamon inner bark)
  • Bái zhǐ (Angelica dahurica), each one liǎng (50 grams)
  • Rǔxiāng (Frankincense) three fen
  • Dāngguī (Angelica sinensis)
  • Lòulú (Reeds)
  • Sháoyào (Peony)
  • Wēilíngxiān (Corydalis)
  • Dìgǔpí (Rehmannia root)
  • Chuān niúxī (Achyranthes)
  • Qiānghuó (Notopterygium)
  • Ānxíxiāng (Benzoin)
  • Táorén (Peach kernel), each one liǎng

The above sixteen ingredients, including the nine main components Yú, Táorén, Bái fùzǐ, Āwēi, Guìxīn, Bái zhǐ, Ānxíxiāng, Rǔxiāng, and Mòyào (Myrrh), are mixed with two shēng (approximately 400 ml) of the child’s urine and wine, stir-fried until hot, then allowed to cool. The residue is combined into a powder, formed into hollow pills the size of a marble, and taken with warm wine, without restriction on timing.[215p]

四肢门

　　　　方

　　柴胡升麻汤东垣，同　治男子妇人四肢发热，肌热筋骨热，表热如火燎，以手扪之烙人手。夫四肢者，属脾土也。热伏地中，此病多因血虚而得之。又有胃虚，过食冷物，郁遏阳气于脾土之中，此药主之。　　防风二钱五分　升麻　葛根　独活　羌活　白芍药　人参各五钱　炙甘草　柴胡各三钱　生甘草二钱　　右(口父)咀，每服五钱，水二大盏，煎至一盏，去滓热服。忌寒冷之物。[216p]

Comprehensive Compendium of Books from Ancient and Modern Times, Volume 193

Four Limbs Section

Prescription

Chaihu Shengma Decoction by Dongyuan, for treating both men and women with fever in the limbs, hot muscles, and heated bones. The exterior feels as if it is scorched by fire, and can be felt with the hand as if burned. The four limbs are associated with the Spleen and Earth. When heat is trapped in the ground, this illness often arises from blood deficiency. Additionally, there may be stomach deficiency and excessive consumption of cold foods, which obstructs Yang energy within the Spleen and Earth. This medicine addresses the condition.

Ingredients:

  • Fangfeng (Siler) 2.5 taels
  • Shengma (Rhizoma Cimicifugae) 5 taels
  • Gegen (Pueraria) 5 taels
  • Duhuo (Angelica) 5 taels
  • Qianghuo (Notopterygium) 5 taels
  • Baishao (White Peony) 5 taels
  • Renshen (Ginseng) 5 taels
  • Zhi gan cao (Honey-fried Licorice) 3 taels
  • Chaihu (Bupleurum) 3 taels
  • Sheng gan cao (Raw Licorice) 2 taels

Use the above ingredients, work them into a powder, take 5 taels with 2 large cups of water, boil until reduced to 1 cup, strain, and take warm. Avoid cold substances.[216p]

　　火郁汤　治五心烦热，是火郁于地中，四肢乃脾土，心火下陷于脾土中，郁而不得伸也。经云：火郁则发之。　　升麻　葛根　柴胡　白芍药各一两　防风　甘草各五钱　　右(口父)咀，每服五钱，水二大盏，入连须葱白三寸，煎至一盏，去滓，稍热，不拘时候服。
　　除湿补气汤　治两腿麻木，沉重无力，多汗喜笑，口中涎下，身重如山，语声不出，寸脉洪大。　　升麻六钱　苍朮四钱　黄蘗酒浸，炒　柴胡　黄芪各三钱　知母酒浸，炒　槁本　生甘草　当归各二钱　五味子　陈皮各一钱五分　　右銼，如麻豆大，每服五钱，水二盏，煎至一盏，去滓，空心服之。待少时，以早饭下之。[217p]

Fire Stagnation Decoction treats the vexation and heat of the five hearts. This is due to fire stagnating in the earth; the limbs represent the spleen's earth. Heart fire sinks into the spleen's earth, becoming stagnant and unable to extend. The classics say: "When fire is stagnant, it must be released."

For the ingredients:

  • 1 tael each of Sheng Ma, Ge Gen, Chai Hu, and Bai Shao Yao;
  • 5 qian each of Fang Feng and Gan Cao.

Crush the above, and for each dose, use 5 qian with 2 large bowls of water, adding 3 inches of onion white. Boil until reduced to 1 bowl, strain, warm slightly, and take at any time.

Removing Dampness and Supplementing Qi Decoction treats leg numbness, heaviness without strength, excessive sweating, joyfulness, salivation, a heavy body like a mountain, and a voice that doesn't come out, with a pulse that is large and soft.

For the ingredients:

  • 6 qian of Sheng Ma;
  • 4 qian of Cang Zhu;
  • 3 qian each of Chai Hu and Huang Qi (fried in yellow vine liquor);
  • 2 qian each of Jizhi Ben, Sheng Gan Cao, and Dang Gui;
  • 1.5 qian each of Wu Wei Zi and Chen Pi.

Grind these to the size of large mung beans. For each dose, take 5 qian with 2 bowls of water, boil until reduced to 1 bowl, strain, and take on an empty stomach. Wait a little while, then follow with breakfast.[217p]

　　人参益气汤　治两手指麻木，四肢困倦，怠惰嗜卧，乃热伤元气也。　　黄芪八钱　生甘草　人参各五钱　白芍三钱　炙甘草　升麻各二钱　五味子一百四十个　柴胡二钱五分　　右(口父)咀，分作四服，每服水二盏，煎至一盏，去滓，稍热，食远服。
　　导气汤　治两腿麻木沉重。
　　黄芪八钱　甘草六钱　青皮四钱　升麻　柴胡　当归梢　泽泻各二钱　红花　橘皮各一钱　五味子一百二十个　　右(口父)咀，分作四服，每服水二大盏，煎至一盏，去滓，食前热服。
　　补中汤　治面黄汗多，目赤，四肢沉重，食减腹中时时痛，咳嗽，两手寸脉短，右手脉弦细兼濇，关脉虚。　　升麻　柴胡　当归身各二分　神曲三分炒　泽泻四分　红花少许　大麦曲　苍朮各五分　黄芪二钱五分　炙甘草八分　五味子二十个　　右(口父)咀，分作二服，水二盏，煎至一盏，去滓，食远服。[218p]

Ginseng Beneficial Qi Decoction
For treating numbness in the fingers, fatigue in the limbs, laziness, and excessive sleeping, which are caused by heat injuring the original Qi.

  • Huang Qi (Astragalus) 8 qian
  • Sheng Gan Cao (Raw Licorice) 5 qian
  • Ren Shen (Ginseng) 5 qian
  • Bai Shao (White Peony) 3 qian
  • Zhi Gan Cao (Honey-fried Licorice) 2 qian
  • Sheng Ma (Cimicifuga) 2 qian
  • Chai Hu (Bupleurum) 2.5 qian
  • Wu Wei Zi (Schisandra) 140 pieces

Crush the ingredients above and divide into four doses. For each dose, use 2 sheng of water, decoct to 1 sheng, strain, slightly warm, and take before meals.

Qi Guiding Decoction
For treating numbness and heaviness in the legs.

  • Huang Qi (Astragalus) 8 qian
  • Gan Cao (Licorice) 6 qian
  • Qing Pi (Green Tangerine Peel) 4 qian
  • Sheng Ma (Cimicifuga) 2 qian
  • Chai Hu (Bupleurum) 2 qian
  • Dang Gui Shao (Angelica) 2 qian
  • Ze Xie (Alisma) 2 qian
  • Hong Hua (Safflower) 1 qian
  • Ju Pi (Tangerine Peel) 1 qian
  • Wu Wei Zi (Schisandra) 120 pieces

Crush the ingredients above and divide into four doses. For each dose, use 2 da sheng of water, decoct to 1 sheng, strain, and take hot before meals.

Middle Supplementing Decoction
For treating pale complexion, excessive sweating, red eyes, heaviness in the limbs, reduced appetite, regular abdominal pains, coughing, and short pulse in both hands. The right hand pulse is thin and choppy, and the guan pulse is weak.

  • Sheng Ma (Cimicifuga) 2 fen
  • Chai Hu (Bupleurum) 2 fen
  • Dang Gui Shen (Angelica) 2 fen
  • Shen Qu (Medicated Leaven) 3 fen, roasted
  • Ze Xie (Alisma) 4 fen
  • Hong Hua (Safflower) a little
  • Da Mai Qu (Barley Ferment) 5 fen
  • Cang Zhu (Atractylodes) 5 fen
  • Huang Qi (Astragalus) 2 qian 5 fen
  • Zhi Gan Cao (Honey-fried Licorice) 8 fen
  • Wu Wei Zi (Schisandra) 20 pieces

Crush the ingredients above and divide into two doses. For each dose, use 2 sheng of water, decoct to 1 sheng, strain, and take before meals.[218p]

Sheng Yang Yi Wei Decoction: Treats spleen and stomach deficiency, lethargy and a tendency to sleep, with limbs that do not retract.

Ingredients:

  • Astragalus (Huangqi) 2 taels
  • Pinellia (Banzhu) - if symptoms of phlegm are present, use
  • Ginseng (Renshen) and licorice (Gancao), both 1 tael

  • Tangerine peel (Jùzǐ) 4 qian

  • Coptis (Huánglián) 1 qian

Combine all ingredients, roughly ground. For each dose, take 3 qian, add 3 cups of water, 5 slices of ginger, and 2 jujubes; simmer until reduced to 1 cup, strain and take warm. After breakfast, the dose may be increased to 5 qian.

  • Hair (about the thickness of a finger)

Experience with Prevention and Treatment

Treatment for pain in the legs after dysentery, appearing like a cut or bite from a tiger, with swollen knees, making walking difficult, known as Crane Knee Wind.

  • Aconite, soaked in children’s urine for three days, processed, 4.5 grams; in winter, 6 grams.
  • Crush together, make into a plaster, with three slices of ginger and two dates, decoct in water and take.

Five Beast Three Preservation Pills

To treat depletion of blood and qi, insufficiency of liver and kidney, with weak and soft legs.

  • Deer antler, Qi Lin horn, tiger femur, cowherb, and golden hair dog spine, each in equal parts, these are the five beasts;
  • One piece of aconite, skin removed, center dug out, filled with realgar;
  • One piece of papaya, skin removed, center dug out, inside which the aconite is placed and covered with aconite powder, this is the three preservations.
  • Place the three preservations in a clay jar, steam in heavy water until very soft, take out and mix with the five beasts, rolling into pills the size of chestnuts, to be taken with papaya wine.

Continuation of Bone Elixir
This is for treating weakness in the legs, fatigue and lack of strength, as well as for children who cannot walk. Use the following ingredients:

  • Tianma (Gastrodia elata) that is clear and pure, soak in wine
  • Bai Fuzi (White Aconite)
  • Niuxi (Achyranthes root)
  • Chuan Qianghuo (Notopterygium root)
  • Mubeizi (Tuckahoe) — each half a liang (about 15 grams)
  • Wutou (Aconite) — 1 qian (about 3 grams),
  • Zhushah (cinnabar) — 1 qian,
  • Ruxiang (Frankincense) and Moyi (Myrrh) — each 2 qian,
  • Dilo (earthworm) after removing soil — 1 fen (about 1 gram).

Combine with 1 liang of fresh Nansheng (Aristolochia) powder. Cook with ash-free wine until it forms a paste, then make into pills the size of a chicken head, coat with cinnabar. Each pill can be ground with mint tea and taken before meals.

Mulberry Branch Decoction
This treats weakness in the knees and legs caused by wind.
Use 3 sheng (about 720 ml) of mulberry branches, fresh Fuzhi (Aconite) — 5 liang,
and 1 sheng each of eggplant root and black beans. Combine these four ingredients, add 3 dou (about 6 liters) of water, and boil down to 1 dou (about 2 liters). Strain out the dregs and boil down to 5 sheng (about 1.2 liters), then add the following powdered herbs:

  • Shihu (Dendrobium) with the roots removed,
  • Tianxiong (Aconite) that is pounded and peeled,
  • Tianma,
  • Niuxi,
  • Chuanqiang,
  • Gui Xin (Cinnamon bark) — each 2 liang.

Grind these into powder and mix into the previous decoction. In a silver pot, simmer over low heat, constantly stirring with a willow wood spatula until it reaches a syrupy consistency. Store in a ceramic box. Every day, on an empty stomach, mix with hot wine and take with a teaspoon, and it is especially effective if taken again before the evening meal.[225p]

　　苍朮散　治风湿，常服壮筋骨健步。　　苍朮一斤，用粟米泔水浸过，用竹刀刮去筋皮，以童子小便浸半斤；无灰好酒浸半斤。　　右浸至春五日，夏三日，秋七日，冬十日，取出苍朮于净地上掘一坑，以炭火煅坑红去炭，将浸苍朮酒小便倾在坑内，却放苍朮在坑内，以瓦器盖覆，用泥封固，经一宿，取出苍朮，研为细末，每服二钱，空心盐汤或酒调服。
　　乳香没药丸　治远年近日，风湿脚气攻注脚膝，或肿或疼，筋挛不能屈伸，脚不能踏地，及一切疼痛，往来不已。　　乳香别研　没药别研　骨碎补去毛　缩砂仁　五灵脂去土　白附子　甜瓜子　牛膝酒浸　当归酒炒　木瓜　地龙去土木鳖子各一两　白牵牛三两，微炒　　右为细末，酒煮面糊为丸，如梧桐子大，每服二十丸，木瓜汤下，或温酒亦可，不拘时服。[226p]

Cangzhu Powder treats wind and dampness, and regular consumption strengthens muscles and bones, enhancing walking. Use one pound of Cangzhu, soak it in millet waste water, scrape off the sinews and skins with a bamboo knife, and then soak half a pound in the urine of a young boy; soak another half pound in good wine without ash. Soak according to the seasons: five days in spring, three days in summer, seven days in autumn, and ten days in winter. After soaking, take the Cangzhu out and dig a pit on clean ground, use charcoal fire to heat the pit until red, then pour the soaked Cangzhu wine and urine into the pit. Place the Cangzhu inside, cover it with a clay vessel, seal it with mud, and let it rest overnight. Afterward, take out the Cangzhu, grind it into a fine powder, and take two qian with warm salt water or wine.

Frankincense and Myrrh Pill treats long-term and recent issues like wind and dampness affecting the feet and knees, causing swelling or pain, with muscles cramping and unable to bend or stretch, preventing the foot from touching the ground, and any form of unbearable pain. Grind frankincense separately, grind myrrh separately, prepare one ounce of bone fragments without hair, one ounce of cardamom, one ounce of five spices without soil, one ounce of white zhuzi, one ounce of sweet melon seeds, soak ox knee in wine, stir-fry angelica in wine, one ounce of papaya, and one ounce of earthworm cleaned of soil, and one ounce of lucerne, lightly stir-fried. Grind all into a fine powder, boil with wine to form a paste for pills the size of a zelkova seed. Take twenty pills each time, swallow with papaya soup or warm wine, and there are no restrictions on when to take them.[226p]

　　上马丸　治寒湿臂痛腿疼筋骨诸疾。　　川乌炮　木香各半两　虎骨酥炙　当归酒浸　牛膝　杜仲　木瓜　龟板酥炙　白然铜酢淬　黄芪蜜炙　白朮各一两　　右为细末，炼蜜为丸，如梧桐子大，每服三四十丸，温酒下。
　　防风汤　治脚气痹弱，神验。
　　防风　防己　蜀椒　细辛　桂心　麻黄　石膏　独活　黄芩　茵芋　葛根　芎藭　芍药　甘草各一两　生姜　茯苓各二两　乌头二枚　　右(口父)咀，以竹沥一斗，煮取四升，分作六服，令一日一夜服尽，其间可常作赤小豆饮。有人脚弱，先服常用竹沥汤四剂，未觉增损，作此方后，觉得力。又云：脉沉细快风在内者，作此汤也。一方无竹沥、赤小豆，每服三钱，水一大盏，生姜三片，煎至七分，去滓，不拘时温服。[227p]

Shangma Pill: Treats cold and damp-related pain in the arms and legs and other ailments.

Fangfeng Decoction: Treats foot qi obstruction and weakness, with remarkable efficacy.
Ingredients:

  • One tael each of Fangfeng (Saposhnikovia), Fangji (Stephania), Shu Jiao (Zanthoxylum), Xixin (Asarum), Gui Xin (Cinnamon heart), Ma Huang (Ephedra), Shigao (Gypsum), Duhuo (Angelica), Huangqin (Scutellaria), Yin Yu (Artemisia), Gegen (Pueraria), Chuanxiong (Ligusticum), Shaoyao (Paeonia), and Licorice.
  • Two taels each of fresh ginger and Fuling (Poria).
  • Two pieces of Wu Tou (Aconitum).

Prepare by chewing the above and boiling with one dou (approx. 10 liters) of bamboo juice until reduced to four sheng (approx. 1 liter), dividing into six doses to be taken over a day and a night. During this period, one may regularly consume adzuki bean tea.

If someone experiences weakness in the feet, they should first take four doses of the commonly used bamboo juice soup, and if they don't notice any change, then use this formula to feel stronger. It is also said: if the pulse is deep, thin, and quick, indicating internal wind, this decoction is recommended. If one lacks bamboo juice and adzuki beans, take three qian (approx. 10 grams) with a large cup of water, three slices of fresh ginger, and boil down to seven parts, strain, and take warm at any time.[227p]

Qinhu Dan: Treats wind, cold, dampness, and joint pain, as well as serious conditions affecting the legs and lower back. Qianghuo San: Treats cold and numbness in the waist and legs, as well as various wind and numbness diseases, bone and marrow pain, loss of appetite, and gradual weight loss. Ingredients include: Qianghuo, Five-Flavor Cortex (of Schisandra), roasted Jujube seeds, and Cassia Heart, two taels each; Fangfeng, roasted Angelica, Red Peony Root, and Danshen (Salvia miltiorrhiza), three taels each; two fen of Yinyu, and one tael each of Niuxi, prepared Fuzi with skin and navel removed, and Luoluo. 　　萆薢丸　治腰脚冷痹，沉重无力。

　　熏蒸法　治肾气衰弱，脾肾肝三经受风寒湿，停于腿膝，使经络凝而不行，变成脚痹，故发疼痛，此药和荣卫，通经络。　　小椒　盐各一把　葱三大握，切　小麦麸五升　酒一盏　　右以酢不拘多少，日搅拌上件等，湿润为度，用银器炒令极热，摊卧榻下，将所患腿脚，就卧熏蒸，薄衣被盖，得汗出匀遍，约半个时辰，撤去炒麸，止就铺褥中卧，待一两时辰，觉汗稍解，再用收阳粉扑敷汗孔毕，然后出铺卧中，勿见风。[229p]

Biqi Pill: Treats cold and numbness in the waist and legs, resulting in heaviness and lack of strength.

Steaming Method: Treats weakness of kidney energy, and the spleen, kidney, and liver meridians affected by wind, cold, and dampness, which accumulate in the legs and knees, causing stagnation of the meridians and resulting in leg numbness and pain. This medicine nourishes the body and unblocks the meridians.
Ingredients:

  • One handful each of small pepper and salt
  • Three large handfuls of scallions, chopped
  • Five liters of wheat bran
  • One cup of wine

Combine above ingredients with vinegar to appropriate moisture, stirring daily. Fry in a silver vessel until very hot. Spread beneath a bed, placing the affected legs under the steam. Cover with thin clothing and blanket, allowing for uniform sweating for about half an hour. Remove the fried bran, lie down on bedding, and rest for one to two hours. Once sweating subsides, apply Yang-receiving powder to the sweat pores, then return to rest in bed, avoiding exposure to wind.[229p]

　　通痹散　治腰以下至足，感受风寒湿三者，合而成痹，两足至膝冷如冰，不能自举，或因酒热，立冷水中，久成此疾。　　独活　川芎　天麻　当归　白朮各等分　　右为细末，每服二钱，食前用好酒调服。
　　六生散　治周痹身体疼痛，腰脚(疒帬)痹。　　生石菖蒲九节者，去毛，切，焙　生地黄切，焙　生商陆根洗净切，焙　生枸杞根切，焙，各一斤　生姜去皮切，焙，二斤　生乌头去皮脐，四两　　右先焙了，各秤分两，复以醇酒一斗五升，浸一宿，滤出曝干，复内酒中，再曝干，捣为细末，每服半钱，以清酒一盏调下，渐加至一钱，空心临卧各一服。[230p]

Tong Bi San: This treats bi syndrome from the waist down to the feet caused by the combined effects of wind, cold, and dampness. Liu Sheng San: This treats body aches from bi syndrome and joint pain in the waist and legs. Ingredients: Fresh Shi Chang Pu (nine-section) cleaned and chopped, roasted; Fresh Di Huang cut and roasted; Fresh Shang Lu root cleaned and chopped, roasted; Fresh Goji root chopped, roasted, all at 1 jin each; Fresh ginger peeled and chopped, roasted, 2 jin; Fresh Wu Tou peeled and de-germed, 4 liang. 　　木瓜牛膝丸　治寒湿脚气，冷湿下注，脚弱无力，及肾经虚弱，腰膝沉重，腿脚肿急筋挛，或时疼痛，步履艰难，大小便不利，日见倦乏。　　木瓜　川牛膝去芦浸　当归去尾　石楠藤　乌药　熟地黄　肉苁蓉酒浸，焙　杏仁去皮尖　陈皮去白　黑牵牛炒　续断　赤芍药各等分　　右为细末，酒糊为丸，如梧桐子大，每服三十丸，空心用木瓜煎汤送下，盐汤亦可。未效，用羌活木瓜酒浸，或加牛膝同浸，温暖一盏许送下。
　　抱龙丸　治肝肾脏虚，风湿寒邪，流注腿膝，行步艰难，渐成风湿脚气，足心如火，上气喘急，小腹不仁，不食。　　赤小豆四两　白胶香另研　破故纸炒　狗脊　木鳖子去壳另研　海桐皮　威灵仙　草乌以盐炒熟，去盐不用　五灵脂炒地龙去土炒，各一两　　右为细末，酒糊和丸桐子大，辰砂为衣，每服五十丸，空心用盐酒任下。临晚食前，再进一服。[234p]

Mugua Niuxi Pills: Treats cold and damp foot skin conditions, with cold moisture descending, weak and powerless feet, and weak kidney channels. Symptoms include heavy waist and knees, swollen legs and feet with sudden cramps, occasional pain, difficulty walking, and poor urination and defecation, leading to increasing fatigue.

Ingredients:

  • Mugua
  • Chuan Niuxi (removed from the reeds)
  • Danggui (removed the tail)
  • Shinan Vine
  • Wuyang
  • Cooked Dihuang
  • Rou Congrong (marinated in wine, roasted)
  • Almonds (peeled)
  • Aged tangerine peel (white part removed)
  • Black Qianqiu (stir-fried)
  • Xuduan
  • Chi Shaoyao (each equal portions)

Grind the above into a fine powder, mix with wine to form pills the size of a phoenix seed. Take thirty pills each time, delivered with a decoction of mugua on an empty stomach; salty soup is also acceptable. If ineffective, soak Qianghuo and mugua in wine, or add niuxi for soaking, and take with warm water.

Baolong Pills: Treats liver and kidney deficiency, wind, damp, and cold pathogens, leading to flowing conditions in legs and knees, difficulty in walking, gradually causing wind-damp foot conditions, burning sensation in the soles, shortness of breath, numbness in the lower abdomen, and poor appetite.

Ingredients:

  • Chi Xiaodou (4 taels)
  • White gelatinous resin (ground separately)
  • Poge Zhi (stir-fried)
  • Gouxizi
  • Mupizi (shelled and ground separately)
  • Haitian Skin
  • Weilingxian
  • Caowu (salt-fried, salt removed)
  • Wuling Zhi (stir-fried) and Dilu (soil removed), each 1 tael.

Grind the above into a fine powder, mix with wine to form pills the size of phoenix seeds, coated in cinnabar. Take fifty pills each time, delivered with salty wine on an empty stomach. An additional dose can be taken before late meals.[234p]

　　大鳖甲汤　治脚弱风毒，挛痹气上，及伤寒恶风温毒，山水瘴气热毒，四肢痹弱。　　鳖甲二两　防风　麻黄　白朮　石膏　知母　升麻　茯苓　橘皮　芎藭　杏仁去皮尖　人参　半夏　当归　芍药　萎蕤　甘草　麦门冬各一两　羚羊角屑六铢　大黄一两半　犀角屑　雄黄　青木香各半两　大枣十枚　贝齿　乌头七枚生姜三两　薤白十四枚　麝香三铢　赤小豆三合　吴茱萸五合　以水二斗，煮取四升，分六服，去滓，食前温服，如人行十里久，得下止。一方用大黄半两煨，畏下可止用六铢。一方用羚羊角半两，毒盛可用十八铢。胡洽有山茱萸半升，为三十二铢。《千金翼方》、无知母、升麻、橘皮、芎藭、人参、当归、萎蕤。[235p]

Giant Softshell Turtle Shell Decoction treats weakness in the legs, wind toxins, tightness and numbness due to Qi rising, as well as wind-cold and warm toxins in cases of sudden cold, and heat toxins from marshy waters, resulting in weakness and numbness in the limbs.

Ingredients:

  • 2 taels of turtle shell

  • 1 tael each of:

    • Ledebouriella
    • Ephedra
    • Atractylodes macrocephala
    • Gypsum
    • Anemarrhena
    • Cimicifuga
    • Poria
    • Tangerine peel
    • Chuanxiong
    • Skinned apricot kernels
    • Ginseng
    • Pinellia
    • Angelica sinensis
    • Peony
    • Astilbe
    • Licorice
    • Ophiopogon

  • 6 zhū of antelope horn shavings

    • Rhinoceros horn shavings
    • Realgar

  • 10 jujubes

  • 7 fresh aconite tubers

  • 3 cups of red beans

  • 5 cups of Evodia

Boil in 2 douches of water to yield 4 sheng, divide into six doses, discarding the dregs, and take warm before meals. If one has walked for a long distance (ten miles), taking this will help ease symptoms.

There is a variant using half a tael of rhubarb, adjusting dosage if there is a risk of diarrhea to 6 zhū. Another variant uses half a tael of antelope horn in cases of severe toxins, with a dosage of 18 zhū. Hu Qia has half a sheng of Shan Zhi Yu at 32 zhū. "Thousand Gold’s Winged Supplement" notes excluding Anemarrhena, Cimicifuga, tangerine peel, Chuanxiong, ginseng, Angelica sinensis, and Astilbe.[235p]

　　麻黄汤　治恶风毒气，脚弱无力，顽痹，四肢不仁，失音不能言，毒气冲心。有人病者，但其病相当，即服此第一方，次服第二、第三、第四方。　　麻黄一两　杏仁三十枚　防风　白朮　当归　升麻　芍药　芎藭　黄芩　桂心　麦门冬　甘草各二两　茯苓三两大枣二十枚　　右(口父)咀，以水九升，清酒二升合煮，取二升半，分四服，日三夜一，覆令小汗，粉之，莫令见风。[236p]

Mahuang Decoction treats severe wind and toxic气, weakness and lack of strength in the legs, stubborn numbness, numbness in the limbs, loss of voice and inability to speak, and毒气 attacking the heart. For those with illness, if the symptoms match, take this primary formula first, followed by the second, third, and fourth formulas.

Ingredients:

  • 1 tael Mahuang
  • 30 pieces of apricot kernel
  • 2 taels each of Fangfeng, Baizhu, Danggui, Shengma, Shaoyao, Chuanxiong, Huangqin, Guixin, Maidong, and Gancao
  • 3 taels Fuling
  • 20 pieces of dates

Prepare by grinding the above (coarsely), using 9 sheng of water and 2 sheng of clear wine, boil together and take 2.5 sheng, dividing it into four doses, taken three times during the day and once at night, causing a light sweat. Powder it and avoid exposure to wind.[236p]

　　第二服独活汤
　　独活四两　熟地黄三两　生姜五两　葛根　桂心　甘草　芍药　麻黄各二两　　右(口父)咀，以水八升，清酒二升，合煎，取二升半，分四服，日三夜一。脚弱特忌食瓠子、蕺菜，犯之一世治不愈。
　　第三服兼补厚朴汤　并治诸气咳嗽，逆气呕吐。　　厚朴　芎藭　桂心　熟地黄　芍药　当归　人参各二两　黄芪　甘草各三两　吴茱萸　半夏七两　生姜一斤　　右(口父)咀，以水二斗，煮猪蹄一具，取汁一斗二升，去上肥并肉，入清酒三升合煮，取三升，分四服，相去如人行二十里久，更进服。[237p]

Second Prescription: Du Huo Decoction
Four liang of Du Huo, three liang of cooked Rehmannia, five liang of fresh ginger, two liang each of Kudzu root, Cinnamon heart, Honey-fried Licorice, Peony root, and Ephedra. Crush these ingredients, using eight sheng of water and two sheng of clear rice wine, boil together to yield two and a half sheng. Divide into four doses, taking three doses during the day and one at night. Those with weak feet should especially avoid eating bottle gourd and pigweed; if consumed, it may result in a chronic condition that is difficult to treat for a lifetime.

Third Prescription: Combined Supplement with Hou Po Decoction
Treats various coughs and the counterflow of qi leading to vomiting. Two liang each of Magnolia Bark, Cyperus, Cinnamon heart, cooked Rehmannia, Peony root, Angelica, and Ginseng; three liang each of Astragalus and Honey-fried Licorice; seven liang of Wu Zhu Yu; one jin of fresh ginger. Crush these ingredients, using two dou of water to cook a whole pig trotter, extracting one dou and two sheng of broth. Remove the top fat and meat, add three sheng of clear rice wine, and boil together to yield three sheng. Divide into four doses, taking them like a person traveling twenty li for a while before taking the next dose.[237p]

　　第四服兼补风引独活汤
　　独活四两　茯苓　甘草各三两　升麻一两半　大豆二升　人参　桂心　防风　当归　芍药　黄芪　干姜　附子各二两　　右十三味，(口父)咀，以水九升，清酒三升，合煮三升半，分四服，相去如人行二十里久，更进服。
　　酒浸牛膝丸 【《本事方》】 　治腰脚筋骨酸无力。　　牛膝三两，炙黄　川椒半两，去目并合口者　附子一个，炮去皮脐　虎胫骨真者半两，酢炙黄　　右(口父)咀，用生绢作袋，入药扎口，用煮酒一斗，春秋浸十日，夏浸七日，冬浸十四日。每日空心饮一大盏，酒尽出药为末，酢糊为丸，每服二十丸，空心温酒盐汤任下。忌动风等物。
　　透骨丹　专治脚气。
　　川乌炮　羌活　沉香　乳香研　川芎　槟榔　木瓜各一两　木香一两半　白茯苓二两　　右为细末，面糊和丸如梧桐子大，每服六十丸，食前用生姜汤送下。[238p]

Fourth Decoction Combining Treatment for Wind with Du Huo Decoction
Du Huo: 4 taels, Poria, Licorice: each 3 taels, Angelica: 1.5 taels, Soybeans: 2 sheng, Ginseng, Cinnamon, Fang Feng, Angelica Sinensis, Peony, Astragalus, Dried Ginger, Aconite: each 2 taels. Combine these thirteen ingredients, pound them well, add 9 sheng of water and 3 sheng of clear wine, and boil down to 3.5 sheng. Separate into four doses, allowing each dose to be taken as one walks for about 20 miles; then continue with the next dose.

Wine-Soaked Niuxi Pills [from Benshi Fang]
Treats weakness and soreness in the waist and joints.
Niuxi: 3 taels; roasted Yellow: 0.5 tael, remove the eyes and combine with: Aconite: 1 piece, remove skin and navel; True Tiger Leg Bone: 0.5 tael, vinegar-roasted Yellow. Pound these ingredients, and use raw silk to make a bag, place the medicine inside and tie it up. Soak in 10 dou of boiling wine in spring and autumn for 10 days, for 7 days in summer, and for 14 days in winter. Take one large cup on an empty stomach daily. When the wine is exhausted, grind the medicine into powder and form it into pills, taking 20 pills each time, with warm wine or salty soup. Avoid actions that disturb the wind and similar things.

Tongue-Permeating Pill
Specifically treats athlete’s foot.
Prepare: Sichuan Aconite, Qiang Huo, Sandalwood, Frankincense, Chuanxiong, Betel nut, Papaya: each 1 tael; Wood Fragrance: 1.5 taels; White Poria: 2 taels. Make these into a fine powder, mix with flour to form pills the size of wu-tong seeds. Take 60 pills before meals, using raw ginger soup to wash them down.[238p]

　　五斤丸　治筋不足，腰脚缓弱，行步艰难，一切寒湿脚气。　　没药另研　川乌炮去皮脐　虎骨酥炙令黄色　山药各四两　天麻切焙　川牛膝去芦，酒浸　肉苁蓉酒浸，焙　木瓜各一斤　　右为细末，将木瓜烂蒸，研作糊，和药末，如不就，更用原浸牛膝酒，打糊搜和，杵一二千下，丸如梧桐子大，每服五十丸，食前用温酒或盐汤送下。
　　四斤丸　治肾经虚寒，下攻腰脚，筋脉拘挛，掣痛不已，履地艰辛，脚心隐痛，及风寒湿痹亦皆治之。　　木瓜　天麻　牛膝　肉苁蓉各焙一斤　已上四味，用无灰酒五斤浸，春秋各五日，夏三日，冬十日，取出焙干，再入附子，炮去皮脐二两，虎骨酥炙一两，同为细末，用浸药酒，煮面糊和丸，如梧桐子大，每服五十丸，空心煎木瓜酒盐汤任下。常服补虚除湿，大壮筋骨。[239p]

Five Jin Pill: Treats insufficient tendons, weak waist and legs, difficulty in walking, and all cold and damp foot conditions.

Ingredients:

  • Myrrh, ground separately
  • Prepared Chuanwu (black aconite) with skin and navel removed
  • Tiger bone, roasted to a yellow color
  • 4 taels of Dioscorea (yams)
  • Tianma (Gastrodia) cut and roasted
  • Chuan Niu Xi (stephania) with the leaf removed, soaked in wine
  • Rou Cong Rong (horny goat weed) soaked in wine and roasted
  • 1 jin of papaya

Instructions: Grind the above into a fine powder. Steam the papaya until soft, mash it into a paste, and mix with the medicinal powder. If needed, use the original Niu Xi wine to adjust the paste consistency, pound it 1,000 to 2,000 times, and shape into pills the size of Chinese parasol seeds. Take 50 pills each time, using warm wine or salted broth before meals.

Four Jin Pill: Treats kidney channel deficiency and cold, attacks on waist and legs, stiffness and pain in the tendons, difficulty standing, hidden pain in the soles of the feet, as well as wind, cold, and dampness disorders.

Ingredients:

  • Papaya, Tianma, Niu Xi, and Rou Cong Rong, each roasted to 1 jin

Instructions: Soak the four ingredients in 5 jins of non-ash wine for 5 days in spring and autumn, 3 days in summer, and 10 days in winter. Use the soaked medicinal wine to cook into a paste, form into pills the size of Chinese parasol seeds. Take 50 pills on an empty stomach with boiled papaya wine and salted broth. Regular consumption replenishes deficiency, removes dampness, and strongly strengthens tendons and bones.[239p]

  • Líng Yáng Jiǎo, powdered: 1 tael
  • Bái Zhī Lǐ, toasted and dehorned: 1 tael
  • Hēi Shēn: 0.3 taels

These are ground into a fine powder, mixed, and then shaped into pills with honey the size of a wu-tong seed. Take 20 pills after meals, using warm water thrice a day and once a night.

　　立效散　疗脚气攻心。

Lixiao San - Treatment for Athlete's Foot Attacking the Heart.

Large areca nuts, seven pieces; two taels of fresh ginger; one tael each of tangerine peel, Wu Zhu Yu (lugol), Zi Su (perilla), and papaya. Chop all into small pieces, then boil with two liters of water until reduced to one liter and two cups, taking in divided doses.

Cortex Cistanche and Achyranthes Bidentata Pill - Treatment for Athlete’s Foot.

Clean and dry meat cistanche; dry and chop Achyranthes bidentata; clean and dry Tian Ma (gastrodia); grind all mentioned into small pieces. Using three liters of wine, seal in a bottle, and take out after spring for five days, summer for three, autumn for seven, and winter for ten days; dry it to a powder. Select and wash Goji berries, honey-fried Astragalus, tiger bone soaked in wine and roasted. Prepare each of these in equal parts, two taels. Grind everything finely and mix well; using the previously soaked medicinal wine, make a dough to form pills the size of a phoenix seed. Dry these and take three to fifty pills before meals, washed down with warm wine or clear broth.

Frankincense and Papaya Pill - Specifically Treats Long-term Recent Athlete’s Foot.

Grind frankincense separately; grind blood resin separately, in equal parts. Mix thoroughly with one papaya, using a bamboo knife to remove the skin and core, take the top cover off, mix in the powdered medicine until full, put the top cover back on, wrap it in dough about half a finger thick, and cook in a clay pot until thoroughly soft. Pound it in a stone mortar until it becomes a paste, making pills the size of a phoenix seed. Start with thirty-nine pills, gradually increasing to forty, taken on an empty stomach with warm wine or papaya soup. Avoid moving air, cold, damp, and oily foods.[243p]

　　独活酒　治腰脚屈弱，兼头眩气满。　　独活　石斛　生姜一本用干姜　白茯苓赤者亦可　白朮各三两　牛膝　丹参　侧子炮去皮脐　萆薢各二两　薏苡仁　防风　桂心　人参　当归切焙　山茱萸　秦艽　天雄炮去皮脐　甘菊花　芎藭各一两半　生地黄四两，焙　　右细銼，用绢袋盛，内净磁瓮中，以清酒三斗渍之，密封，春夏五日，秋冬七日，取开量情饮之，日五六服，常令酒力不绝。如冷，加蜀椒一两，去目并合口者，炒出汗。脚弱痛甚者作散，每服三钱，酒调下。[244p]

Gān Biē Sàn - Treatment for athlete's foot.
Remove the shells from two wood locust fruits, one male and one female. Take one liang of linked sweet dates. Grind these into fine powder. Take two pig kidneys, split them open, mix one qian of the powdered medicine inside, wrap in paper, and steam over fire until cooked. Allow to cool. At the beginning of the fifth watch, chew finely and wash down with rice soup. If the left foot is afflicted, use the left kidney; if the right foot, use the right kidney. Only one qian of the powdered medicine is needed.

Dú Huó Jiǔ - Treatment for weak knees and feet, accompanied by dizziness and fullness in the head.
Use three liang each of Duhuo, Dendrobium, white peony, and white Atractylodes. Use two liang each of Oxtongue, Salvia, and Cibotium (with skin and navel removed). Two liang of Spurling and Coix seeds, and one and a half liang each of Siler, Cassia, Ginseng, and prepared Angelica. Four liang of fried Rehmannia, finely shaved. Place the mixture in a silk bag and store it in a clean ceramic jar. Soak in three dou of clear wine, seal tightly. In spring and summer, leave for five days; in autumn and winter, seven days. Decant and drink according to need, five to six doses each day, ensuring the potency of the wine does not diminish. If cold, add one liang of Sichuan pepper, removing eyes and closing the mouth, and stir to induce sweating. For severe weakness and pain in the feet, make a powder, taking three qian each time, mixed with wine to consume.[244p]

　　辰砂丹　治足掌疼。

Cinnabar pills treat pain in the soles of the feet. Cinnabar and scorpion venom, each one qian; frankincense and musk, half a qian each. Five-leaved acanthopanax pills treat foot problems where the skin feels numb, and symptoms fluctuate. Chenxiang Pills are used to treat wind toxin foot sores, which attack the internal organs, spreading into the limbs, causing weakness and swelling.

For the recipe: take one sheng of small black soybeans, two liang of aconite (washed of its skin and navel, cut), soak it in Wu zhu yu decoction and roast; eight liang each of Qingjuzi peel soaked and roasted. Four liang of fresh ginger, chopped finely.

Combine the above five ingredients in a cloth bag and place it in a large pot with ten dou of water; boil until the water is reduced and nearly dry, then take out the soybeans, dry them in the sun, and grind them into a powder. The other four ingredients are not needed at this stage.

Next, add the following ingredients: two liang each of white aconite (roasted), ba jian (cut and roasted), meat of cynomorium (cut and roasted), and agarwood. Also include one liang each of niu xi (shredded and soaked in wine, then roasted), du huo (prepped), hai tong pi (roasted), qing huo (prepared), shan yu, ze xie, xiong gen, and sheng di huang (cut and roasted).

Except for the first four ingredients, grind the remaining ingredients into a fine powder, mix well, and then knead with honey into pills the size of sycamore seeds. Take twenty pills at a time, with warm wine on an empty stomach, and repeat in the evening.[246p]

Chuanxiong Dafu Pi Powder treats athlete's foot, with symptoms of swelling, heaviness, and pain in the legs and feet due to dampness obstructing the meridians. This formula promotes the flow of the meridians, ensuring unobstructed circulation from top to bottom, balancing blood and qi, resulting in lightness and well-being in the legs and feet.

Ingredients:

  • Chuanxiong
  • Betel nut
  • Acanthopanax
  • Fried mulberry bark
  • Akebia
  • Fennel
  • Licorice
  • Perilla seeds
  • Aged tangerine peel (washed and toasted)
  • White Poria
  • Schizonepeta spikes
  • Perilla leaves

Each ingredient: 1 liang (50 grams). Dafuzi with skin: 3 liang (150 grams). Fried tangerine peel: ½ liang (25 grams). Dried papaya: 2.5 liang (125 grams).

Preparation: Mix, and take 5 qian (15 grams) with one bowl of water and five slices of fresh ginger, along with five large slices of radish. Boil until reduced to ¾ of a bowl, strain, and drink warm before meals, twice a day. After ten days, reduce to one dose daily, and stop upon recovery. If radish is unavailable, 1 qian (3 grams) of radish seeds, lightly toasted and crushed, can be substituted. If experiencing constipation, take a modified Shen Gong pill.

Sweet Bean Soup for treating athlete's foot:
1 liang (50 grams) of black beans and ½ liang (25 grams) of licorice. Boil together as a decoction.

Papaya Soup for treating athlete's foot:
Dried papaya, Dafu pi, perilla leaves, costus root, notopterygium, and roasted licorice each: 2 qian (6 grams). White poria and aged tangerine peel: 1.5 qian (4.5 grams) each. Prepare one dose with 2 zhong (approximately 600 ml) of water, boil down to 1 zhong (300 ml), and take on an empty stomach.

Evodia Decoction for treating athlete's foot.[247p]

Wuzhuyu and Guixin, each two liang; orange peel, three liang; fresh ginger, five liang; ten large betel nuts, crushed with skin. Mulberry Root White Skin Pills - for treating beri-beri.
Five liang of mulberry root white skin; six liang of crushed fresh ginger; five liang of Sichuan pepper (stir-fried to release sweat); four liang each of Schisandra fruit, Guixin (cinnamon heart), and Chuanxiong. Grind these into a fine powder, mix with honey, and form into balls the size of paulownia seeds. Initially take ten balls in September, gradually increasing to thirty. Take with warm water. After September, it is advisable to combine with Zizi wine and other ten herbal wines, along with the pills.

Zizi Wine - for treating beri-beri.
Five liang each of Zizi, Niuxi, and Xuduan; eight liang each of mulberry root white skin, Bai Zhu, and fresh ginger; six liang each of Wujia white skin and Danshen; four liang each of Xixin and Guixin. Grind finely and store in a silk bag. Soak in five sheng of undiluted wine for five to six days. Initially, take one egg yolk worth of the concoction, repeat twice a day, gradually increasing the amount as needed. Follow the previous dosage guidelines, as it is effective without awareness. Avoid pork, cold water, peaches, plums, sparrows, lettuce, and raw green onions.[248p]

Haihe Powder: Treats athlete's foot with edema, urinary obstruction, and shortness of breath. Ingredients: 1 liang each of sea clam, new lacquer leaves, Fangji, Mutong, and Baihe; 0.5 liang each of fried Bintlian and (Mu Yu) Liren, peeled and roasted; 1.5 liang of fried Sangbai Pi. Crush and take 3 qian, boil with 1 cup of water until reduced to 60%, strain, and take warm at noon.

Zhu Ling Decoction: Treats athlete's foot with internal water and Qi stagnation, generalized swelling, dyspnea, and urinary obstruction. Ingredients: 3 fen each of Zhu Ling (black skin removed), Chishu Ling (peeled), and Fangji; 5 liang of roasted Sangbai Pi; 0.5 liang each of (Mu Yu) Liren (peeled, roasted), Zexie, and Mu Xiang; 7 pieces of Dafu Pi, ground together. 　　五加皮散　治江东岭南春夏不免暑湿郁蒸，脏腑虚弱羸瘦，瘴毒攻击，脚气发动，两脚枯疼，或即浮热肿满，或即皮肉焦燥，不能久立，筋挛掣痛，或气冲心闷乱，胸隔痰逆，四肢不仁，腹胀壅闷，目眩头旋，并宜服之。　　五加皮　麻黄去根节，各一两　防风　泽泻　独活　丹参　桂心各半两　石膏　赤茯苓　牛膝　防己　羚羊角镑升麻　黄芪各三分　薏苡仁一两半，微炒　　右(口父)咀，每服四钱，以水一中盏，入生姜半分，煎至六分，去滓，不拘时温服。[251p]

Ting Li Zi Pill: Treats athlete's foot leading to edema, along with upper respiratory issues, shortness of breath, and coughing. If water pills are taken, they may cause loose stools; only if urination becomes frequent should one be cautious.

The preparation involves:

  • Ting Li Zi, stir-fried with paper, then ground, three liang
  • Fang Ji and Gan Cao, each one liang
  • Skinless and pointed Xing Ren, stir-fried, then ground to a paste
  • Bei Mu, with the heart removed, each two and a half liang

Combine these into a fine powder, mix in the Ting Li and Xing Ren, then use jujube flesh to bind into pills the size of wutong seeds. Take thirty pills on an empty stomach, using decoction of jujube, mulberry bark, and glutinous rice to wash down. If urination does not improve, increase to forty pills.

Wu Jia Pi Powder: Treats the damp heat stagnation and summer heat prevalent in Jiangdong and Lingnan during spring and summer, also addressing weakness, emaciation, and attacks from pathogens leading to athlete's foot. Symptoms include dry, painful feet, swelling or burning skin, inability to stand for long, cramping pain, chest tightness, phlegm stagnation, numbness in limbs, abdominal bloating, dizziness, and headaches; this remedy is suitable for all such conditions.

Ingredients include:

  • Wu Jia Pi
  • Ma Huang, roots removed, each one liang
  • Fang Feng, Ze Xie, Du Huo, Dan Shen, Gui Xin, each half liang
  • Shi Gao, Chi Fu Ling, Niu Xi, Fang Ji, Ling Yang Jiao, Sheng Ma, Huang Qi, each three fen
  • Yi Yi Ren, one and a half liang, lightly roasted

Prepare by grinding the above, taking four qian each time, using one medium cup of water and half a fen of fresh ginger, decoct until down to six parts, then strain. Consume warm at any time.[251p]

First Bamboo Juice Decoction (from "Qianjin Fang", and likewise below)

Second Bamboo Dew Decoction: Treats sudden stroke, with mouth locked and unable to speak, limbs weak and slack, local paralysis and spasms, wind entering the five organs, confusion with sudden anger and instability, hands and feet unresponsive.

Ingredients: Bamboo dew (1 dou, 4 sheng), Angelica duhuo, Huang qin, Fang feng, Yin yu, Raw licorice, Bai zhu (stir-fried), Ge gen, Xi xin, Bai shao, and Qiong hua (2 liang each), Aconite (1 piece), Cinnamon heart, Fang ji, Ren shen, Gypsum, Ma huang, Fresh ginger, Fu ling (3 liang each).

Prepare by cooking in bamboo dew to yield 4 sheng, divided into 6 doses. If no sweating occurs, induce sweating; stop after one dose is sufficient.

Third Bamboo Dew Decoction: Treats wind toxin entering the internal organs, causing shortness of breath, heat and discomfort below the heart, pain in hands and feet, inability to lift limbs, numbness in skin and flesh, mouth locked and unable to speak.

Ingredients: Bamboo dew (1 dou, 9 sheng), Fu ling, Qin jiao, Fang feng (3 liang each), Huang qin, Ren shen, Qiong hua, Xi xin, Dong quai (2 liang each), Fu zi (2 pieces), Shu jiao (1 liang), Ge gen (5 liang), Fresh ginger (8 liang).

Prepare by cooking in bamboo dew to yield 4 sheng, divided into 5 doses. At the onset of illness, it is necessary to rub the ointment twice daily; once numbness settles, stop.

(Note: In "Qian Jin Yi," Sheng ma is noted as Tong cao, Qiong hua as Fang ji, Huang qin as Bai shao, and no Ma huang, Shu jiao, or fresh ginger is included.)[254p]

Ephedra Decoction from the Left Channel (from "Collected Proven Recipes," same below)

Treats wind, cold, heat, dampness, and channel obstruction affecting the foot's taiyang channel, leading to waist and leg pain, joint heaviness, difficulty walking, aversion to cold with fever, no sweat with aversion to wind, or spontaneous sweating with aversion to wind, headache, and dizziness.

Ingredients: Ephedra (removed from branches), Kudzu root, Asarum, White Atractylodes, Poria, Stephania, Cinnamon, Notopterygium, Windbreak, Honey-fried Licorice, each in equal parts.
Preparation: Grind and take 7 qian per dose with 2 cups of water, 5 slices of ginger, 1 date, decoct until 1 cup remains, and take on an empty stomach. If there is spontaneous sweating, remove Ephedra and add Cinnamon and Peony. For heaviness, add White Atractylodes and Chenpi. For absence of sweating, reduce Cinnamon and add Apricot kernel and Alisma.

Da Huang Decoction

Treats wind, cold, heat, dampness, and flow obstruction affecting the foot's yangming channel, leading to pain in waist and legs, difficulty walking, excessive salivation, constipation or diarrhea, stomach pain with vomiting, aversion to food odors, wheezing with fullness in the shoulders, spontaneous sweating, and delirium; all are suitable for this remedy.

Ingredients: Prepared Rhubarb, Asarum, Poria, Stephania, Notopterygium, Huangqin (Skullcap), Qianhu (Hogfennel), Stir-fried Bitter Orange, Honey-fried Licorice, Apricot kernel (peeled and tip removed) stir-fried, Prepared Magnolia Bark, each in equal parts.
Preparation: Take 7 da qian per dose, with 1.5 cups of water, 5 slices of ginger, 1 date, decoct on an empty stomach and take warm. Add Peony for abdominal pain, add Ejiao for constipation, add Mulberry bark and Perilla for wheezing, add Alisma for urination issues, and add Schizonepeta for skin itching, mixing in equal parts.[255p]

　　荷叶槁本汤　治脚胫生疮，浸淫腿膝，脓水淋漓，热痹痒痛。　　干荷叶四个　槁本二钱半

Banxia Zuo Jing Tang: Treats the foot Shaoyang meridian, suffering from wind, cold, heat, and dampness, leading to fever, pain in the waist and legs, headaches, nausea, deafness, anxiety, heat and restlessness, and issues with breathing, shoulder and back pain, and stiffness in waist and legs.

　　大料神秘左经汤　治风寒暑湿，流注足三阳经，手足拘挛疼痛，行步艰难，憎寒发热，自汗恶风，或无汗恶寒，头眩腰重，关节掣痛，或卒中昏塞，大小便秘濇，或腹痛呕吐下利，恶闻食臭，髀腿顽痹，缓纵不随，热闷惊悸，心烦气上，脐下冷痹，喘满气粗。　　麻黄去节　干葛　细辛　厚朴　茯苓　防己　枳壳麸炒　桂心　羌活　防风　柴胡　黄芩　半夏　干姜炮　麦门冬　甘草炙，各等分　　右(口父)咀，每服五钱，水一盏半，生姜五片，枣一枚，煎至一盏，去滓，空心服。自汗，加牡蛎、白朮，去麻黄；肿满，加泽泻、木通；热甚无汗，减桂，加橘皮、前胡、升麻；腹痛吐利，去黄芩，加芍药、附子炮；大便秘，加大黄、竹沥，喘满，加杏仁、桑白皮、紫苏，并等分。凡有此病，备细详证，逐一加减，无不愈者。[257p]

Great Ingredient Mysterious Left Scripture Decoction

This remedy treats wind, cold, heat, and dampness, flowing into the three Yang channels of the feet. It addresses symptoms such as stiffness, pain in hands and feet, difficulty in movement, aversion to cold and fever, spontaneous sweating, aversion to wind, or absence of sweat with a dislike for cold. It also aids in alleviating dizziness, heaviness in the lower back, joint pain, sudden collapse, constipation or diarrhea, or abdominal pain with vomiting. Additionally, it addresses an aversion to foul food odors, stubborn pain in hips and legs, sluggishness, heat disturbance leading to palpitations, irritability with ascending qi, cold and painful sensations below the navel, and breathlessness with coarse breathing.

Ingredients:
Ephedra (Mahuang) without nodes, Kudzu Root (Gancao), Asarum (Xixin), Magnolia Bark (Houpian), Poria (Fuling), Stephania (Fangji), Prepared Fructus Aurantii (Zhike), Cinnamon (Guixin), Qianghuo, Siler (Fangfeng), Bupleurum (Chaihu), Huangqin (Scutellaria), Pinellia (Banxia), Prepared Ginger (Ganjiao), Ophiopogon (Maimendong), and Honey-Fried Licorice (Gancao), all in equal parts.

For preparation: Each dose is five qian, boiled with one and a half cups of water, five slices of fresh ginger, and one date, until reduced to one cup. Strain and take on an empty stomach.

If there is spontaneous sweating, add oyster shell and Atractylodes, and remove ephedra; for swelling and fullness, add Alisma and Akebia; if there is high heat without sweating, reduce cinnamon and add tangerine peel, before-mentioned bugs, and Siberian ginseng; for abdominal pain and diarrhea, remove Huangqin and add peony and prepared Aconite; for constipation, add rhubarb and bamboo juice; for breathlessness and fullness, add apricot kernel, white mulberry bark, and perilla, all in equal parts.

For any of these ailments, prepare detailed verification and adjust the formula accordingly; there will be no cases that do not improve.[257p]

　　加味败毒散　治三阳经脚气，流注脚踝，臖热赤肿，寒热如疟，自汗恶风，或无汗恶寒。　　人参　赤茯苓　甘草炙　芎藭　前胡　柴胡　羌活　独活　枳壳麸炒　桔梗　大黄煨　苍朮米泔浸，各等分　　右每服五钱，水一盏半，生姜五片，薄荷五叶，煎至一盏，去滓热服。皮肤瘙痒赤疹，加蝉蜕。[258p]

Jiawei Baidu San treats foot qi from the three yang channels, with symptoms such as flowing edema in the ankles, heat and redness, alternating chills and fevers like malaria, spontaneous sweating and aversion to wind, or no sweating and aversion to cold. The ingredients include Ren Shen (ginseng), Chi Fu Ling (red Poria), honey-fried Gan Cao (licorice), Chuang Xiong (Sichuan lovage), Qian Hu (hogfennel), Chai Hu (bupleurum), Qiang Huo (Notopterygium), Du Huo (angelica), Zhi Ke (bitter orange) stir-fried with bran, Jie Geng (balloon flower), Da Huang (rhubarb) stewed, and Cang Zhu (Atractylodes) soaked in rice water, all in equal parts.

For each dose, take five qian (a traditional unit of weight), with one and a half bowls of water, five slices of ginger, and five leaves of mint, simmering until reduced to one bowl. Strain and take hot. If there is skin itching or rashes, add Chen Tui (silkworm shell).[258p]

　　六物附子汤　治四气流注于足太阴经，骨节烦疼，四肢拘急，自汗短气，小便不利，恶风怯寒，头面手足肿痛　　附子炮去皮脐　桂心　防己各四两　白朮　茯苓各三两　炙甘草二两　　右(口父)咀，每服五钱，水二盏，生姜七片，煎至一盏，去滓，空心温服。
　　八味丸　治少阴肾经，脚气入腹，小腹不仁，上气喘急，呕吐自汗。此证最急，以肾乘心，水克火，死不旋踵。　　牡丹皮　泽泻　茯苓各三两　附子炮去皮脐　桂心各二两　山茱萸　山药各四两　熟地八两　　右为细末，炼蜜和丸，如梧桐子大，每服五十丸，食前温酒米汤送下。
　　十全丹　治脚气上攻，心肾相系，足心隐痛，小腹不仁，烦渴，小便或秘或利，关节挛痹疼痛。　　肉苁蓉酒浸　石斛　狗脊　萆薢酒浸　茯苓　牛膝酒浸　枸杞子　远志各一两　熟地黄　杜仲去粗皮，銼炒去丝，各三两　　右为细末，炼蜜和丸桐子大，每服五十丸，温酒盐汤任下。[259p]

Liu Wu Fuzi Decoction: Treats the four seasonal influences obstructing the foot Taiyin channel, causing painful joints, tightness in the limbs, spontaneous sweating, shortness of breath, difficulty in urination, aversion to wind,Coldness, swelling and pain in the head, face, hands, and feet.

Ingredients:

  • Fuzi (prepared and peeled) 4 taels
  • Guixin 4 taels
  • Fangji 4 taels
  • Baizhu 3 taels
  • Fuling 3 taels
  • Honey-fried licorice 2 taels

Preparation: Grind the above ingredients, take 5 qian each time, boil with 2 cups of water and 7 slices of ginger until reduced to 1 cup. Strain and take warm on an empty stomach.

Bawuwei Pill: Treats Shaoyin kidney channel issues with foot qi entering the abdomen, resulting in numbness in the lower abdomen, dyspnea, vomiting, and spontaneous sweating. This condition is most urgent, as the kidneys counter the heart, water extinguishes fire, leading to imminent danger.

Ingredients:

  • Peony bark, Zexie, Fuling each 3 taels
  • Fuzi (prepared and peeled) 2 taels
  • Guixin 2 taels
  • Shan Zhu Yu, Shan Yao each 4 taels
  • Shudihuang 8 taels

Preparation: Grind into fine powder, mix with honey to form pills the size of Wu Tung seeds. Take 50 pills warm with rice wine before meals.

Shiquan Dan: Treats foot qi attacking upwards, affecting the connection between heart and kidneys, causing hidden pain in the soles, numbness in the lower abdomen, thirst, and irregular urination whether difficult or frequent, along with joint spasms and pain.

Ingredients:

  • Rou Congrong (soaked in wine)
  • Shihuchun
  • Dog spine, Bichai (soaked in wine)
  • Fuling
  • Niuxi (soaked in wine)
  • Goji berries, Yuan Zhi each 1 tael
  • Shudihuang, Duzhong (peeled and toasted) each 3 taels

Preparation: Grind into fine powder, mix with honey to form pills the size of Wu Tung seeds. Take 50 pills with warm salted wine soup.[259p]

　　四蒸木瓜丸　治肝肾脾三经气虚，受风寒暑湿搏着，流注经络，远年近日，治疗不痊。凡遇六气，更变七情，心神不宁，必然动发，或肿满，或顽痹，憎寒壮热，呕吐自汗。　　木瓜四枚　威灵仙、葶苈同入　黄芪、续断同入　乌药、黄松节同入　苍朮、橘皮同入　　右各半两，以木瓜切去顶盖，去瓤填药在内，却用顶盖簪定酒洒蒸熟，三蒸三晒取药出，焙干为末，研木瓜为膏，和捣千余下，丸如梧子大，每服五十丸，空心温服盐汤下。黄松节即茯苓中木。
　　苍龟丸 【《医学入门》】 　治痢后，脚弱渐细。　　苍朮　龟板　白芍各二两半　黄蘗盐酒炒，五钱　　右为末，粥丸梧子大，以四物汤加陈皮、甘草煎，下五七十丸。[260p]

Four Steamed Papaya Pills
For treating the deficiency of qi in the liver, kidneys, and spleen, affected by wind, cold, heat, and dampness, which have entered the meridians. Symptoms may include longstanding or recent conditions that haven’t healed despite treatment. Upon encountering the six external pathogens and changes in emotions, the heart and spirit become unsettled, resulting in agitation, swelling, or stubborn stiffness, with aversion to cold and intolerance of heat, nausea, and spontaneous sweating.
Ingredients: Four papayas, along with the following combined:

  • ½ tael of Welingxian and Tingli
  • ½ tael of Huangqi and Xuduan
  • ½ tael of Wuye and Huang Songjie
  • ½ tael of Cangzhu and Juhua
    Cut the tops off the papaya, remove the seeds, and fill them with the medicinal mixture. Seal the tops back on and steam with wine until cooked. Repeat the process of steaming three times and drying in the sun to extract the medicine. Grind to a fine powder, make a paste with the papaya, combine and knead until well mixed, then shape into pills the size of a large walnut. Take fifty pills warm on an empty stomach, swallowed with salt water. Huang Songjie refers to the wood of Poria.

Canggui Pill (from Introduction to Medicine)
For treating weakness and gradual thinning of the feet after dysentery.
Ingredients: 2.5 taels of Cangzhu, turtle shell, and white peony, and 5 qian of Huangbo fried in salt wine.
Grind into a fine powder, form into pills the size of a large walnut, and take 50 to 70 pills with a decoction of Siwu decoction added with dried tangerine peel and licorice.[260p]

　　开结导饮丸 【东垣】 　治饮食不消，心下痞闷。　　陈皮　白朮　泽泻　茯苓　半夏制　神曲　麦蘖各一两　枳实炒　青皮　干姜各半两　　右为末，汤浸蒸饼为丸，如桐子大，每服三五十丸至七十丸，温汤下，食远服。如有积块者，加巴豆霜一钱半。　　又方　治湿热并诸湿客搏，腰膝重痛，足胫浮肿。　　槟榔　甘遂　赤芍药　威灵仙　泽泻　葶苈　乳香研，各二两　没药研，一两　牵牛半两　大戟炒，三两　陈皮四两　　右为末，面糊为丸，如桐子大，每服五十丸，加至七八十丸，食前温水送下，得更衣，止后服。前药忌洒二日，又忌面及甘草三两日，食温淡粥补胃。
　　杉节汤 【《医学正传》】 　治脚气入腹冲心，危急欲绝，以此救之。　　杉木节四两　大腹皮一两　槟榔大者七个　青橘叶四十九片，无则用皮　　右銼，作一贴，以顺流水煎服。[261p]

Kaijie Daoyin Wan (by Dongyuan)
For the treatment of food not being digested, with feelings of pressure and discomfort in the chest.
Ingredients:

  • Dried tangerine peel: 1 liang
  • Bai Zhu: 1 liang
  • Ze Xie: 1 liang
  • Fu Ling: 1 liang
  • Ban Xia (processed): 1 liang
  • Shen Qu: 1 liang
  • Wheat chaff: 1 liang
  • Stir-fried Zhi Shi: 0.5 liang
  • Qing Pi: 0.5 liang
  • Dried ginger: 0.5 liang

Grind these into a powder, and soak in broth to form pills the size of a tung seed. Take 30 to 70 pills each time with warm water, at least 30 minutes before meals. If there are masses, add 1.5 qian of Ba Dou San.

Another recipe for treating damp-heat and various damp factors causing heavy pain in the waist and knees, with swelling in the feet and shins:

  • Betel nut: 2 liang
  • Gan Sui: 2 liang
  • Chi Shao Yao: 2 liang
  • Wei Ling Xian: 2 liang
  • Ze Xie: 2 liang
  • Ting Li: 2 liang
  • Frankincense (ground): 2 liang
  • Myrrh (ground): 1 liang
  • Qian Niu Zi: 0.5 liang
  • Da Ji (stir-fried): 3 liang
  • Dried tangerine peel: 4 liang

Grind these into a powder, mix with flour to form pills the size of a tung seed. Take 50 to 80 pills before meals, with warm water. After adjustments, take later. Avoid sprinkling the above herbs for two days, also avoid flour and licorice for two to three days, and eat warm, light congee to nourish the stomach.

Shanjie Decoction (from "Yixue Zhengzhuan")
To treat beriberi affecting the abdomen and heart, in critical and urgent situations.
Ingredients:

  • Shanjue (branch of cedar): 4 liang
  • Da Fu Pi (big belly peel): 1 liang
  • Large betel nut: 7 pieces
  • Qing Ju Ye (green tangerine leaves): 49 pieces (if not available, use the peel)

Grate these and prepare a paste, simmer in flowing water and take it as a decoction.[261p]

　　续断丸 【《本事方》，下同】 　治肝肾风虚气弱，脚不可践地，腰脊疼痛，风毒流注下部，行止艰难，小便余沥。此药补五脏内伤，调中益气，凉血强筋骨，益智轻身耐老。　　杜仲五两　牛膝酒浸　薏苡仁　羌活　防风　五加皮　续断各三两　萆薢四两　生地黄五两　　右为末，好酒三升，化青盐三两，用木瓜半斤，去皮子，以盐酒煮成膏和杵，丸如梧子大，每服三五十丸，空心食前，温酒盐汤任下。
　　虎骨酒　去风补血益气，壮筋骨，强脚力。　　虎胫骨真者　萆薢　仙灵脾　薏苡仁　牛膝　熟地黄各二两　　右细銼，绢袋盛浸酒二斗，饮了一盏，入半盏，可得百日。妇人去牛膝。
