Continuation of Duan Wan
This medication treats liver and kidney wind deficiency, weak qi, inability to walk on the ground, pain in the waist and spine, wind toxin flowing to the lower part of the body, difficulty in movement, and residual dribbling of urine. This medicine nourishes internal injuries of the five organs, regulates the center and benefits qi, cools the blood, strengthens muscles and bones, enhances wisdom, lightens the body, and increases longevity.
Ingredients:

  • 5 taels of Du Zhong
  • 3 taels each of Niu Xi, soaked in wine, Yi Yi Ren, Qiang Huo, Fang Feng, Wu Jia Pi, and Xu Duan
  • 4 taels of Bi Xie
  • 5 taels of Sheng Di Huang
    The above should be ground into a powder, combined with 3 sheng of good wine, 3 taels of salt, and boiled with 0.5 jin of peeled papaya into a paste. Form into pills the size of a walnut, taking 30 to 50 pills before meals with warm wine and salt water.

Tiger Bone Wine
Removes wind, replenishes blood, boosts qi, strengthens muscles and bones, and enhances leg power.
Ingredients:

  • 2 taels of real tiger tibia bone
  • 2 taels each of Bi Xie, Xian Ling Pi, Yi Yi Ren, Niu Xi, and Shu Di Huang
    Grind finely, place in a silk bag, and soak in 2 dou of wine. Drink one cup, adding half a cup to last for a hundred days. Women should omit Niu Xi.

Two-Fried Cang Zhu San
This treats damp-heat foot disease, causing pain in the feet and knees, or redness and swelling, with heat and pain between the bones of the feet, making it difficult to walk and causing weakness and atrophy. This is effective in all cases.
Ingredients:

  • 4 taels each of Cang Zhu, soaked in water overnight, and salt-fried, and Huang Lian, soaked in wine overnight, and fried until charred
    Grind the above to 5 qian, and decoct in water for consumption, or mix with water to form pills if desired.[262p]

Coix Seed Wine
To treat leg paralysis.
Coix seeds and ox knee, each two liang;
Sea mulberry bark, five-flavored bark, costus root, and angelica pubescens, each one liang;
Dried radix rehmanniae two and a half liang;
White atractylodes half a liang.

Grind the above into a coarse powder, place into a fine silk bag, and soak in five sheng of good wine for seven days during spring and autumn, and for seven days in winter. During hot summer months, divide into several applications. Soak each application in the wine; every day, on an empty stomach, take one or half a cup at a time, three to four times a day, ensuring the effect of the wine lingers. With prolonged use, one will feel as if hundreds of worms are crawling beneath the skin, thus dispelling wind and dampness.

Large San Wan Powder
To treat leg qi attacking the heart, abdominal fullness, and constipation.
Roasted licorice, half a liang;
Angelica pubescens, dried papaya, and roasted large belly bark until yellow, and white atractylodes, and perilla leaves, each one liang;
Soaked in decoction of aged tangerine peel, to remove the white;
Sandalwood, fragrant wood, chuanxiong, and betel nut flour, each seven and a half qian.

Grind all into a coarse powder, take two and a half qian each time, boil with two cups of water until reduced to one cup, strain out the residue, and divide into three doses. Take warm for relief.[263p]

Da Fuzhi San
Treats wind toxic foot pain, joint discomfort, and oppressive heart and spirit.

Xi Jiao San
Treats heart congestion with foot pain, agitation, vexation, head pain, and dry mouth, making it hard to sit or lie.
Ingredients: Rhino horn shavings, Zhihua (with the pulp removed), toasted bran, and Chenxiang, each seven qian and a half; Boli, Zisu stems and leaves, Maidong, and Chifuling, each one liang; Muxiang and Fangfeng each half liang; Gypsum, finely ground, two liang.
Preparation: Grind the right ingredients together, each dose is eight qian, with one and a half cups of water, decoct until reduced to one large cup, strain, add one part diluted bamboo juice, and further boil gently once or twice, take warm, without regard to time.

Zhuyu Mugua Tang

Binglang San
Treats heart congestion with foot pain, agitation, and lack of recognition.

Mugwort Powder: Treats foot odor affecting the heart, irritation, and stagnation below the navel. Ingredients: 1.5 ounces of wood fragrance, betel nut, and mutong. Prepare by grinding, take 8 qian (a weight unit), with 1.5 medium cups of water, add 5 slices of raw ginger and 7 inches of green onion, boil until it reduces to 1 cup, and take warm, at any time.

Dihuang Decoction: Treats penetrating heart foot odor. Ingredients: 4 ounces of cooked rehmannia, 2 ounces of angelica, and 1 ounce each of peony, cowherb (prepared with liquor), chuanxiong, and three kinds of fruit; 0.5 ounces of eucommia. Grind the ingredients, take 5 qian, with 1.5 cups of water, boil until it reduces to 1 cup, strain, and take warm.

Sandalwood Powder: Treats foot odor affecting the heart, irritation with shortness of breath, pain and soreness in the feet and knees, and confused thoughts. Ingredients: 1 ounce each of sandalwood, red peony, mutong, perilla stems and leaves, haritaki skin, and betel nut; 0.5 ounces of evodia. Grind the ingredients, take 8 qian, with 1.5 medium cups of water, add 5 slices of raw ginger, boil until it reduces to a large cup, strain, and take warm at any time.

White Mulberry Root Powder: Treats excessive foot odor, swelling in both feet, red and painful urination, abdominal and side fullness, making sitting or lying down difficult. Ingredients: 1 ounce each of white mulberry bark and (wood-fragrance) plum kernels; 2 ounces of red poria; 1.5 ounces each of wood fragrance, fangji, and big belly fruit; 7.5 qian each of perilla seeds, mutong, betel nut, and green skin. Banxia Powder [from "Collected Proven Recipes"] treats foot qi with discomfort, vomiting, and chest congestion, leading to inability to eat or drink. Prepare Banxia decoction by washing seven times; slice ginger and take seven and a half qian of cassia twig, one tael each of ginseng, red poria, and dried tangerine peel (white part removed), as well as one tael each of peucedanum, betel nut, and one and a half taels of perilla leaves. Right (to be chewed), take five qian for each dose, with one and a half medium cups of water, seven slices of fresh ginger, two qian of thin bamboo shavings, boil down to three-quarters, strain, and take warm, without time restriction.

Cao Cardamom Powder treats foot qi during onset, vomiting, and fullness and discomfort in the chest, causing inability to eat or drink. Ingredients include one tael each of Cao cardamom seeds, perilla leaves, red poria, peucedanum, and wood unblock, along with two and a half qian of wuzhuyu and seven and a half qian each of processed banxia and stir-fried bitter orange peel. Right (to be chewed), take eight qian per dose, with one and a half medium cups of water, seven slices of fresh ginger, boil to one cup, strain, and take warm, without time restriction.

Ginseng Powder treats foot qi with vomiting, anxiety, and inability to eat or drink. Prepare with seven and a half qian of cassia twig, one tael each of ginseng, red poria, dried tangerine peel (white part removed), and ophiopogon (heart removed), and one tael of betel nut. The decoction preparation is the same as described above.

Tangerine Peel Decoction treats foot qi with phlegm obstruction, causing vomiting and chest fullness, leading to loss of appetite. Use one tael each of dried tangerine peel (white part removed), ginseng, and perilla leaves.[267p]

Da Fu Pi San - Treats previous symptoms.
Ingredients: 3 liang of Da Fu Pi, 1 liang each of Mu Guo, Su Zi, Bing Lang, Jing Jie Sui, Wu Yao, Chen Pi, Zi Su Ye, 0.5 liang of Luo Bo Zi, 1.5 liang each of Chen Xiang, Sang Bai Pi, Zhi Ke (fried).
Preparation: Grind the ingredients, take 8 qian per dose, mix with 1.5 sheng of water and 5 slices of ginger, boil until reduced to 1 sheng, strain and take warm. The imperial physician, Chu Shi, added Mu Tong, Bai Fu Ling, fried Huai Xiang, and roasted Gan Cao to the formula.

Mu Tong San - Treats foot qi, general swelling, and shortness of breath with irritability.
Ingredients: 1 liang each of Mu Tong, Zi Su Ye, and Zhu Ling; 2 liang each of Sang Bai Pi, Bing Lang, and peeled Chi Fu Ling.
Preparation: Grind the ingredients, take 4 qian per dose, mix with 1.5 zhong of water, add 5 slices of fresh ginger and 5 inches of scallion white, boil until reduced to 1 sheng, strain and take warm, as needed.

Bing Lang Wan - Treats foot qi attacks with constipation or diarrhea, abdominal fullness and discomfort, bladder urgency, and limb pain.
Ingredients: 1 liang each of Bing Lang, Chi Fu, Su Ye, Da Ma Ren, and (Mu Yu) Li Ren; 2 liang of prepared Da Huang; 0.5 liang each of Mu Xiang and Gui Xin; 7.5 qian each of Zhi Ke (fried), Mu Tong, Ze Xie, and broken Ling Yang Jiao.
Preparation: Grind into a fine powder, mix with honey and knead 200-300 times, form into pills the size of walnuts. Take 30-40 pills before meals with warm water to aid efficacy.[269p]

　　虎骨四斤丸　治前证。

Tiger Bone Pills [for treating previous conditions].
Four pounds of tiger bone,
Mugua (Magnolia fruit), Tianma (Gastrodia elata), and clean, dried meat of Cynomorium. Each weighs one pound.
Two taels of Prepared Aconite (去皮尖).
One tael of roasted tiger bone.

Prepare as follows: Take the first four ingredients and soak them in five sheng of ash-free wine, for five days in spring and autumn, three days in summer, and ten days in winter. Remove and dry them, then grind together with Aconite and tiger bone into a fine powder. Use the soaked medicinal wine to form a dough, rolling it into pills the size of walnuts. Take fifty pills each time, with salty broth before meals.

Anti-Damp Cakes [from “Medical Tradition”]
For treating chronic beriberi with swollen legs and feet.
Two taels of black fungus, take the head part (five qian),
Two taels of white fungus, take the head part (five qian),
Five qian of Gansui.

Grind the above into a very fine powder, mix with one and a half taels of buckwheat flour, and add water to knead into cakes the size of each being about three qian. Steam them over rice until cooked. Chew each cake with plain tea to aid digestion as needed.

Deer Antler Pills
For treating beriberi with sores on the legs and ankles.
Roast deer antler and grind it into a paste.
Mix equal parts of Schisandra, Angelica, and cooked Rehmannia root.

Grind all the above into a fine powder, combine with glue to form pills the size of Paulownia seeds. Take thirty to forty pills with warm wine or salty broth before meals, followed by taking XiongGui powder.[271p]

Ji Ming San
Treats pain from athlete's foot, suitable for both men and women. If one is affected by wind and dampness leading to pain and swelling in the feet, this should be taken.
Chen Pi, Mu Guo, each one liang; Wu Zhu Yu, Zi Su Ye, each three qian; Jie Geng, Sheng Jiang (with peel), each half liang; seven pieces of Bing Lang.
This should be chewed before being decocted once. Use three large bowls of water, simmer until down to one and a half bowls, strain, then add two bowls of water for a second decoction. Combine the two decoctions; set by the bedside. The next morning at five, divide into three to five doses, taken cold. In winter, it can be taken slightly warm. After taking the medicine, apply a dry item to bind it down. If not all is consumed, leave some for gradual consumption the next day. Taking the medicine until dawn, one should expect dark stool and watery excrement, indicating the expulsion of cold, damp, and toxic energies from the kidney. By breakfast, pain should subside and swelling should diminish. It is advisable to delay eating to allow the medicine to take effect. This medicine is not a purgative and has no contraindications.[272p]

　　加减槟榔汤　治一切脚气，春夏多宜服之。　　槟榔　橘红　紫苏茎叶各一两　甘草炙，半两　　右每服五钱，水一盏半，生姜五片，煎至八分，去滓温服，不拘时。如脚痛不已者，加木瓜、五加皮。妇人脚痛，加当归。室女脚痛，多是肝血盈实，宜加赤芍药，师尼寡妇亦然。中满不食者，加枳实。痰厥或呕者，加半夏。腹痛大便不通者，用此汤下青木香丸；如更不通，加大黄。小便不利者，加木通。转筋者，加吴茱萸。脚肿而痛者，加大腹皮、木瓜。足痛而热，加地骨皮。[273p]

Jiajian Betel Nut Decoction treats all forms of athlete's foot and is especially suitable for use in spring and summer.

Ingredients:

  • Betel nut: 1 tael
  • Dried tangerine peel: 1 tael
  • Purple perilla stems and leaves: 1 tael
  • Honey-fried licorice: half a tael

Dosage: Take 5 qian of the above mixture with 1.5 cups of water, add 5 slices of fresh ginger, and boil until reduced to 80% of the original volume. Strain and take warm, regardless of time.

If foot pain persists, add papaya and five-leaf aralia. For women experiencing foot pain, add angelica. Young maidens with foot pain often have an excess of liver blood, so add red peony root; the same applies to widows or nuns. For those feeling fullness and unable to eat, add bitter orange. If there is phlegm or vomiting, add pinellia. For abdominal pain with constipation, use this decoction to take with Qingmuxiang pills; if still constipated, add rhubarb. If urination is difficult, add akebia. If there are cramps, add evodia. For swollen and painful feet, add areca nut and papaya. If foot pain is hot, add earth bone bark.[273p]

　　导气除湿汤　治脚气。

　　胜骏丸 【《三因方》】 　治脚气拘挛疼痛，行步不随，去一切足弱病。　　木瓜四两　当归酒浸　天麻酒浸　牛膝酒浸　酸枣仁炒　熟地黄酒浸，蒸，捣　防风各二两　全蝎去毒，一两　附子一枚，炮，去皮脐　乳香　没药　羌活　木香　甘草各五钱　麝香二钱　　右为末，生地黄二斤，洗净杵烂如泥，好酒四升，同煮如膏，和前药捣令坚，每一两作十丸，每取一丸，临睡细嚼酒下。或丸如梧子大，酒下五十丸，亦可。服至半月行步如飞，故名曰胜骏。冬月不用地黄，只炼蜜作丸。

Shengjun Pill [from "San Yin Fang"]
This treats athlete’s foot, cramps, and pain, causing difficulty in walking and addressing all foot weakness diseases.

  • 4 taels of papaya
  • Angelica soaked in wine
  • Gastrodia soaked in wine
  • Achyranthes soaked in wine
  • Roasted sour jujube seed
  • Cooked Rehmannia soaked in wine, steamed, and pounded
  • 2 taels each of Ledebouriella and whole scorpion (toxic parts removed)
  • 1 piece of Aconite, processed and peeled
  • 5 qian each of frankincense, myrrh, Qianghuo, wood fragrant, and licorice
  • 2 qian of musk

Grind these into a powder. Use 2 jin of fresh Rehmannia, wash and pound until muddy, mix with 4 sheng of good wine, and cook into a paste. Combine with the powder and pound until firm. Each 1 tael makes 10 pills. When taking one pill, chew finely and wash down with wine before sleeping. Alternatively, the pills can be made the size of a jujube, and 50 pills can be taken down with wine. After half a month, walking will feel as light as flying; hence, it is named Shengjun. In winter, do not use Rehmannia; instead, make pills with honey.

Zhuo Hu Dan [from "Yixue Rumeng"]
This treats athlete’s foot with swelling and intolerable pain.

卷柏散
This formula is particularly effective for treating long-term cases of beriberi that are difficult to cure. Use eastern-facing卷柏. First, boil it in salt water for half a day, then boil it in sweet, cold water for another half day, and dry it. Grind to a fine powder: black morning glory root, sweet-scented wormwood, areca nut — each should be ground separately, without mixing. Take one qian (approx. 3-4 grams) of each, except for the areca nut, which should be two qian. In the early hours of the morning, discreetly boil it, and take it with scallion white broth. By the time of Chen and Si (between 7-11 AM), expel the toxins similar to fish being removed from gelatin. Those who are weak should reduce the dosage by half. Continue consuming light porridge and take the decoction, adding a clearing heat and dampness-reducing soup to it.

枳壳散
This formula treats beriberi that breaks out in spring and summer, or symptoms of heart and abdominal congestion, leg and knee pain, difficult bowel movements, and red, scanty urine.
Ingredients: three fen (approx. 10 grams) of fried bitter orange peel, purple perilla stems and leaves, and red poria; one liang (approx. 30 grams) each of areca nut and rhubarb (lightly fried); one liang each of red peony root, akebia stem, five-leaf ginseng bark, antler horn shavings, angelica, yellow gentian, and honey-fried licorice — each a half liang.
Grind everything finely, take four qian with one middle-sized cup of water, add half a fen of fresh ginger, and decoct until reduced to six parts. Remove the dregs and consume warm before meals.[278p]

[From "De Xiao Fang"]

Moistening Decoction
Used for dampness from sitting or lying on wet ground, or being struck by rain and dew, resulting in heaviness in the body, weakness in the legs, joint pain, fever and chills, or excessive sweating with chills, or difficulty in urination and loose stools.
Three qian of Bai Zhu, Zhi Gan Jiang (dry ginger roasted), Bai Shao Yao, and Fu Zi (roasted, peeled, and navel removed), and one qian each of Bai Fu Ling and Ren Shen, and half a qian each of Gui Zhi and Gan Cao (honey-fried).

Burdock Root Powder
Used for warm diseases with no sweating, spasms in hands and feet, and inability to bend or extend.
Ten pieces of Burdock root, Ma Huang without root joints, six qian each of Niu Xi and Nan Xing.
Finely pound these ingredients in stoneware, adding one sheng of good wine, and grind them well. Additionally, use half a jin of charcoal to heat a yellow earth pit until it is red; clean out the fire, add the medicine to the pit, and heat it until black. Remove and grind into a fine powder. Take one qian with warm good wine, three times daily for effect. For external use, apply a paste of various herbs, which is beneficial.[281p]

　　膏药方　治裙边疮。

Goose Palm Wind Treatment Recipe
(For Leaf Heart Yang, same below)
Mercury, snake bed seeds, and Sichuan pepper, each six qian; large pagoda tree seeds, eight qian; alum, three qian; four wood bell seeds; camphor and light powder, each two qian. Grind into a powder, mix with pig oil, and apply, also used on the feet.

Goose Palm Wind Recipe
Chuanwu, Cao Wu, He Shou Wu, red peony, fangfeng, jingjiao, tianhuafen,苍术, diyu, and mugwort leaves, together boiling in water for steaming and washing.

Plaster Recipe for Treating Skirt Edge Sores
Four qian of tribulus, one fen of borneol and musk, de-oiled frankincense, de-oiled myrrh, each one qian; dragon bone and elephant skin, each two qian. Grind these eight ingredients into a powder, use four liang of sesame oil to boil it. First add two liang of incense to boil until water droplets form beads, then add two qian of lead powder and one liang of yellow lead, remove, and prepare for application.

Plaster Recipe for Treating Skirt Edge Sores and Long-term Ulcers
One jin of cedar oil, boiled until black with gentle fire, then add eight liang of lead powder, boil until water droplets form beads, remove, then add three qian of light powder and elephant skin, four qian of frankincense and myrrh (de-oiled). Grind the two de-oiled ingredients into powder, mix into the previous oil, and apply on paper.

Sheng Ji San, for treating ulcerated feet.
4 ounces each of sweet stone and dragon bone; 5 fen each of musk and ice shavings; 2 ounces each of ivory and myrrh; 3 qian each of realgar and cinnabar; 5 qian each of light powder and bright powder; 1.5 ounces each of yellow orpiment and goldenseal; 3 ounces of calcined oyster. Grind together into a powder and apply to the affected area.

Huang Qi Wan (from "Ju Fang"), for treating ulcerations on the feet and knees; taking this will provide immediate relief.
Chuan Wu head (prepared), remove skin and navel; 1 ounce each of Chuan lianzi, earthworm (dirt removed and roasted), and fragrant vine (roasted); 1 ounce each of spiny plum (roasted, thorns removed), adzuki bean, and ledebouriella root; 1 ounce of hu yao. Grind these into a fine powder, form into pills with boiled flour and wine, about the size of a walnut. Take 15 pills with warm wine or salty soup. Women may take it with vinegar soup, also on an empty stomach.

Lian Chuang Fang:
1 ounce each of white resin, goldenseal, and separately ground soft plaster; half an ounce each of indigo and dragon bone. Grind into a fine powder and mix with scented oil to apply to the affected area.

Another formula:
2 fen of goat droppings, 1 fen of plaster, and half a fen of red resin, ground finely. Mix with scented oil, use old black oil umbrella paper as a barrier dressing to bind it, addressing the root cause.

Cui Yu Gao, for treating ulcerations.[283p]

One liang of asphalt, two qian each of yellow wax and copper green, one qian each of myrrh and frankincense (with oil removed). First, finely grind the copper green into a powder, mix it with fragrant oil. Then, melt the yellow wax and asphalt over a fire, add the copper green oil, and stir well. Gradually mix in the myrrh and other two ingredients, then use a bowl of river water to pour the medicine into it, pulling and mixing it evenly with your hands. Wrap it in oil paper according to the size of the wound, forming pieces. Chew them and shape into cakes, applying them to the wound, sealing with paper, and changing every three days.

Frankincense powder by Guo’s formula, also known as white resin incense powder, is used to treat various chronic sores and ulcerations that have not healed over time, particularly below the scars and stubborn sores formed on the inner and outer ankles. For this, take half a liang of alum, white resin incense, and red stone resin, and three qian each of yellow lead, frankincense, and myrrh, along with two qian of light powder. Grind these into a fine powder and add a little musk. If the sore is wet, apply when dry; if it is dry, use fragrant oil for application.

For treating ulcers, combine four qian each of mouse dung, bitter gentian, peach twigs, fir tree thorns, willow twigs, pine twigs, flour paste, egg shells, soap pods, sparrow dung, peony, cottonseed, sesame, mulberry twigs, snake skin, bottom coal from pots, and the hairs of prepared Angelica. Mix these into a fine powder, crush candle wax regardless of the amount, and combine all ingredients in a mortar. Dig a pit in the ground, place the mortar inside, and surround it with fire to melt. Afterward, take it out and grind it until uniform, apply it to the wound, and it will heal naturally. Avoid all substances that are hot or produce gas.[284p]

Paper Paste is used to treat internal and external sores.

Ingredients:

  • 1 qian of light powder
  • 6 qian of yellow lead
  • Angelica
  • Coptis
  • 5 kinds of galls
  • Soft-shelled turtle
  • Realgar
  • Angelica dahurica
  • Myrrh
  • Dragon’s blood
  • White peony
  • White lily
  • Yellow bitter
  • Thick-skinned magnolia (each half a liang)
  • 2.5 qian of ground frankincense

Mix the above into a fine powder, then blend it into a paste with clear oil. Apply the paste using oil paper and bind it securely with silk cloth. If there is pus, open it up and scrape away the impurities, then reapply the medicine. Repeat this several times until healed. First, wash the area with a salt boil, wipe it dry with silk cloth, and wait briefly for moisture to evaporate before applying the medicine.

Another prescription for sores that have persisted without healing:

  • 2.5 qian of dragon bone
  • A small amount of light powder
  • 1 qian each of frankincense and myrrh
  • Half a liang each of areca nut and dried pig manure, burned to preserve their properties.

Grind into a fine powder. First, wash the wound with salt boil, then dry it with soft silk cloth, and apply with clear oil. If the wound is wet, dust the dry powder onto it.

Another prescription for sores located below:

  • Half a liang each of white stone resin and dragon bone
  • 2 liang of galls, burned to preserve their properties
  • 3 qian of yellow lead in powder
  • A small amount of realgar
  • 1 liang of alum, dried

Grind into a fine powder. First, wash the sore with scallion and salt water until the flesh is visible, then apply the above medicine onto the sore. If applying thickly, wrap it in cloth and keep it still until it dries and the sore skin can detach by itself.[285p]

Ulcer Ointment Recipe

Take equal parts of yellow lead, light powder, white atractylodes, camphor, and ash from a failed boat. Grind them into a fine powder, then mix with tung oil to form a paste. Place it in an oil paper bag. First, wash the area with warm scallion soup and dry it with a cloth. Apply the medicine to the ulcer, secure it in place, and after using one side, turn it and repeat the washing and application process. An alternative recipe omits the light powder; using the ash instead is also effective.

Another Recipe: When Zhan Wuzi was thirty years old, he suffered from ulcers and found this remedy effective several times.
Combine equal parts of white atractylodes, white herb (bai lian), and yellow berberine, grinding each separately. Form a very fine powder, add a small amount of light powder, and mix thoroughly. Combine with melted honey to form a paste, shape into cakes, and apply to the ulcer, filling deep ones completely. Wrap with a cloth; the area will gradually dry over the course of a week. If there are cracks, simply apply powder until healed.

Blood-Injecting Foot Recipe

The cow dung mushroom, also known as the lime mushroom, grows on the ground. If there are stone clumps, break them apart. Use the ash from the fat oak mushroom and mulberry mushroom. For men, use male fetal hair; for women, use female. One version suggests males use female and females use male.

Take five qian (a unit of weight) of each of the three mushrooms, dried. Burn three qian of fetal hair to ash and finely grind all ingredients together. When wet, apply the dry powder; when dry, mix and apply with refined sesame oil.[286p]

　　奇妙栀子散　治远年日久，内外臁疮。　　轻粉少许　山栀子不拘多少，烧存性，研为细末　乳香另研，各半钱　　右研末，以磁器盛，每用时先以葱白、花椒煎汤洗净疮，稍歇，再以温浆水又洗一次，候恶水去尽；再将白水煎百沸，候温再洗。但疮口无脓水血丝，清水各尽，又用粉帛片拭干，然后敷药。如干者，香油调敷；湿者，干掺。但将疮口实满，软绢帛护之。坚硬不作脓者，未可用。肿而软，有脓者，依前法再洗后，敷贴之，二三次即愈。乃一药二洗之功也。　　又方　治男子两足搔痒生疮，连年累月，俗为肾风疮，宜服此药。　　黄芪　牛膝各半两　羌活　独活　白附子　川芎　防风　木香各二钱半　白蒺藜一两，去刺　　右为细末，炼蜜为丸，如梧子大，每服三十丸，空心盐汤送下，仍以后药敷之。　　又方[287p]

Wintergreen leaves and pig bile, mixed with frost from a hundred herbs.

First, chew the wintergreen leaves thoroughly. Clean the wound with scallion and pepper broth, then apply the bile powder followed by the chewed leaves on top. Repeat this three or four times.

Miraculous Gardenia Powder treats long-standing internal and external sores. Use a small amount of powder, any amount of gardenia, burn it to obtain its essence, and grind it into a fine powder. Also grind equal parts of frankincense.

Mix the powders and store them in a ceramic container. Before use, clean the wound with scallion white and pepper broth, rest briefly, then wash it again with warm starch water until the unpleasant fluid is gone. Boil plain water, wait until it is warm, then wash the wound again. Ensure there are no pus, blood streaks, and that all water is removed. Use a cloth to dry the area before applying the medicine. For dry wounds, use fragrant oil; for wet ones, use a dry mixture. Protect the wound with soft silk if it is full. Do not use on hard wounds without pus. If swollen and soft with pus, follow the previous method to wash and apply; healing should occur in two or three applications. This method uses one medicine and two washes.

Another prescription treats men with itchy sores on the legs, often called kidney wind sores, and they should take this medicine.

Each of astragalus and ox knee: half a tael; of qianghuo, duhuo, white peony root, chuanxiong, fangfeng, and wood fragrance: two and a half qian each; and one tael of white tribulus, with thorns removed.

Grind into fine powder, mix with honey to form pills about the size of a walnut. Each dose consists of thirty pills taken with saline water on an empty stomach, followed by applying the medicine.

Zhanfan Powder treats foot ulcers.

Take equal parts of bamboo sawdust, burnt wool ash, roasted red dates (to retain their essence), yellow orpiment, safflower powder, and dried white alum, and grind them into a fine powder.

Longgu Powder treats foot gangrene and chronic ulcers that do not respond to other medicines. Grind two and a half qian of white dragon bone and light powder each, one qian of betel nut, and a quantity of fat pig dung, as well as dry new tiles roasted until red. Grind them into a fine powder, totaling five qian. Mix them well, start by rinsing the wound with diluted water or warm saline solution to cleanse it until the flesh shows, then mix the medicine with pure sesame oil and apply according to the size of the wound. If not healed, reapply after three to five days.

Niuhuang Tiger Dan:

Grind two and a half liang of niuhuang (bezoar), five liang of dragon brain, equal parts of greasy powder and dried white alum, as well as tianzhuhuang (Turmeric), then wash with tian南星 decoction, dry, and grind into powder. Mix with bile from a cow into a paste and dry in the shade. If cow bile is unavailable, use the method of sprinkling and steaming for seven days and nights. Grind, each in twenty-five liang. Grind xiong huang (realgar) finely, one hundred and fifty liang. Use eighty sheets of gold leaf as the casing. For tianxiong炮, peel off the skin and the navel, grind it to a fine powder totaling twelve liang and a half, mix with honey, and form into ten pills for every two and a half liang using gold leaf as the casing. Take one pill dissolved in fresh water. Not to be used by pregnant women.[289p]

Niu Xhi San: Treats spider veins on feet.
Chicken dung, fake death herb, two-sided turtle, red cow knee, purple gold skin, mountain centipede, root of the heavenly climbing vine, shell-off vine, heavenly cloth root, red kudzu root, back-side centipede. Boil the above with water, mix with wine, and take.

Topical medicine formula:
Heavenly buckwheat, deer onion root, purple gold skin, mountain cloth gourd, root of the heavenly climbing vine, lily bulb seeds, heavenly south star, red kudzu root, chicken dung, bitter mint, heavenly cloth gourd, back-side centipede. Chop into pieces, add a bit of vinegar, warm and apply.

Pine resin ointment: Treats flesh spines.
Pine resin and white adhesive aromatic each one tael, yellow wax half tael. Melt together over fire until it becomes an ointment, cool and affix with a material.

Unsalted ointment: Treats flesh spines.
Three unsalted seeds, one soap pod. Burn until the smoke dissipates, grind fine, mix with strong vinegar in a sand basin, separately grind the soap pod into paste, and apply the mixture for immediate effect.

Fumigated sulfur powder: Treats flesh spines.
Fumigated incense, stone sulfur.[290p]

　　润肌膏 【《宝鉴》】 　治手足皴濇，皮肤裂开疼痛。　　珠子沥青四两　黄蜡八钱　乳香二钱　　右三味，于铁器内用文武火熬，下沥青在铛内，随手便下黄蜡、乳香，次入清芝麻油一二匙，候沥青尽熔开，微微熬动，放大净水一盆于其旁，以搅药用匙，取一二滴，滴于水中试之，如硬再入油，如软硬合宜，用新绵滤净，入水中折迭扯之，以白为度。油当旋旋入，勿令软了。磁器盛或油纸裹亦得。每用不拘多少，先于火上炙裂子口，却捻合裂子药，亦火上炙软，涂于裂子上，用纸少许，贴之即合。
　　丹溪方　治老人脚膝疼，稍肿。
　　生地　当归头　白芍药　苍朮　炒蘗各三钱　川芎　桂各二钱　木通一钱半。　分四贴，煎取小盏，食前热服。[291p]

Mix the ingredients evenly, apply to the flesh wound, and then cauterize it with a heated needle; this is the method.

To treat flesh wounds, use toad venom. Take five pieces of toad venom, soak them in water, and mix with one qian of greasy powder. Place the toad venom in a bowl, mix evenly with the greasy powder, and do not use a needle to puncture the edge beforehand. Then apply the medicine and wrap it tightly.

Moisturizing ointment [from "Treasure Mirror"] treats the cracking and painful skin of hands and feet. Use four liang of natural asphalt, eight qian of yellow wax, and two qian of frankincense. Combine these three ingredients in an iron vessel using both gentle and strong heat. Add the asphalt to the pot, and as it begins to melt, gradually add yellow wax and frankincense, followed by one or two tablespoons of pure sesame oil. Wait until the asphalt is completely melted, stir gently, and place a large basin of clean water nearby. Using a stirring spoon, take one or two drops of the mixture and drip it into the water to test. If it hardens, add more oil; if it is just right, filter it through fresh cotton until it appears white. The oil should be added gradually, ensuring it does not become too soft. It can be stored in ceramic containers or wrapped in oiled paper. Use as needed, and first heat the area with a hot compress before applying the ointment to ensure it adheres well.

Danxi Formula treats knee pain and slight swelling in the elderly. The ingredients include fresh rehmannia, angelica root, white peony root, aster, and fried rhizoma belamcanda, each three qian; two qian each of chuanxiong and cinnamon; and one and a half qian of wood shavings. Divide into four doses, decoct to obtain a small cup, and take warm before meals.[291p]

　　秘传隔纸膏　治内外臁疮，年久月深不愈者。　　老松皮一本松香　樟脑谷　丹砂炒，一本黄丹　水龙骨　轻粉　川芎　海螵蛸　　右为细末，熔化松香，加清油少许和之，入药匀，以油纸随疮口大小，糊袋盛药夹之，用水洗疮干净，方贴上，用绢扎，三日换一次。若单用白芷、川芎、海螵蛸煎水洗，亦可。此证多年久不愈者，多是肾水虚败，下流为患。又有脾溃溢，可服前苦参丸补肾水，及用解毒生肌定痛散，次用前隔纸膏药。

Secret Paper Plaster Recipe

For treating internal and external sores that have not healed for many years.

Ingredients:

  • Old pine bark (1 part)
  • Pine resin
  • Camphor
  • Calamine (fried)
  • Realgar (1 part)
  • Yellow lead
  • Water dragon bone
  • Light powder
  • Szechuan lovage
  • Sea crab shell

Grind the above ingredients into a fine powder. Melt the pine resin, mix in a small amount of clear oil, and incorporate the powdered medicine evenly. Use oiled paper according to the size of the sore, creating a bag to hold the medicine. Clean the sore with water until dry, then affix the plaster and secure it with silk. Change every three days. Alternatively, you can simply decoct white atractylodes, Szechuan lovage, and sea crab shell for washing.

For cases that have not healed for many years, it is often due to deficiency in kidney essence leading to downward afflictions. There may also be spleen sores; in this case, one can take the aforementioned bitter root pills to replenish kidney essence, and use detoxifying and wound-healing powders before applying the secret paper plaster.

Hua Tuo's Recipe for Ingrown Toenails

For treating ingrown toenails, with cumulative effects.

Ingredients:

  • Noxious sand (1 qian)
  • Frankincense (1 qian)
  • Three olive pits, burnt to a fine ash
  • One character of yellow lead
  • Half a qian of greasy powder

Grind the ingredients into a powder and mix with raw sesame oil. First, wash the area with salt water, then dry it and apply the mixture. This method may require two applications for efficacy.

Bone Exchange Pill

For treating wind afflictions, including knee wind.

Ingredients:

  • Prepared wind (1 liang)
  • Cow knee (1 liang)
  • Angelica (1 liang)
  • Tiger bone (roasted) (1 liang)
  • Sichuan lovage (1 liang)
  • Exclusive lovage (1 liang)
  • Crushed turtle shell (1 liang)
  • Gentian (1 liang)
  • Acorus (1 liang)
  • Pine resin (1 liang)
  • Silk worm sand (1 liang)
  • Goji berries (2 and a half liang)
  • Ripe roots, washed (2 liang)
  • Atractylodes (4 liang)

Soak them in wine, or form them into pills with wine.

Source: Collection of Ancient and Modern Medical Books, Volume 195[292p]

Sizhi Gate

Fang

隔纸膏 - Treats sores and damp toxic ulcers. Calcine gypsum, grind to a powder with equal parts of powdered alumen, and mix with tung oil to form a paste. Apply it using partition paper. Additionally, take Jingfang Baidu San, and if several doses do not show effectiveness, one should take ginseng and astragalus soup.

Liushendan - Treats ulcers in men, women, and children, curing all sores on the body. Fry three taels and six qian of flower pollen until yellow, two fen of borneol, four qian of white lead powder, and one tael of yellow lead prepared with water and dried. Grind to a powder and apply a small amount to the affected area. Cover it with wintergreen leaves and change twice a day.

Biyang Fang - Treats itchy conditions of the feet caused by dampness. Six fen of mercury, one tael each of realgar and fried flower pollen, and two taels of evodia and berberine. Grind these together, and apply with candle oil.

Fangfeng Tang - Treats individuals affected by wind toxicity, which lingers in the blood and does not dissipate, fighting against the nutritive and defensive Qi, leading to wind sores, body heat, dizziness, swelling, and pain. Ingredients are: fangfeng, chih-shih, qianghuo, and sliced and toasted angelica; white atractylodes, mutong; fuzi, with skin and navel removed; ephedra with roots and joints taken away. Boil and skim off the foam. Roast, fry, and prepare licorice. Use equal amounts of these (one tael for each). Grind them into pieces the size of mung beans. Each dose is five qian mixed with one and a half bowls of water, boil until reduced to eight parts, filter out the residue, and take one dose after meals and before lying down. If sweating is desired, take two doses on an empty stomach, followed by hot ginger soup and thin porridge, then cover to induce sweating, while being cautious of wind external.[293p]

　　海桐皮酒　治热毒风结成疽，肿痛不得安。　　生地焙，三两　海桐皮　五加皮　独活　杜仲　防风　干蝎炒　薏苡仁炒　牛膝酒浸，各一两　　右(口父)咀，生绢囊贮，以好酒一斗五升，浸磁瓶中，密封，秋夏三日，冬春七日，食前温服三合或四五合，不拘时，常令酒气相续。
　　犀角散　治脚气风毒生疮肿痛，心神烦热。　　犀角屑　天麻　羌活　防风　黄芪　白蒺藜　黄芩　枳壳炒　白藓皮各七钱半　槟榔一两　乌蛇二条，酒浸　甘草炙，半两　　右(口父)咀，每服八钱，以水一中盏半，生姜五片，煎至二大盏，去滓温服，不拘时。　　又方　治脚气上生风毒，疮肿疼痛。　　蒺藜二两　漏芦　白蔹　槐白皮　五加皮　甘草各七钱半　　右(口父)咀，每用五两，水一斗，煮取六升，去滓，看冷热，于无风处淋洗之。[294p]

Haitongpi Wine: Treats heat poison and wind that cause sores, swelling, and pain that disrupts comfort. Ingredients: three taels of raw Rehmannia, one tael each of Haitongpi, Wujiapi, Duchong, Fangfeng, fried Scorpion, roasted Coix seeds, and Niu Xi flavored with wine, all one tael. After grinding, store in a silk bag. Soak in 15 liters of good wine in a sealed ceramic bottle. In the fall and summer, steep for three days; in winter and spring, steep for seven days. Warm and take three to five jugs before meals, without a specific time, allowing the aroma of the wine to continue.

Xijiao San: Treats athlete's foot, wind poison causing sores and swelling, and restlessness due to heat. Ingredients: rhino horn shavings, Tianma, Qianghuo, Fangfeng, Huangqi, Baijili, Huangqin, fried Zhihe, and Baixianpi, each seven and a half qian; one tael of Betel nut; two black snakes, soaked in wine; half a tael of roasted licorice. After grinding, take eight qian with one and a half middle cups of water and five slices of ginger. Boil until two large cups remain, strain, and take warm, without a specific time.

Another Formula: Treats upward wind poison causing athlete's foot, sores, swelling, and pain. Ingredients: two taels of Baijili, Liulu, Baiyan, Huai white skin, Wujiapi, and licorice, each seven and a half qian. After grinding, use five taels with one dou of water. Boil down to six sheng, strain, adjust temperature, and wash in a windless area.[294p]

　　还少丹　治足三阴经虚损，患鹤膝等证。又补脾肾、进饮食之良剂也。　　肉苁蓉酒浸，去甲　远志甘草汤泡，去骨　山药　蘹香炒　巴戟去心　枸杞子　牛膝　石菖蒲　杜仲　熟地捣膏　五味子　白茯苓　楮实子　山茱萸肉各等分　　右为末，用红枣肉同蜜为丸，梧子大，每服七十丸，温酒下，每日三服，白汤亦可。

Huan Shao Dan treats deficiencies in the three Yin meridians of the feet and conditions such as "crane knee." It also nourishes the spleen and kidneys and is a good remedy for improving appetite and digestion.

Soaked in wine, remove shells from the following:

  • meat from Cistanche,
  • wash with sweet licorice water and remove bones,
  • add Chinese yam,
  • fry with fragrant herbs,
  • clean the heart from Morinda root,
  • include goji berries,
  • ox knee,
  • stone calamus,
  • eucommia bark,
  • mash cooked Rehmannia,
  • Schisandra berries,
  • white Poria,
  • mulberry seeds,
  • and flesh of cornelian cherries, all in equal parts.

Grind these into a powder, and mix with red dates and honey to form pills the size of a walnut. Take seventy pills with warm wine, three times a day; white soup is also acceptable.

Du Huo Decoction treats "crane knee wind," regardless of swelling, rupture pain, or numbness in the waist, back, and limbs.

The ingredients include:

  • five fen roasted licorice,
  • one qian each of Du Huo,
  • angelica,
  • white atractylodes,
  • roasted astragalus,
  • thin cinnamon,
  • and ox knee.

Boil in water with ginger and scallion, adjusting the dosage to the individual's needs.[295p]

　　二矾汤 【《外科正宗》】 　治鹅掌风，皮肤枯厚，破裂作痛，宜用此汤熏洗。轻则不宜，越重越效。　　白矾　皂矾各四两　孩儿茶五钱　柏叶半斤　　右用水十碗，入上药四味，煎数滚，候用。先用桐油擦抹患上，以桐油蘸纸捻点着，以烟焰向患上熏之，片时，方将前汤乘滚贮净桶内，手架上用布盖，以汤气熏之，勿令泄气，待微热，倾入盆内，蘸洗良久，一次可愈。七日忌下汤水，永不再发。[296p]

Earth Immortal Pill
Treats kidney qi deficiency and fatigue, wind dampness, and soreness in the feet and knees, along with weakness while walking.

Erfan Decoction (from "Orthodox Text of Surgery")
Treats goose palm wind, skin dryness and thickness, fissures causing pain. This decoction should be used for fumigation and washing. If mild, it's not suitable; the heavier the condition, the more effective it will be.

  • White alum: 4 taels
  • Soap alum: 4 taels
  • Child tea: 5 qian
  • Cedar leaves: half a jin

Use 10 cups of water, add the four ingredients, boil until bubbling, and keep for use. First, apply tung oil to the affected area, then dip a piece of paper in tung oil, ignite it, and use the smoke to fumigate the area. Afterwards, pour the boiling decoction into a clean bucket, cover it with cloth to keep the steam from escaping. Once it's slightly warm, pour into a basin and soak for a long time; one treatment can cure. Avoid consuming soup or water for seven days, and it won’t occur again.[296p]

Treatment for Hand Sores

To treat sores on the hands that are swollen, painful, and producing pus, and have been broken open to leak fluid:

  • Burn pig dung to ash
  • Areca nut (5 qian)
  • Brain powder (0.5 fen)
  • Sichuan pepper and dragon bone (3 fen each)

Grind these into a fine powder. Mix the dry ingredients and apply with sesame oil. If there is pus, add 1 qian of gypsum powder.

Dragon Bone Ointment

For treating ulcerated sores:

Burned five-colored dragon bone, frankincense, myrrh, and myrrh resin (each 2 qian), half a qian of sea turtle shell, and five pieces of soap burned to a residue.

Grind these together, use double layers of cotton paper with needle-pierced holes, mix with clean oil, and apply the medicine inside. Bind it over the sore and replace every other day, applying to both sides.

Purslane Ointment

For treating thirty-six types of wind sores, chronic ulcers, ulcerated sores, damp eczema, and alopecia areata. It can also seal abscesses.

Take purslane, cook down to extract one pot of juice, add three taels of yellow wax, and simmer slowly until it becomes an ointment to apply.

Kiln Soil Ointment

For treating ulcerated sores:

Use iron-rich kiln soil or soil from the center of a stove that has been used for years, yellow lead, gypsum powder, yellow huangluo, frankincense, myrrh, and red resin (all in equal parts).

Grind these into a fine powder, mix with clean oil to form an ointment, and cover with parchment paper. Secure with silk, avoiding scratching even if it itches, and allow the ulcer to scab over. If not healed, apply again. First wash with clean tea before applying the ointment.[297p]

　　桐油膏　治臁疮。
　　桐油二两　百草霜　黄丹　发灰　乳香各三钱　　右同熬成膏，摊油纸上贴之。血虚痛甚者，尤宜。冷者加鹿角灰。如经年紫黑色者，先用炉灰膏去瘀，后用此膏。

　　蕲艾　川椒各五钱　水粉一两　黄丹三钱　轻粉一钱　　右为细末，熟麻油调膏，隔纸贴之，效。
　　蜡矾纸　治臁疮。
　　绵纸迭十二重，看疮大小，剪成方块，以纸捻钉住，却用麻油二两，入川椒四十九粒　　右用慢火煎枯黑，去滓；入槐枝四十九寸，煎枯黑，去滓；入黄蜡一两，枯矾一钱，轻粉二钱，俟熔化即入前纸，令油渗透，勿使焦黄，取起。贴时用槐枝葱椒煎汤洗拭，取前纸贴上，外另用油纸绯绢紧缚。周时取下近疮纸一重，候纸取尽，则疮全愈，其效如神。气虚脓多者，尤宜。[298p]

Tung Oil Ointment for Treating Ulcers.
Two taels of tung oil, three qian each of herbal frost, yellow lead, and frankincense, along with five qian of hair powder; boil these together into an ointment and apply to oiled paper for dressing. For those with blood deficiency and severe pain, this is especially beneficial. If there is coldness, add deer antler ash. For longstanding purple-black sores, first use furnace ash ointment to remove stasis, then follow with this ointment.

Qiyai Ointment for Treating Ulcers.
Five qian each of Qiyai and Sichuan pepper, one tael of water powder, three qian of yellow lead, and one qian of light powder; grind into a fine powder, mix with cooked sesame oil to form an ointment, and apply between layers of paper for efficacy.

Wax Alum Paper for Treating Ulcers.
Prepare wool paper in twelve layers, cut into squares based on the size of the ulcer, and secure with paper twists. Use two taels of sesame oil and forty-nine grains of Sichuan pepper; slow-cook until it turns dark and remove the dregs. Then add forty-nine inches of locust branches and simmer until blackened, also removing the dregs. Incorporate one tael of yellow wax, one qian of burnt alum, and two qian of light powder, allowing them to melt into the previous oil mixture, ensuring it does not burn to a yellow color before removing. When applying, wash the sore with decoction of locust branches and Sichuan pepper, then place the prepared paper on top, securing it tightly with additional oiled paper. Change the inner layer of paper periodically; once the paper is removed completely, the sore will be fully healed, showing remarkable effectiveness. This is particularly beneficial for those with qi deficiency and excessive pus.[298p]

　　黄蜡膏　治臁疮。
　　香油一两，入胎发如梅子大，熬消化　入白胶香　黄蜡各一两，熔化　入生龙骨　赤石脂　血竭末，各一两，搅匀候冷，磁器收贮　　右每用捏作薄片贴疮上，外以箬叶绢帛缚之，三日后翻过药贴，以活血药煎汤洗之。外臁亦妙。
　　炉灰膏　治一切无名肿毒恶疮，及臁疮经年紫黑色者。　　响糖炉内灰一升半　风化石灰一升，炒红　　右以竹箕盛贮，用滚汤三碗，慢慢淋自然汁一碗，铜锅盛，慢火熬如稀糊，先下巴豆末，次下蟾酥各二钱，白丁香末五分，炒石灰一钱，搅匀再熬，如干面糊，取起俟冷，以磁罐盛贮，勿令泄气。每用时，以簪头挑少许，放指甲上研，口呵气，调匀如泥，将患处用针拨开，以药点之。[299p]

Yellow Wax Ointment: Treats ulcer sores.

Take one tael of fragrant oil and heat it with the size of a plum in placenta hair until fully melted. Add one tael each of white resin, yellow wax, and mix well. Then add one tael each of raw dragon bone, red stone resin, and blood gall powder. Stir and allow to cool, then store in a porcelain container.

When using, pinch off a thin piece to apply to the sore, and bind it with bamboo leaves or silk cloth. After three days, replace the plaster and wash with a decoction of blood-activating herbs. It is also effective for external sores.

Ash Ointment: Treats all types of unnamed toxic swellings, evil sores, and ulcer sores that have turned purple and black after many years.

Take one and a half sheng of ash from the sugar furnace and one sheng of slaked lime, and stir-fry until red. Store this in a bamboo sieve and slowly pour in three bowls of boiling water and one bowl of natural juice. In a copper pot, simmer over low heat until it becomes a thin paste.

First, add two qian of powdered father bean, then two qian of toad secretions, five fen of powdered clove, and one qian of stir-fried lime, mixing well and continuing to simmer until it reaches a dry, dough-like consistency. Remove and let it cool, storing in a ceramic jar, ensuring no air leaks in.

For use, take a small amount with a hairpin and crush it on your fingernail. Breathe onto it to mix it into a paste, then use a needle to pierce the affected area and apply the medicine.[299p]

Huangbai San treats wet toxins of ulcers and widespread heat sores. The ingredients are:

Sanjiao Ointment treats distant and nearby ulcers, especially those that have rotted to the bone and are painful. The ingredients are:

  • Frankincense: 2 qian
  • Pine resin: 3 qian

Grind finely and mix with true fragrant oil. Use reed leaves with many small holes, spread the medicine on top, apply the leaves to the affected area with the medicine in the center, cover with remaining leaves, and secure with cloth to stop the pain immediately.

Poison-Removing Powder: Treats poisonous sores that appear on the fingertips, characterized by redness, swelling, and hardness, commonly known as "finger fire," along with unbearable bone-deep pain. Take a small amount of frankincense and grind it, mix with bee nest powder to create a paste. Apply this mixture with vinegar; when it dries, moisten it with vinegar, and the pain will stop immediately.

Snake-Bite Swelling Powder: Treats snake bites, as well as conditions like snake joint sores, snake belly sores, snake head sores, and snake back sores. Combine snake head grass, celestial gourd vine, wood tick herb, immortality yam, earth wood fragrance, purple gold vine, and both blue and green herbs. Grind and take with warm wine, using the residue as a poultice.

Zhang Expulsion and Pain Relief Powder: Treats snake head poison and all types of viper poison. Purple gold vine, also known as happy grass, is used here. Grind and take with wine, using the residue to apply to the affected area for great effectiveness.

Earth Hyacinth Powder: Treats snake head poison. Ear ring tail, also known as glass grass, flower tube grass, or earth hyacinth, is used here. Grind and take with wine, applying a cooked paste made from the crushed herb.

Poison-Poultice Recipe: Treats all types of viper poison at the snake head. Earth hyacinth, gold brain fragrance, purple river rah, purple centipede, golden phoenix tail, golden chicken tongue, and flying centipedes are all chopped and stir-fried in wine for application.

Soaking Toxic Powder: Treats the previous conditions with similar efficacy.[303p]

Shengma decoction treats substitute fingers.
Half a liang each of shengma and licorice.
Grind finely, add two sheng of water, and simmer until reduced to one sheng, then remove the dregs. Add half a liang of pulverized glauber salt, mix well, and warm-soak the fingers several times; if cool, rewarm until healed. One method uses one liang each of gardenia seeds and licorice; another uses only licorice; a third uses only glauber salt; a fourth uses only ephedra, all prepared as above.

Red pueraria paste treats toxic accumulations at the lotus sections and areas such as the arms, elbows, wrists, and palms. The ingredients include red pueraria root, mountain bottle gourd root, mountain samshu, mountain camphor bark, purple gold skin, red cow knee, and red ligusticum root, all of which are to be chopped and stir-fried together, then applied to the affected areas.

Xionghuang San
Used for the initial onset of heavenly snake venom, characterized by redness, swelling, fever, and deep pain. It is advisable to use it.
Bright xionghuang, 2 qian; toad venom, 2 fen, slightly roasted; borneol, 1 fen; talcum powder, 5 fen. Grind into a fine powder, mix with freshly drawn water to apply, cover with paper. Use thrice for maximum effect.

Jiedu Jisheng Tang
Used for the initial onset of a deteriorating sore, with chills, fatigue, fever, thirst; may present with swelling or purple spots, numbness or pain, general fatigue of the limbs, and a restless mind. It should be taken.
Chuanxiong, Danggui, Huangbo, Zhimu, Yuanzhi, Tianhuafen, Chaihu, Huangqin, Xijiaoxia, Baifuling, Jinyinhua, and Maidong, each 1 qian; licorice and safflower, each 3 fen. Combine with 2 cups of water, simmer to about 8 parts. Before taking, add 1 cup of children's urine; administer according to the condition. For fingers, add Shengma; for toes, add Niuqiao, each 5 fen.

Wugong Jian
Used for long-standing chronic sores that are black, rotten, and painful, where other medicines have no effect.
Du Huo, Baizhi, Licorice, and Centipede, each 1 qian; tung oil, 2 liang. Combine the above four ingredients into the oil and boil. First, clean the sore, then prepare a circle with flour and water, surrounding the sore’s edges to prevent leakage of the oil. Keep the foot flat, use a teaspoon to fill gradually with hot oil. After the oil cools, the rotten flesh and venom will naturally fall off. Use Jiedu Zijing Gao to apply afterward, cover with paper and secure with silk, changing every three days.[305p]

　　解毒紫金膏　治臁疮无论新久，及顽疮年久不愈者，并用之。　　细块矾　红明净松香各一斤　共捣极细末，麻油调稠，先将患上用前汤熏洗洁净，擦上此药，油纸盖住，以软布条要扎至紧，毋令血行，三日一换。如无前汤熏洗，只煎葱艾甘草等汤，俱可洗换。又治诸毒顽臁等疮神效。愈后，忌发物煎炒。

Lamp Lighting Method
Treats long-standing purple-black blood wind sores that itch constantly with fluid. First, use green onion soup to wash the affected area, then use a lamp flame to fumigate it, with three twists each time.
Ingredients: 2 qian of Xionghuang, 2 qian of cinnabar, 2 qian of dragon's blood, 2 qian of myrrh, and 4 fen of musk.
Grind these into a fine powder, using 3 fen each time, wrapped in cotton paper as a twist, about a foot long, soaked in genuine sesame oil. Fumigate at a distance of about half an inch from the sore, gradually moving from the outside inward, slowly surrounding the area. With the flame upwards, the medicinal vapor enters, dispersing the sores' toxins without harming internal organs. Start with three twists and gradually increase to four or five as the sores diminish.

Shengji Yuhong Gao - A divine medicine for removing rotten flesh and generating new tissue, with astringing effects.
5 qian of Bai Zhi, 1 liang 2 qian of Licorice, 2 qian of Zi Cao, and 2 liang each of Bai La and Gui Shen, 4 qian of Xue Jie, and 1 jin of sesame oil. First, steep the four herbs (Dang Gui, Licorice, Zi Cao, Bai Zhi) in oil for three days; then gently simmer with a large ladle until the medicine slightly darkens, strain the oil through fine silk, return it to the ladle, bring to a boil, add all the Xue Jie to dissolve completely, followed by Bai La to melt over low heat. Pre-soak four tea cups in water, divide the paste into four portions, pour into each cup, wait for a moment, then grind ultra-fine powder, adding 1 qian to each cup and mix well; collect after it has settled for a while. Do not add or reduce anything, or it will be ineffective.[308p]

Yin Yang Er Qi Dan: Treats ulceration. Long-term use of minerals and tonic medicines can deplete kidney essence, leading to dryness of the mouth and throat, even causing a lack of awareness of the coldness of ice and snow. This indicates a solitary flourishing of Yang, thus it is advisable to take this remedy to resolve it.
Ingredients: Tian Dong, mashed into paste; Mai Dong, mashed into paste; Wu Wei Zi, roasted and ground; Huang Bo; Ren Zhong Bai (to be given for children’s urination), ground; Yuan Shen, soaked in soup, mashed into paste, each one liang; Qing Dai, Gan Cao, Ku Fan, Ze Xie, each two qian; Bing Pian, one qian; all to be finely powdered. Mix with Yuan Shen and two Dong pastes, add a little refined honey, and re-mash until the consistency is right, forming pills the size of a tung seed. Coat with two qian of Chen Sha. Each dose involves taking sixty pills, along with one cup of children's urine and one cup of milk sent down on an empty stomach to ensure a restful sleep; the effect is miraculous.

Qing Shen San: Treats ulcerations, abscesses, and boils; especially for toxic accumulation in the back, which can cause agitation, confusion, and dreams; those experiencing vomiting and lack of appetite should also take it.
Ingredients: Gan Cao Jie, five qian; Zhen Dou Fen, one liang; Da Zhu Sha, three qian; Mei Hua Bing Pian, five fen; Niu Huang, three fen.
All to be finely powdered. Each dose involves taking one qian, mixed with a light bamboo leaf and shell heart soup to adjust.[313p]

　　雌雄霹雳火　治脱疽，及一切发背初起不疼痛者，并宜灸之。　　蕲艾茸二钱　丁香　雌黄　雄黄各二分　麝香一分　　右下四味，共研极细，搓入艾中，作豌豆大丸，放于患上灸之，毋论痛痒，以内焦为度。如毒已经走散，就红晕尽处，排炷灸之，痛则至痒，痒则至痛为妙。灸后，仍用提疔麦子贴上膏盖，次服蟾酥丸及解毒济生汤兼治，转回活色，有脓为妙。
　　金液戊土丹　治脱疽及疔疮发背，纵食膏粱厚味法酒，又或丹石补药，勉力房劳，多致积毒脏腑，久则胃汁中干，肾水枯竭，不能上制心火，以致消渴消中消肾，饶饮多干，能食多瘦，九窍不通，惊悸健忘。此证若出，后必发疽，多难治疗，宜预服此，亦可转重就轻，移深就浅。又解五金八石之毒药也。[314p]

Female and male thunderfire treats gangrene and all initial stages of boils that are not painful; it is advisable to use moxibustion.

Two qian of Qiai herb, two fen each of clove, female yellow, and male yellow, one fen of musk. Grind these four ingredients very finely, roll them into a mixture with mugwort, and form pea-sized pills. Place them on the affected area for moxibustion, disregarding pain or itchiness, using internal heat as a measure. If the poison has already dispersed, treat the area up to where the redness ends, using moxibustion there; if it hurts, it should turn to itching, and if it itches, it should turn to pain, as this is ideal. After moxibustion, apply a wheat paste on top and take toad venom pills and detoxifying life-restoring decoction, along with treating the condition; it is excellent to see discharge of pus.

Golden liquid and earth elixir treat gangrene and boils. Even if one consumes rich foods and alcohol, or takes restorative herbs, excessive exertion can lead to accumulated toxins in the organs. Over time, gastric juices may dry up and kidney water deplete, preventing control over heart fire, resulting in diabetes, dryness, excessive thirst, inability to eat well, weight loss, blocked orifices, anxiety, and forgetfulness. Once this condition arises, it may lead to sores that are difficult to treat; it is wise to take this as a preventive measure, which may help alleviate severe conditions to lighter ones, or from deeper to shallower issues. Additionally, it also detoxifies poisons from metals and stones.[314p]

　　人中黄研　茯神　胡黄连　生地酒蒸，捣膏　乌梅肉捣膏　五味子各一两　石菖蒲　远志　雄黄研　辰砂飞　硝石研，各三钱　牛黄另研　冰片各一钱　金箔二十张为衣　各为净末，配准前数，共入乳钵内，再研千转，于端午、七夕或二至、二分吉辰，在净室中，先将乌梅、地黄二膏，捣极烂和药，渐加炼蜜少许，徐徐添捣，软硬得中。每药二两，分作十丸，金箔为衣。每服一丸，用人乳、童便共一大杯，化药，随病上下食前后服之。此药最解膏粱金石药毒，杀三尸，除劳热，极有奇功。又治烦热颠狂，安神志，辟瘴瘟，及诸邪魅，谵语妄情，失心丧志者，俱效。修合之时，服药之际，俱忌妇人僧尼孝服鸡犬等见之。此药用蜡封固收藏，不泄药味，愈久愈效。[315p]

To prepare the medicine, take one tael each of yellow ochre, Poria, Coptis chinensis, and fresh rehmannia steamed in wine, then pound into a paste. Pound the flesh of black plum and five-flavored fruit, each one tael. Additionally, take three qian each of stone calamus, Polygala, powdered realgar, vermilion, and nitre, as well as one qian each of bull bile and borneol. Use twenty sheets of gold leaf as a coating.

Grind all substances into a fine powder and mix according to the prescribed amounts. Place everything in a mortar and grind for a thousand turns. On auspicious days such as the Dragon Boat Festival, Qixi, the Summer and Winter Solstice, in a clean room, first mix the pastes of black plum and rehmannia thoroughly, then gradually add a little refined honey while continuing to pound until the mixture reaches the right consistency of softness and firmness.

Take two taels of each medicine, divide into ten pills, and coat with gold leaf. For each dose, dissolve one pill in a large cup of human milk and children's urine, and take it before and after meals according to the condition of the illness. This medicine is particularly effective at resolving the toxic effects of rich foods, suppressing evil spirits, alleviating fever, and has remarkable efficacy.

It also treats restlessness and agitation, calms the spirit, prevents pestilence, and alleviates various evils, including delusions and loss of will. During the period of preparation and while taking the medicine, one should avoid contact with women, monks, nuns, and any mourning attire, as well as dogs and chickens.

Store this medicine sealed in wax to preserve its efficacy; the longer it is kept, the more effective it becomes.[315p]

　　保安万灵丹　治痈疽疔毒，对口发颐，风湿风温，湿痰流注，附骨阴疽，鹤膝风证，左瘫右痪，口眼喎斜，半身不遂，气血凝滞，遍身走痛，步履艰辛，偏坠疝气，偏正头风，破伤风，牙关紧闭，感冒风寒，无不应效。　　全蝎　石斛　明天麻　甘草炙　麻黄　当归　羌活　荆芥　防风　细辛　草乌汤泡，去皮尖　何首乌　川芎　川乌汤泡、去皮尖，各一两　雄黄六钱　茅朮八两　　右为细末，炼蜜丸弹子大，每药，一两分作四丸，一两作六丸，一两作九丸，三等做下，以备年岁老壮，病势缓急。朱砂六钱，研细为衣，磁罐收贮。用时以连须大葱白九枝，煎汤一茶锺，化开一丸，服尽，被盖出汗为效。如汗迟，再用葱汤催之。得汗渐渐退下衣物，其汗自敛。未成者随消，已成者随即高肿。服后避风，当食稀粥。忌冷物房事。孕妇勿服。[316p]

Bao'an Wanling Dan treats carbuncles, sores, and poison; it is effective for oral and facial issues, wind and dampness, phlegm and fluid retention, bone-related Yin sores, crepitant wind syndrome, left-sided paralysis, right-sided paralysis, crooked mouth and eyes, hemiplegia, stagnation of qi and blood, widespread pain, difficulty walking, unilateral hernias, headache, tetanus, clenched jaws, and colds from wind and cold—nothing is beyond its efficacy.

Ingredients include: whole scorpion, dendrobium, bright gastrodia, honey-fried licorice, ephedra, angelica, qinghao, schisandra, and fine xixin, prepared with aconite broth (peeled and tips removed), he shou wu, chuanxiong, and prepared with aconite broth (peeled and tips removed), each one tael; realgar six qian; and eight taels of tawny gentian.

Grind the above into a fine powder and make pills the size of a marble. For each ingredient, one tael is divided into four pills; one tael makes six pills; and one tael makes nine pills. Prepare according to the desired effect and intensity of illness.

For use, take six qian of realgar, grind it finely and use it as a coating; store in a magnetic jar. When needed, boil nine segments of scallions in water to make a tea, dissolve one pill, and drink it all, then cover up to induce sweating as the effect. If sweating is delayed, use the scallion tea to encourage it.

When sweating begins, gradually remove clothing; the sweat will naturally diminish. If symptoms are not severe, they will gradually dissipate; if they are severe, swelling may be immediate. After taking, avoid wind and consume light porridge. Avoid cold foods and sexual activity. Do not take if pregnant.[316p]

　　圣愈汤　治溃疡脓水出多，气血虚极，脉细空而无力，以致心烦不安，眠睡不宁，或五心烦躁等证并服。　　熟地黄　生地黄　川芎　人参各五钱　归身　黄芪盐水炒，各一钱　　右作一剂，水二茶锺，煎八分，食远服。[317p]

Sheng Yu Decoction treats excessive pus discharge from ulcers, with severe deficiency of qi and blood, resulting in a thin, weak pulse, leading to restlessness, anxiety, and disturbed sleep, as well as symptoms like irritability in the five hearts.

　　蟾酥丸　治疔疮发背，脑疽乳痈，附骨臀腿等疽，一切恶证歹疮，不痛或麻木，或呕吐病重者，必多昏愦。此药服之，不起发者即发，不痛者即痛，痛甚者即止，昏愦者即苏，呕吐者即解，未成者即消，已成者即溃，真有回生之功，乃恶证中至宝丹也。　　蟾酥二钱，酒化　轻粉五分　枯矾　寒水石煅　铜绿　乳香　没药　胆矾　麝香另研，各一钱　雄黄二钱　蜗牛二十一个朱砂二钱　以上各为末，称准，于端午日午时，在净室中，先将蜗牛研烂，再同蟾酥和研稠粘，方入各药，共捣极匀，丸如菉豆大，每服三丸，用葱白五寸，患者自嚼烂，吐于男左女右手心，包药在内，用无灰热酒一茶杯送下，被盖如人行五六里，出汗为效。甚者，再进一服。修合时，妇人鸡犬等忌见。[318p]

Chansu Pills are used to treat carbuncles and abscesses, brain sores and breast abscesses, as well as abscesses on the buttocks and thighs, and all manner of severe ailments and harmful sores that are either painless or numb, or accompanied by severe vomiting or delirium. When taking this medicine, those who do not generate painful sensations will begin to feel pain; those who are in pain will find it alleviated; those who are delirious will regain their senses; those who are vomiting will have relief; unripe abscesses will resolve, while mature ones will rupture. It truly possesses the power of resurrection, making it the invaluable elixir among severe ailments.

The recipe includes 2 qian of chansu, dissolved in wine; 5 fen of light powder; 1 qian each of dry alum, calcined cold water stone, copper green, frankincense, myrrh, and vitriol; 2 qian of realgar; 21 pieces of snail; and 2 qian of cinnabar. All of these should be ground into a fine powder, measured accurately, and on the day of the Dragon Boat Festival at noon, in a clean room, first grind the snail into a paste, then combine it with chansu and grind into a thick adhesive; add all the other medicines and pound them together thoroughly. Form pills about the size of mung beans. The dosage is three pills at a time, taken with a five-inch section of the green onion, which the patient should chew until it disintegrates, then spit in the palm of the left hand for men and the right hand for women, enclosing the medicine inside. Take it down with a cup of hot wine without ash, and the patient should walk about five or six li until sweating occurs for effect. If the condition is severe, take an additional dose. During the preparation, women and animals such as chickens and dogs should not be present.[318p]

四肢门

　　　　单方

　　石村刘大尹治臁疮膏药：用芝麻油四两，铜锅内煎，葱白三根，煮黑色取出；入川椒去目一两，煮黑色，滤去；入铜青末一两，以槐枝十根，各长一尺合搅，焦一节截去一节，以尽为度；后入白矾一两，黄蜡五钱，煎良久，倾碗内成膏。每以油单纸夹膏一匙于中，以银针刺之，密密多孔。先以浓茶洗疮口，贴膏于上，反复转换，时得痛为佳。止用一二贴立效。年深者，不过五七贴。其膏存久益效。
　　刘川州治臁疮方：用香油一两，铁杓煎，入黄蜡五钱化开；用铜绿三钱，研极细末，徐徐入铁杓内，作五十余次入；将铜钱判末，另放碗里，将药倾入碗内，冷定。将疮洗净，用毡一块如疮大，摊药于上，勒放患处，一日一换。换时先要洗净疮上。
　　足上转筋：以故绵浸酢中，甑蒸热裹之，冷即易，勿停，取瘥止。 【《外台秘要》】
　　凡脚心肿痛，或因久行久立致者，以水和蚯蚓粪厚敷，一夕即愈。 【《永类钤方》】[320p]

Four Limb Gate

Single Prescription

Liu Dayin from Shicun treats ulcerated sores with a medicated plaster: Use four taels of sesame oil, heat in a copper pot, and add three stalks of green onion, boiling until they turn black; then add one tael of ground Sichuan pepper, boil until black, and strain away; add one tael of copper green powder and ten branches of locust wood, each one foot long, and stir together, burn one segment off until it is fully utilized; then add one tael of alum and five qian of yellow wax, simmer for a long time until it becomes a paste. Each time, place a spoonful of the paste wrapped in oil paper and pierce it with a silver needle to create many small holes. Clean the wound with strong tea before applying the paste, changing it repeatedly, and a stinging sensation is a good sign. Usually, one or two applications yield quick results, and for long-standing cases, no more than five to seven applications are needed. The longer the paste is stored, the more effective it becomes.

Liu Chuanzhou's formula for treating ulcerated sores: Use one tael of fragrance oil, heating it in an iron ladle, and add five qian of yellow wax to dissolve; then add three qian of copper green powder, grinding it very finely, and slowly mixing it into the iron ladle for more than fifty times; separate the powdered copper money into another bowl, pour the mixture into the bowl, and let it cool and set. Clean the sore and place a piece of felt, sized to the sore, on top of it, applying the medicine and securing it in place, changing it once a day. Be sure to wash the sore clean before each change.

For muscle cramps in the feet: Soak old cotton in vinegar, steam it hot, wrap it around, and change it once it cools. Do not stop until healed.

For all cases of swelling and pain in the soles of the feet, or those caused by prolonged walking or standing, mix dirt from earthworms with water and apply thickly; it will heal overnight.[320p]

　　寒湿脚气：用古砖烧红，以陈臭米泔水焠之，乘热布包三块，用膝夹住，绵被覆之，三五次愈。【《扶寿方》】
　　风湿脚痛：用针砂、川乌头为末，和匀炒热，绵包熨之。 【《摘元方》】
　　脚腿红肿，热如火炙，俗名赤游风，用铁锈水涂解之。 【《惠济方》】
　　脚气痛楚：无名异末化牛皮胶调涂之，频换。 【《易简方》】
　　风气脚弱：孔公孽二斤，石斛五两，酒二斗，浸服。 【《肘后方》】
　　风冷脚气：白矾石煅三斤，酒三斗，渍三日，稍稍饮之。 【《肘后方》】
　　脚缝出水：好黄丹入花乳石末掺之。 【《试效方》】
　　一切脚气：盐三升蒸热，分裹近壁，以脚踏之，令脚心热。又和槐白皮蒸之尤良，夜夜用之。【《食疗本草》】
　　脚气疼痛：每夜用盐擦腿膝至足甲，淹少时，以热汤泡洗。有一人病此，曾用验。 【《救急方》】[321p]

Cold and Damp Beriberi: Use ancient bricks, heat them red, then extinguish with water from aged, odorous rice, and while hot, wrap three pieces in cloth and hold between the knees, covering with a cotton blanket. Repeat three to five times for a cure.

Wind and Damp Foot Pain: Grind needle sand and Chuanwu roots into powder, mix and heat, then apply with a cloth.

Red and Swollen Feet, Hot like Fire: Known as "Red Traveling Wind," relieve by applying rust water.

Foot Pain from Beriberi: Use an unnamed powder mixed with cowhide glue to apply, changing frequently.

Weakness from Wind: Two jin of Konggong Sleeves, five liang of Dendrobium, and two dou of wine, soak and consume.

Cold and Windy Beriberi: Three jin of calcined alum stone, three dou of wine, soak for three days, and drink slightly.

Water from Foot Spaces: Mix good yellow lead with powdered flower stone.

All Types of Beriberi: Steam three sheng of salt until hot, wrap in cloth and step on it to warm the soles. Additionally, steaming with white locust bark is particularly effective; use this nightly.

Painful Beriberi: Each night, scrub the legs and knees with salt up to the toenails, soak for a short time, and wash with hot soup. There was a person who suffered from this illness and had success using this method.[321p]

　　风毒脚气痹弱：硫黄末三两，锺乳五升，煮沸，入水煎至三升，每服三合。　　又方：牛乳三升，煎一升半，以五合调硫黄末一两服。厚盖取汗，勿见风。未汗再服。将息调理数日，更服。北人用此多效。亦可煎，或为丸服。【《肘后方》】
　　风湿脚气：石亭脂生用一两，川乌头生一两，无名异二两，为末，葱白自然汁，和丸梧子大，每服一钱，空心淡茶生葱吞下，日一服。【《瑞竹堂方》】
　　脚气冲心：白矾三两，水一斗五升，煎沸浸洗。 【《千金方》】
　　脚气风湿虚汗，少力多痛：烧矾末一匙头，投沸汤，淋洗痛处。
　　南方地卑湿，人多患足疮，岁久生虫如蛭，乃风毒攻注而然。
　　用牛肚或羊肚或猪肚，去粪不洗，研如泥，看疮大小，入煅过枯矾半两，共研匀涂帛上贴之，须臾痒入心徐徐连帛取下，火上炙之，虫出如丝发马尾千万，或青白赤黑，以汤洗之，三日一作，不过数次，虫尽疮愈。【《岣嵝神书》】[322p]

Wind toxins causing foot disease and weakness: Use three taels of sulfur powder and five sheng of cow's milk, boil it, then steep it in water until it reaches three sheng. Take three he each time. Another method: Take three sheng of cow's milk and boil it down to one and a half sheng, mixing in one tael of sulfur powder to take. Cover well to induce sweating and avoid wind. If sweat doesn’t occur, take again. After resting and adjusting for a few days, take again. This is very effective for northern people. It can also be boiled or made into pills.

For wind and damp foot disease: Use one tael of raw stone extract, one tael of raw Chuan Wutou, and two taels of an unnamed herb, ground into powder. Mix with the juice of white scallion to form pills the size of a jujube. Take one qian each time with lightly brewed tea and raw scallion, once a day.

For foot disease reaching the heart: Use three taels of white alum and five sheng of water, boil and soak for washing.

For foot disease caused by wind, damp, and deficiency with light strength and much pain: Take a spoonful of burnt alum powder, toss it into boiling water, and wash the painful area.

In the southern regions, where the land is low and damp, many people suffer from foot sores, that for years may harbor worms like leeches, resulting from wind toxin attacks.

Use cow, sheep, or pig stomachs, remove the waste without washing, and grind into a paste. Depending on the size of the sore, add half a tael of calcined dry alum, mix uniformly, and apply on cloth and stick it on the sore. After a moment, if it itches deeply, gradually remove the cloth, heat it over the fire, and the worms will come out like countless threads of a horse's tail, either blue, white, red, or black. Wash them out with water, do this every three days for a few times, and the worms will be exhausted and the sores will heal.[322p]

　　嵌甲作疮，乃足趾甲入肉作疮，不可履靴，矾石烧灰敷之，蚀恶肉，生好肉，细细割去甲角，旬日取愈。此方神效。【《肘后方》】

　　甲疽延烂，或因割甲伤肌，或因甲长侵肉遂成疮肿，黄水浸淫相染，五指俱烂，渐上脚趺，泡浆四边起，如火烧疮，日夜怪憎，医不能疗。绿矾石五两，烧至汁尽，研末，色如黄丹，收之，每以盐汤洗拭，用末敷之，以软帛缓裹之，当日取汁断疮干。每日一遍，盐汤洗濯，有脓处使净，其痂干处不须近，但有急痛则涂酥少许，令润，三日即觉疮上痂起，依前洗敷，十日痂渐剥尽，软处或更生白脓泡，即擦破敷之，自然瘥也。张侍郎病此，卧经六十日，诸医无效，得此法如神。【《外台秘要》，下同】[323p]

This remedy is remarkably effective.

In cases of nail diseases that become rotten, it may be due to nail cutting injuring the skin or the nail growing into the flesh, leading to sores and swelling. This may cause yellow fluid to soak in, resulting in the fingers becoming rotten and eventually spreading up the foot, with blisters forming around the edges, as if burned by fire, causing constant pain and being unhealable by doctors. Take five liang of green vitriol, burn it until all the liquid is gone, and grind it into a powder that is yellow in color. Store it to use, washing with salt water, and apply the powder. Wrap it gently in a soft cloth, and the very same day, it will stop the fluid and dry the sore. Do this once a day, washing with salt water, ensuring any pus is cleaned out. For areas where scabs have formed, do not disturb them unless there is urgent pain, in which case apply a little butter to soothe. After three days, you will notice the scab lifting. Continue washing and applying treatment as before, and within ten days the scabs will gradually come off. If soft areas develop more white pus blisters, break them and apply the treatment, and they will naturally heal. A certain Zhang Shilang suffered from this ailment for sixty days without relief from various doctors, but found this method effective as if it were a miracle.[323p]

Tendon cramps: One tael of pine resin, shaven to the size of rice, one qian of frankincense, fry in silver stoneware over low heat until charred, retaining one or two points of potency. Grind into powder and take one or two qian mixed with hot papaya wine; this cures all tendon diseases.

To treat lumbago with swelling in the legs: Use four sheng of Sichuan pepper, boil with four dou of water until two and a half dou remain. Store in a jar and warm it by fire, creating a bridge with a board. Remove the broth leaving about two inches, place your feet on the board, and sit with support. Seal with cotton to prevent air from escaping. If fatigued, step out, wipe with powdered medicine, then return to the jar. Ensure the fire beneath the jar is continuous, without the broth washing over. Following this method, within seven days you can find relief, and the swelling will also subside.

Another method: Use one liang of earth bone bark, half liang each of white wax and licorice root, fry them with fragrant oil until well-cooked, strain, then add one and a half liang of yellow lead and continue to cook until black; mix in wax and spread on white paper. Next, use wintergreen leaves boiled in vinegar as a compress on the sore.[342p]

　　治风湿寒痹，麻木不仁，粥法：用川乌生为末，用香熟白米作粥半碗，药末四钱，同米熬熟，稀薄不要稠，下姜汁一茶匙脚许，蜜三大匙，搅匀，空心啜之，温为佳。如是中湿，更入薏苡仁末二钱，增米作一中碗。服此粥大治手足四肢不随，痛不能举者。有此证者，须预服防之。左氏曰：风淫末疾，谓四肢为四末也。脾主四肢，风邪客于肝则淫脾，脾为肝克，故疾在末，谷气引风湿之药径入脾经，故四肢得安。此汤剂极有力，予尝制此方以授人，服者皆验。

To treat wind, damp, and cold blockages causing numbness and lack of sensation, the porridge method is as follows: Use fresh Chuanwu (a specific herb) and grind it into a powder. Mix this with half a bowl of cooked white rice porridge, adding four qian (a unit of weight) of the powdered medicine. Cook this mixture until well blended, keeping it thin rather than thick. Add one teaspoon of ginger juice and three large tablespoons of honey, stirring well. Consume it on an empty stomach, and it is best warm. If there's dampness involved, additionally incorporate two qian of coix seed powder, and increase the rice to make one medium bowl. Eating this porridge greatly alleviates issues with limbs that are unresponsive or painful and unable to lift. For those with such symptoms, it is essential to take preventative measures.

According to Master Zuo: Wind can affect the limbs, which are referred to as the four extremities. The spleen governs the limbs, and when wind evils invade the liver, they are mischievous towards the spleen. As the spleen is subdued by the liver, the ailment manifests in the extremities. The energy from grains attracts wind and dampness, which directly enters the spleen channel, hence providing comfort to the limbs. This remedy is potent, and I have previously formulated this prescription for others, with successful results.

　　里外臁疮：羊屎烧存性，研末，入轻粉涂之。 【《集要》】
　　臁胫生疮：用中鲫鱼三尾洗净，穿山甲二钱，以长皂荚一挺，劈开两片，夹住扎之，煨存性研末，先以井水洗净脓水，用白竹叶刺孔贴之，候水出尽，以麻油、轻粉调药傅之，日一次。【《直指方》】
　　臁胫烂疮：牛蹄甲烧灰，桐油和敷。 【《海上方》】

Wet Toxins and Ulcers: Mix shavings from dry bamboo and yellow bitter herb, wash with scallion, pepper, and tea soup, then apply daily.

Internal and External Ulcers: Burn sheep dung to retain ash, grind it to powder and apply with light powder.

Ulcers on the Shins: Use three cleaned carp, two taels of pangolin, and one long soap pod split into two, fastening them together. Then, use sesame oil and light powder to prepare the medicine, applying once a day.

Rotten Ulcers on the Shins: Burn bull hoofs to ash and mix with tung oil for application.

Ulcers Infested with Worms: Take thirty small prawns, remove heads and shells, and mash them with sticky rice; cover with gauze. Change the gauze after one night, revealing small red worms. Wash with scallion and pepper soup, cut white bamboo leaves to size for topical application, and change twice daily until fluids are fully drained. Daily rinse with bitter neem root decoction and apply a good ointment. Use raw meat but do not change the medication; avoid irritants.[355p]

　　臁疮溃烂三四年：马牙匡骨烧研，先以土窖过小便，洗数次，擦之。 【《圣惠方》】
　　治臁疮极妙：地骨皮一斤，黄蘗二两，銼为粗末，用香油一斤半，煎滤过药油六七两，入净松香十两，黄丹二两，同煎，候黄丹微黑色，却入轻粉七角，光粉二角，煎法皆如煎膏法，用长条纸拖过，挂干用。若疮紫黑，先用三棱针去恶血，以冷水洗净，随疮大小，剪膏药掩上，用绢帛扎紧，俟一周时再换膏药。换时须用冷水洗疮，不过数换，不问新久即愈。须忌日气、火气、阳气。傥换膏药再看，如有黑肿未尽，可再出血，以紫黑血尽为度。【《纲目》，下同】[356p]

Blood wind sores: use shrimp and yellow lead ground together and apply, changing daily.

Here are the translations of the provided Classical Chinese text:

  • Another remedy: Jinrao fragrant leaves, also known as She tea, chopped and applied as a cold compress.

  • Another remedy: One chicken egg, open the shell and pour out a little; dip a finger in it and apply intermittently.

  • Another remedy: Soft bone herb, red hemp, golden cup grass, and earring tail, chopped, fried with salt and wine and applied as a compress.

  • Another remedy: Mountain smartweed leaves, field hemp, ground dock, and field snail, chopped, fried with salt and wine and applied as a compress.

  • Another remedy: Mountain bottle gourd root and Jinrao fragrant leaves, pound them together and fry with wine to apply as a compress.

  • Another remedy: Purple gold bell and June snow, chopped and fried as a compress.

  • Golden chicken tongue powder: treats disease lumps. Use golden chicken tongue ground with wine for oral intake, or ground with half water and half vinegar for a warm application.

  • Disease crab fork: Use old garlic chives root and leaves, chopped and fried with wine and applied as a compress. Another remedy: (Muzhen) leaf chopped and fried as a compress. Also, use small leaves, boil in a clean jar, and use the steam to wash, also effective.

  • Wind sore: Use a green bamboo tube, one and a half inches in diameter and three feet long, place a liter of soybeans in the middle, add husk and horse manure and burn them to ash. Burn this in the bamboo tube, catch the juice with a vessel at both ends. First wash the wound with a hot saline solution, then apply the bean juice not more than three times, extremely effective.

  • Another remedy: Chew sesame seeds and apply, wrapped in cotton, changing daily, remarkably effective.[363p]
