四肢门

　　　　针灸

　　《素问》曰：肝热病者，热争则狂言及惊，胁满痛，手足躁，不得安卧。庚辛甚，甲乙大汗。气逆则庚辛死。刺足厥阴少阳。　　肾热病者，先腰痛胻酸，苦渴数饮，身热。热争则项痛而强，胻寒且酸，足下热，不欲言。其逆则项痛员员淡淡然。戊己甚，壬癸大汗。气逆则戊己死。刺足少阴太阳。　　热病，先胸胁痛，手足躁，刺足少阳，补足太阴。病甚者，为五十九刺。　　热病手臂痛者，刺手阳明、太阴而汗出止。　　热病始于足胫者，刺足阳明而汗出止。　　《灵枢经》曰：正月、二月、三月，人气在左，无刺左足之阳。四月、五月、六月，人气在右，无刺右足之阳。七月、八月、九月，人气在右，无刺右足之阴。十月、十一月、十二月，人气在左，无刺左足之阴。[364p]

Ancient and Modern Compendium of Books: Complete Record of the Medical Section, Volume 197

Four Limbs Door

Acupuncture and Moxibustion

The Suwen says: In cases of liver heat disease, there is heated contention resulting in delirium and agitation, fullness and pain in the sides, restlessness in the hands and feet, unable to lie down peacefully. When severe, it leads to extreme sweating. Reversed qi can result in death. Needling the foot’s Jueyin and Shaoyang points is recommended.

In cases of kidney heat disease, there is initial pain in the lower back, acidity in the legs, thirst with frequent drinking, and fever. Heated contention leads to neck pain and stiffness, cold and sourness in the legs, with warmth below the feet and reluctance to speak. Reversed qi can lead to subtle neck pain. When severe, it causes extreme sweating. Needling the foot’s Shaoyin and Taiyang points is recommended.

In cases of fever disease, there is initial pain in the chest and sides, restlessness in the hands and feet; needling the foot’s Shaoyang and supplementing the foot's Taiyin are advised. For severe cases, fifty-nine needles are used.

For fever-related arm pain, needling the hand’s Yangming and Taiyin points helps to stop the sweating.

If the fever begins in the legs and shins, needling the foot’s Yangming point will help to stop the sweating.

The Lingshu Classic states: In January, February, and March, the human energy is in the left side, hence do not needle the Yang point of the left foot. In April, May, and June, the energy is in the right side, hence do not needle the Yang point of the right foot. In July, August, and September, the energy is again in the right side, hence do not needle the Yin point of the right foot. In October, November, and December, the energy is in the left side, hence do not needle the Yin point of the left foot.[364p]

　　手太阴之别名曰列缺，起于腕上分间，并太阴之经，直入掌中，散入于鱼际。其病实则手锐掌热，虚则欠(去欠)，小便遗数。取之去腕半寸，别走阳明也。　　手少阳之别名曰外关，去腕二寸，外绕臂，注胸中，合心主。病实则肘挛，虚则不收。取之所别也。　　足阳明之别名曰丰隆，去踝八寸，别走太阴；其别者循胫骨外廉，上络头项，合诸经之气，下络喉嗌。其病气逆则喉痹卒喑。实则狂颠，虚则足不收胫枯。取之所别也。　　邪在肝，则两胁中痛，寒中，恶血在内行，善掣节，时脚肿。取之行间以引胁下，补三里以温胃中，取血脉以散恶血，取耳间青脉以去其掣。　　身有所伤，血出多，及中风寒，若有所堕坠，四肢懈惰不收，名曰体惰。取其小腹脐下三结交。三结交者，阳明太阴也，脐下三寸关元也。　　暴挛癎眩，足不任身，取天柱。[365p]

The hand Taiyin is also called Lieque, starting at the wrist and connecting with the Taiyin channel, extending directly into the palm and dispersing into the space between the thumb and index finger. When there is excess, it manifests as sharp pain and heat in the palm; when there is deficiency, it results in frequent urination. The point is located half an inch below the wrist, connecting to the Yangming channel.

The hand Shaoyang is called Waiguan, located two inches above the wrist on the outer arm, leading to the chest and connecting with the heart. In cases of excess, it causes elbow stiffness; in deficiency, it results in inability to close. This point is likewise a connecting point.

The foot Yangming is known as Fenglong, found eight inches above the ankle, diverging from the Taiyin; its path follows the outer side of the shinbone, connecting the head, converging with the energy of various channels, and also linking to the throat. If the qi is reversed, it can cause throat obstruction and sudden loss of voice; with excess, it leads to mania, while deficiency results in inability to gather strength in the feet, causing atrophy of the shins. This point signifies a connection as well.

If there is pathogenic influence in the liver, there will be pain in the sides and central area, with cold symptoms, bad blood stagnating inside, leading to spasms, and occasional swelling of the feet. Treat by stimulating the Xingjian point to draw down the sides, tonifying Sanli point to warm the stomach, relieving the bad blood by accessing the blood vessels, and using the ear's lateral veins to alleviate the spasms.

If there are injuries with significant bleeding or if one suffers from wind-cold, leading to a sensation of falling, with laxity of the limbs, it is termed body lethargy. The treatment is to stimulate the area three inches below the navel. This area is the intersection of the Yangming and Taiyin channels, also seen as the Guanyuan point, three inches below the navel.

For severe convulsions, dizziness, or inability to keep the body upright, the Tianzhu point should be used.[365p]

　　病始手臂者，先取手阳明、太阴而汗出。病始头首者，先取项太阳而汗出。病始足胫者，先取足阳明而汗出。　　热病面青脑痛，手足躁，取之筋间，以第四针于四逆。筋躄目浸，索筋于肝，不得索之金。金者肺也。　　足髀不可举，侧而取之在枢合中。以员利针，大针不可刺。病注下血，取曲泉。　　云门、髃骨、委中、髓空，此八者，以泻四肢之热也。　　左足应立春，其日戊寅、己丑。左手应立夏，其日戊辰、己巳。右手应立秋，其日戊申、己未。右足应立冬，其日戊戌、己亥。腰尻以下应冬至，其日壬子。大禁太乙所在之日及诸戊己。凡此九者，善候八正所在之处，所主左右上下，身体有痈肿者，欲治之，无以其所直之日渍治之，是谓天忌日也。　　《金匮要略》曰：病趺蹶，其人但能前，不能却，刺腨入二分，此太阳经伤也。　　《甲乙经》曰：寒热懈懒，淫泺胫酸，四肢重痛，少气难言，至阳主之。[366p]

When a disease begins in the arms, first treat the Hand Yangming and Taiyin to induce sweating. When a disease begins in the head, first treat the Neck Taiyang to induce sweating. When a disease begins in the legs, first treat the Foot Yangming to induce sweating.

For heat diseases with a greenish face and headache, accompanied by restlessness in the hands and feet, stimulate the muscles between them with the fourth needle at the Four Reversals. When muscles are stiff and the eyes are watery, focus on the liver but do not disturb the metal, which corresponds to the lungs.

If the legs cannot be lifted, lie on the side and treat the area at the Pivot Joint. Use a round, smooth needle; do not stab with a large needle. For bleeding hemorrhoids, treat at the Ququan point.

The points Yunmen, Yugu, Weizhong, and Suikong, these eight points are used to drain heat from the limbs.

The left foot corresponds to the beginning of spring, on the days of Wuyin and Jichou. The left hand corresponds to the beginning of summer, on the days of Wuchen and Jisi. The right hand corresponds to the beginning of autumn, on the days of Wushen and Jiwuwei. The right foot corresponds to the beginning of winter, on the days of Wuxu and Jihai. The waist and below should be treated at the winter solstice, on the day of Renzi. The major prohibitions occur on the days of Taiyi and all Wuxi. Of these nine rules, one must be careful to observe the eight points in their proper places, attending to the directions left, right, above, and below. If there are abscesses or swellings on the body, to treat them, do not use the days directly indicated, as this is called an auspicious day forbidden by heaven.

The "Synopsis of the Golden Chamber" states: For a disease characterized by inability to retreat, where the person can only move forward, needle the abdomen two fen deep; this is due to an injury in the Taiyang channel.

The "Classic of Changes" states: In cold and heat, there is lethargy and aching in the limbs, with heaviness and pain in the extremities, and difficulty in speech; this is ruled by the Great Yang.[366p]

　　胸中膨膨然，甚则交两手而瞀，暴痹喘逆，刺经渠及天府，此谓之大俞。　　寒热咳，呕沫，掌中热；虚则肩臂寒栗，少气不足以息；寒厥交两手而瞀，口沫出；实则肩背热痛，汗出，四肢暴肿，身温摇，时寒热；饥则烦，饱则善，面色变，口噤不开，恶风泣出，列缺主之。　　心痛如悬，阴厥脚腨后廉急不可前却，血痈肠澼，便脓血，足跗上痛，舌卷不能言，善笑，足痿不收履，溺青赤白黄黑。[367p]

In the chest, there is a swelling sensation, so intense that one may cross their hands and feel dizzy, with violent convulsions, shortness of breath, and pain in the channels and the Tianfu point; this is called "Da Yu."

For cold and heat symptoms such as coughing and spitting, there is heat in the palms; if deficient, one experiences cold shivers in the shoulders and arms, and insufficient breath; when cold and convulsions occur, hands tremble and froth comes from the mouth; if excessive, there is heat and pain in the shoulders and back, sweating and swelling in the limbs, a feeling of warmth shaking throughout the body, alternation of cold and heat; hunger leads to restlessness, while fullness brings comfort, facial color changes, the mouth cannot be opened, and aversion to wind manifests with tears; the point Lieque governs this.

Heart pain feels like being suspended; there are hidden cold symptoms with urgent pain in the lower abdomen, blood stasis causing fecal pus and blood, pain in the feet and ankles, inability to speak due to tongue rolling, excessive laughter, and atrophy of the feet leading to the inability to wear shoes, with urine appearing in blue, red, white, or black.[367p]

青取井，赤取荣，黄取输，白取经，黑取合。　　寒热酸痛，四肢不举，腋下肿，马刀瘘，喉痹，髀膝，颈骨摇，酸痹不仁，阳辅主之。　　寒热善唏，头重足寒，不欲食，脚挛，京骨主之。　　寒热篡后出，瘈瘲，脚腨酸重，战栗不能久立，脚急肿，跗痛，足筋挛，少腹痛引喉嗌，大便难，承筋主之。　　跟厥膝急，腰脊痛引腹篡，阴股热，阴暴痛，寒热，膝酸重，合阳主之。　　胸胁榰满，膈逆不通，呼吸少气，喘息，不得举臂，步廊主之。　　胸满马刀，臂不得举，渊腋主之。[368p]

Green corresponds to the well, red to honor, yellow to transmission, white to scripture, and black to convergence.

For cold and heat, sourness and pain, limbs unable to raise, swelling under the armpits, horse knife abscess, throat obstruction, hip and knee issues, and shaky neck bones, Yangfu is in charge of these.

For cold and heat with sighing, heavy head and cold feet, lack of appetite, cramping legs, Jinggu is in charge of these.

For cold and heat occurring afterward, convulsions, heaviness and pain in the feet, trembling and inability to stand for long, swelling in the feet, pain in the ankle joints, pain in the lower abdomen leading to throat, difficulty in bowel movements, and Chengjin is in charge of these.

For acute coldness in the knees and feet, back pain radiating to the abdomen, heat in the groin, sudden severe pain, cold and hot sensations, heaviness in the knees, Huyang is in charge of these.

For fullness in the chest and sides, reverse Qi in the diaphragm, shallow breathing, wheezing, inability to raise arms, and Buluang is in charge of these.

For fullness in the chest and horse knife pain, inability to raise the arms, and Yuanyan is in charge of these.[368p]

　　善惊悲不乐，厥胫足下热，面尽热，渴，行间主之。　　胆眩寒厥，手臂痛，善惊妄言，面赤泣出，腋门主之。　　腰脊痛，强引背少腹，俯仰难，不得仰息，脚痿重，尻不举，溺赤，腰以下至足清，不仁，不可以坐起，膀胱俞主之。　　腰痛怏怏，不可以俛仰，腰以下至足不仁，入脊腰背寒，次髎主之。先取缺盆，后取尾骶与八髎。　　腰痛不可举，足跟中踝后痛，脚痿，仆参主之。　　气癃(疒颓)疝，阴急，股枢腨内廉痛，交信主之。　　胸满膨膨然，实则癃闭，腋下肿，虚则遗溺，脚急兢兢然，筋急痛，不得大小便，腰痛引腹，不得俯仰，委阳主之。　　热病先手臂瘈瘲，唇口聚，鼻张目下，汗出如转珠，两乳下二寸坚，胁满悸，列缺主之。[369p]

Feeling startled, sad, and unhappy, with heat beneath the shins and feet, the face is excessively hot and thirsty, a condition that is governed by the interstitial spaces. Dizziness, coldness, and a feeling of fainting, along with pain in the arms, lead to agitation, flushed face, and weeping, which are controlled by the axilla. Pain in the lower back and spine, difficulty in bending or straightening, inability to breathe lying back, heaviness in the feet, inability to raise the buttocks, red urination, numbness from the waist down to the feet, leading to an inability to sit up, is governed by the bladder region. Persistent lower back pain with an inability to bend or straighten, numbness from the waist down to the feet, coldness in the lower back, is associated with the second lumbar region. Begin by addressing the missing pelvic area, followed by the tailbone and the eight crests. Inability to lift due to back pain, pain behind the heel and ankle, weakness in the feet, is managed by the back middle point. Qi stagnation leading to urinary issues and urgency, with pain in the groin area, is addressed at the intersection. A feeling of fullness in the chest that resembles distension, and actual blockage leading to swollen armpits, as well as weakness leading to involuntary urination, with anxious feet and painful muscles, causing inability to urinate or defecate, along with back pain radiating to the abdomen and difficulty bending or straightening, is governed by the perineum. In febrile diseases, initial symptoms in the arms with spasms, gathering of sweat on the lips and mouth, open nostrils and lowered eyes, with sweating profusely like pearls, hardness below the breasts two inches, fullness and palpitation in the sides, are managed by the channel at the wrist.[369p]

　　振寒瘈瘲，手不伸，咳嗽唾浊，气膈善呕，鼓颔不得汗，烦满，因为瘲衄，尺泽主之。左窒刺右，右窒刺左。　　振寒，小指不用寒热，汗不出，头痛，喉痹舌卷，小指之间热，口中热，烦心心痛，臂内廉及胁痛，聋咳瘈瘲，口干，头痛不可顾，少泽主之。　　振寒，寒热，肩臑臂痛，头不可顾，烦满身热，恶寒，目赤痛，眦烂生翳膜，暴痛，鼽衄，发聋，臂重痛，肘挛，痂疥，胸中引臑，泣出而惊，颈项强，身寒头不可以顾，后溪主之。　　振寒，热颈项肿，实则肘挛头项痛狂易，虚则生疣，小者痂疥，支正主之。　　气喘，热病衄不止，烦心善悲，腹胀逆息，热气，足胫中寒不得卧，气满胸中，热暴泄，仰息，足下寒，中闷，呕吐，不欲食饮，隐白主之。　　热痛烦心，足寒清，多汗，先取然谷，后取太溪、大指间动脉，皆先补之。　　手足寒至节，喘息者，死。[370p]

Shivering with cold, unable to extend the hands, coughing with phlegm, a feeling of nausea in the chest, unable to sweat from the temples, feeling irritated and full-bodied. Due to the cough and bleeding, the hour of the wrist governs this. The left side punctures the right, and the right side punctures the left.

Shivering with cold, the little finger does not respond to heat and cold, no sweating, headaches, sore throat, curled tongue, heat between the little fingers, heat in the mouth, troubled heart and chest pain, pain in the inside of the arms and sides, deafness, coughing, and shivering. Dry mouth, severe headaches that cannot be ignored, the lesser seal governs this.

Shivering with cold, alternating between cold and heat, pain in the shoulders and arms, unable to regard the head, feeling irritated and hot all over, aversion to cold, red and painful eyes, tearing and membrane growing in the corners of the eyes, acute pain, sneezing, deafness, heavy arm pain, elbow cramps, scabs and lesions, sensation of pulling in the chest towards the shoulder, weeping out in shock, stiff neck, cold body and head that cannot be regarded, the rear stream governs this.

Shivering with cold, hot swollen neck, if strong, elbow cramps and head pain are severe, if weak, warts will develop, and smaller scabs and lesions arise. The main regulating point is the upright position.

Wheezing, continuous bleeding due to heat illness, troubled heart with sadness, abdominal bloating and reversed breath, heated internal air, legs and shins so cold one cannot lay down, fullness in the chest, hot explosive discharge, breathing upwards, cold beneath the feet, chest heaviness leading to nausea, no desire for food or drink, the hidden white governs this.

Heat pain and troubled heart, cold feet and clearness, excessive sweating, first take the quinoa grain, then the great stream and the artery between the big toe. All should be nourished first.

If the hands and feet are cold to the joints, with wheezing, it leads to death.[370p]

　　手足清，烦热，汗不出，手肢转筋，头痛如锥刺之状，热不可以动，动益烦心，喉痹，舌卷干，臂内廉不可及头，耳聋鸣，窍阴皆主之。　　膝外廉痛，热病汗不出，目外眦赤痛，头眩，两颔痛，寒逆泣出，耳鸣聋，多汗，目痒，胸中痛，不可反侧，痛无常处，侠溪主之。　　目视不明，振寒，目翳，瞳子不见，腰两胁痛，脚酸转筋，丘墟主之。　　头重鼻衄及瘈瘲，汗不出，烦心，足下热，不欲近衣，项痛目翳，鼻及小便皆不利，至阴主之。[371p]

When the hands and feet are clear but hot and there is no sweating, the limbs cramp, and there is a headache that feels like being pierced by a needle. Movement exacerbates the agitation, with throat discomfort, a dry and rolled-up tongue, and an inability to reach the inner arm with the head. There is deafness and ringing in the ears, all governed by the lower orifices.

When the outer knee is painful, there is a fever with no sweating, redness and pain in the outer corners of the eyes, dizziness, pain in the jaws, cold reversals leading to tears, ringing and deafness in the ears, excessive sweating, itchy eyes, and chest pain that prevents turning sides—this is governed by the foot rivers.

When vision is unclear, chilly tremors occur, there is a film over the eyes, the pupils are not visible, there is pain in the waist and flanks, and the feet ache and cramp—this is governed by the hill abyss.

When there is heaviness in the head, nosebleeds, and convulsions, with no sweating, restlessness, heat beneath the feet, a disinclination to approach clothing, neck pain, and a film over the eyes, while nasal and urination difficulties occur—these are governed by the extreme yin.[371p]

　　鼽衄腰脊，脚腨酸重，战栗不能久立，腨如裂，脚跟急痛，足挛引少腹痛，喉咽痛，大便难，(月真)胀，承山主之。　　四厥手足闷者，使人久持之，厥热胫痛，内庭主之。痉惊互引，脚如结，腨如裂，束骨主之。　　痉脊项强，眩运，脚如结腨如裂，昆仑主之。　　风痹注病不可已者，足如履冰，时如入汤中，肢胫淫泺，烦心头痛，时呕时闷，眩已汗出，久则目眩，悲以喜怒，短气不乐，不出三年死。　　足痹不可举，侧而取之，在枢阖中。以员利针，大针不可。膝中痛，取犊鼻以员利针。针发而间之。针大如牦，刺膝无疑。　　足不仁，刺风府。[372p]

Pain in the lower back and spine, heaviness and soreness in the legs, trembling and unable to stand for long, a sensation of cracking in the legs, acute pain in the heels, colicky pain in the lower abdomen, throat pain, difficulty with bowel movements, and bloating—this is governed by the point Chengshan.

If there is numbness and heaviness in the hands and feet persisting for a long time, with heat and pain in the shins, this is governed by the point Neiting.

For convulsive shocks, with a sensation of tightening in the legs and cracking in the joints, the point Shugu is indicated.

If there is stiff neck and back, dizziness, and the legs feeling constricted while the joints feel cracked, this is governed by the point Kunlun.

For the persistent pain of wind-dampness, if the feet feel like walking on ice and then suddenly entering hot water, with limbs feeling heavy and a throbbing headache, nausea, and boredom alternating, dizziness accompanied by sweating, prolonged cases leading to vision disturbance, emotional fluctuations, shortness of breath, and a lack of joy could result in death within three years.

If the feet are too painful to be raised, one should lie to the side to access the point in the joint area. Use a round needle; a large needle is not appropriate. For knee pain, use the needle at the point Dubi with a round needle. When the needle is inserted, it should be intermittently applied.

For numbness in the feet, needle the Fengfu point.[372p]

　　腰以下至足清不仁，不可以坐起，尻不举，腰俞主之。　　足下热，痛不能久坐，湿痹不能行，三阴交主之。　　膝外廉痛不可屈伸，胫痹不仁，阳关主之。　　髀枢中痛不可举，以毫针寒而留之，以月生死为痏数，立已。长针亦可。　　偏枯，四肢不用，善惊，大巨主之。　　手臂不得上头，尺泽主之。[373p]

From the waist down to the feet, there is lack of sensation, making it impossible to sit or stand; the lumbar region governs this. If there is heat in the feet, causing pain that prevents prolonged sitting, or if there is dampness obstructing movement, the point San Yin Jiao governs this. If there is pain on the outer side of the knees that inhibits bending or stretching, or if there is numbness in the shins, the point Yang Guan governs this. Pain in the hip joint that prevents raising the leg can be treated with a fine needle by inserting it cold and leaving it in place, following the lunar cycle for treatment periods. A longer needle can also be used. For unilateral weakness and immobility in the limbs, along with frequent alarming sensations, the point Da Ju governs this. If the arms cannot be lifted above the head, the point Chi Ze governs this.[373p]

　　两手挛不收伸，及腋偏枯不仁，手瘈偏小筋急，大陵主之。　　足不收，痛不可以行，天泉主之。
　　足下缓失履，冲阳主之。
　　手及肾挛，神门主之。
　　痱痿臂腕不用，唇吻不收，合谷主之。　　肘痛不能自带衣起，头眩颔痛，面黑，风肩背痛不可顾，关冲主之。　　嗌外肿，肘臂痛，五指瘈，不可屈伸，头眩，颔额颅痛，中渚主之。　　偏枯臂腕发痛，肘屈不得伸手，又风头痛涕出，肩臂颈痛，项急烦满，惊，五指掣不可屈伸，战怵，腕骨主之。　　风眩惊，手腕痛，泄风，汗出至腰，阳谷主之。　　风逆暴，四肢肿，湿则唏然寒，饥则烦心，饱则眩，大都主之。　　风逆四肢肿，复溜主之。[374p]

　　痿厥风头重頞痛，枢股腨外廉骨痛，瘈瘲痹不仁，振寒，时有热，四肢不举，趺阳主之。　　腰痛，颈项痛，历节，汗出而步履寒复不仁，腨中痛，飞阳主之。　　肩中热，指臂痛，肩髃主之。
　　肩重不举，臂痛，肩髎主之。
　　肩重，肘臂痛不可举，天宗主之。
　　肘痛，尺泽主之。
　　肩肘中痛难屈伸，手不可举，腕重急，曲池主之。　　肩肘节酸重，臂痛不可屈伸，肘髎主之。　　肘中濯濯，臂内廉痛不可及头，外关主之。　　肘痛引肩，不可屈伸，振寒热，颈项肩背痛，臂痿痹不仁，天井主之。　　肘臂腕中痛，颈肿不可以顾，头项急，痛眩淫泺，肩胛小指痛，前谷主之。　　肩痛不可自带衣，臂腕外侧痛不举，阳谷主之。　　臂不可举，头项痛，咽肿不可咽，前谷主之。　　肩痛欲折，臑如拔，手不能自上下，养老主之。　　嗜卧，四肢不欲动摇，身体黄，灸手五里。[375p]

Weakness and numbness in the limbs, severe headaches, pain in the hip and outer thigh, with varying sensations of cold and occasional heat, and inability to lift the limbs—controlled by the Zu Yang point.

左取右，右取左。　　女子手脚拘挛，腹满疝，月水不通，乳余疾，绝子阴痒，阴交主之。　　妇人阴挺出，四肢淫泺，身闷，照海主之。　　膝内廉痛引膑，不可屈伸，连腹引咽喉痛，膝关主之。　　痹胫重，足跗不收，跟痛，巨虚下廉主之。　　胫痛，足缓失履，湿痹，足下热，不能久立，条口主之。　　胫苦痹，膝不能屈伸，不可以行，梁丘主之。　　膝寒痹不仁，不可屈伸，髀关主之。　　髀痹引膝股，外廉痛不仁，筋急，阳陵泉主之。　　寒从足小指起，脉痹上下带，胸胁痛无常处，至阴主之。[376p]

Left takes right, right takes left. Women with hands and feet cramped, abdominal fullness and hernias, menstrual flow blocked, excess milk illness, infertility with itching in the genitals, these are governed by the Yin Jiao point.

　　足大指搏伤，下车挃地，通背，指端伤为筋痹，解溪主之。　　热病烦心，心闷而汗不出，掌中热，心痛，身热如火，浸淫烦满，舌本痛，中冲主之。　　热病刺然谷。足先寒，上至膝，乃出针。　　厥，四逆，喘气满风，身汗出而清，髋髀中痛，不可得行，足外皮痛，临泣主之。　　身懈寒，少气，热甚，恶人，心惕惕然，取飞扬及绝骨、跗下临泣，立已。淫泺胫酸，热病汗不出，皆主之。[377p]

The big toe is injured; when getting off the carriage, it strikes the ground, affecting the back. If the fingertip is injured, it leads to muscle stiffness, treated by "Jiexi."

For a febrile illness causing restlessness, with a feeling of oppression in the heart and absence of sweating, heat in the palms, chest pain, and the body feeling like fire, accompanied by oppressive dampness and pain at the root of the tongue, "Zhongchong" is the treatment.

For a febrile illness manifesting as a burning sensation in the throat, if the feet are initially cold and the needles are only inserted up to the knee.

In case of syncope, extreme coldness, shortness of breath, sweating that is clear, pain in the hip joints, difficulty in walking, and pain in the outer skin of the foot, "Linqi" is the treatment.

If the body feels cold, is weak, with extreme heat, and a dislike of people, accompanied by a feeling of anxiety, needles should be taken at "Feiyang" and "Juegu," as well as at the lower ankle "Linqi" for immediate relief. If there is stiffness in the legs and a febrile illness with absence of sweating, all these points are to be treated.[377p]

　　寒濯濯，舌烦，手臂不仁，唾沫唇干，引饮，手腕挛，指肢痛，肺胀上气，耳中生风，咳喘逆痹，臂痛呕吐，饮食不下膨膨然，少商主之。　　《千金方》曰：掖门主手臂病。巨阙主手清。肩贞主手麻木不举。阴交主手脚拘挛。少商主手不仁。列缺主手臂身热。大陵主手挛不伸，又云主手掣小偏。内关主手中风热。间使主手痛。曲泽主手背逆气。中冲、劳宫、少冲、大泉、经渠、列缺，主手掌热，肘中痛。前腋主臂里挛急，手不上举。尺泽主掣痛，手不可伸。神门、少海主手臂挛。养老主手不得上下。内庭主四厥手足闷。腕骨、中渚主五指掣不可屈伸。曲池主手不可举重，腕急肘中痛，难屈伸；又云主手不举。阳溪主臂腕外侧痛不举。[378p]

Cold and clammy, a troubled tongue, numbness in the arms, dry lips and saliva, thirst leading to drinking, wrist cramps, painful fingers and limbs, lung swelling and breathlessness, wind in the ears, coughing and wheezing with obstruction, arm pain and vomiting, inability to eat, a bloated feeling, primarily associated with the Lesser Shang point. The "Thousand Gold Prescriptions" states: the Ye Men point governs arm ailments. The Ju Que point governs hand conditions. The Jian Zhen point governs numbness and inability to raise the hands. 心俞、肝俞主筋急，手相引。尺泽、关冲、外关、窍阴，主臂不及头。前谷、后溪、阳溪，主臂重痛肘孪。臑会、支沟、曲池、腕骨、肘髎，主肘节痹，臂酸重，腋急痛，肘难屈伸。中(月吕)俞、譩嘻主腋挛。腕骨、前谷、曲池、阳谷，主臂腕急，腕外侧痛，脱如拔。天井、外关、曲池，主臂痿不伸。大泉、经渠主臂内廉痛。巨骨、前谷主内不举。肩髎、天宗、阳谷，主臂痛。曲池、关冲、三里、中渚、阳谷、尺泽，主肘痛时寒。关冲主肘疼，不能自穿衣。鱼际、灵道主肘挛柱满。大陵主肘挛腋肿。[379p]

The points Xinshu and Ganshu govern tightness in the tendons, providing mutual guidance. The points Chize, Guanchong, Waiguan, and Qiaoyin govern conditions where the arm does not reach the head. 间使主肘内廉痛。地五会、阳辅、申脉、委阳、天池、临泣，主腋下肿。天宗主肩重臂痛。肩外腧主肩甲痛而寒至肘。腕骨主肩臂痛。阳关主膝外廉痛，不可屈伸，胫痹不仁。昆仑主脚如结，踝如裂。阴陵泉主足痹痛。京骨、承山、承筋、商丘，主脚挛。承山、承筋主脚胫酸，脚急跟痛，脚筋急痛兢兢。浮白主足缓不收。天柱、行间主足不任身。行间主厥足中热。然谷主足不能安，胫酸不能久立。中都主足下热，胫寒不能久立，湿痹不能行。冲阳、三里、仆参、飞扬、复溜、完骨，主足痿失履不收。仆参主足跟中踝后痛。[380p]

飞扬主腨中痛。复溜主胫寒不能自温，又主脚后廉急不可前，足跗痛。京骨、然谷、肾俞，主足痛。太溪、次髎、膀胱腧，主足清不仁。太溪主手足寒至节。地仓、太泉主足痿躃不能行。光明主痿躄，坐不能起。风府、腰俞主足不仁。条口、三里、承山、承筋，主足下热，不能久立。丘墟主腕不收，坐不得起，髀枢脚痛。阳辅、阳交、阳陵泉，主髀枢膝骨痹不仁。环跳、束骨、交信、阴交、阴舍，主髀枢中痛不可举。临泣、三阴交，主髀中痛不得行，足外皮痛。申脉、隐白、行间，主胫中寒热。[381p]

The ascending pain in the dominant area is caused by Wind. The recurrent chill in the shins cannot warm itself, and it is also associated with urgent pain in the back of the foot, leading to pain in the ankle. Guang Ming is involved with muscular atrophy, leading to an inability to rise from a seated position. Feng Fu and Yao Shu are associated with numbness in the feet. Tiao Kou, San Li, Cheng Shan, and Cheng Jin relate to heat in the lower foot, making it difficult to stand for long. Yang Fu, Yang Jiao, and Yang Ling Quan are related to numbness and stiffness in the hip and knee joints. Huan Tiao, Shu Gu, Jiao Xin, Yin Jiao, and Yin She are associated with central pain in the hip joint, making it hard to lift. Lin Qi and San Yin Jiao connect with pain in the hip area that prevents walking and pain in the outer skin of the foot. Shen Mai, Yin Bai, and Xing Jian relate to cold and heat in the shins.[381p]

太冲、涌泉主胫酸。趺阳主腨外廉骨痛。至阴主风寒从足小指起，脉痹上下。至阳主胫疼，四肢重，少气难言。厉兑、条口、三阴交，主胫寒不得卧。内庭、环眺主肢痛不可屈伸。阳间、环跳、承筋，主胫痹不仁。涌泉、然谷，主五趾尽痛，足不践地。风市主两膝孪，痛引胁，拘急亸躄，或青或焦，或枯或黧如腐木。太冲主膝内踝前痛。梁丘、曲泉、阳关，主筋挛膝不得屈伸，不可以行。犊鼻主膝中痛不仁。犊鼻主膝不仁难跪。中封主少气，身重湿膝踵，内踝前痛。解溪、条口、丘墟、太白，主膝股肿胻酸转筋。合阳主膝股重。[382p]

Tai Chong and Yong Quan govern soreness in the shins. Fu Yang governs pain in the outer knee. Zhi Yin governs wind and cold that starts from the little toe, causing numbness in the pulse above and below. Zhi Yang governs aching in the shins, heaviness in the limbs, and difficulty in speaking due to shortness of breath. Li Dui, Tiao Kou, and San Yin Jiao govern cold in the shins that prevents one from lying down. Nei Ting and Huan Tiao govern pain in the limbs that cannot be flexed or extended. Yang Jian, Huan Tiao, and Cheng Jin govern numbness in the shins. Yong Quan and Ran Gu govern pain in all five toes, making it impossible to step on the ground.
